detailedDescription:
This lovely 4 bedroom home has a sunny west-facing garden and a perfect blend of airy open-plan ground floor living space, together with 4 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms over the upper floors. Located on the edge of the popular Groves area and within only a short walk of New Malden’s bustling High Street and train station. This ideal family home is beautifully presented throughout.
EPC Rating D

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a fantastic purchase for a first time buyer or an investor, as the location to New Malden’s busy train station and High Street are second to none. Holly Mansions was built in 2006 and has been very popular with many styles of buyers.

A luxury two double bedroom, two bathroom leasehold apartment located on the ground floor of Holly Mansions, a purpose built block from Vanfame Developments.

The apartment is very well presented throughout and finished to an exceptionally high standard, with laminate floors, granite kitchen worktops and purpose-made solid ash internal doors. All rooms within the apartment enjoy good proportions. There is a choice of either a bathroom or shower room for bathing and the two double bedrooms are located to the rear of the apartment both overlooking and one with direct access to the private patio and the attractive communal gardens beyond, laid to lawn and with mature trees and shrubs. The property also benefits from an allocated parking place located to the front of Holly Mansions. The amenities of New Malden are close-by and the bus and train links at New Malden British Rail station are within easy walking distance.

Disclaimer

All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Peacefully set on the desirable Woodlands Road this stunning 6 bedroom detached family home is presented in excellent condition with two kitchens, a large conservatory, a lovely garden and an in-out driveway.

Woodlands Road is within easy reach of the good selection of amenities in nearby Surbiton, with a more extensive range of fashionable shops, bars, restaurants and cafes in Kingston. The A3 and Surbiton train station are close by for links into the city.

title: 6 bed detached house for sale

address: Richmond Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
An exceptionally well presented two double bedroom apartment within a converted Edwardian house in North Kingston and accompanied with off street parking.

Having undergone a full refurbishment in recent years, the property is excellently proportioned with good storage and high ceilings. It comprises two double bedrooms, each with fitted wardrobes as well as a modern bathroom and a large reception/dining room with open plan kitchen complete with a range of integrated appliances.

The property is located on Richmond Road in North Kingston and within easy reach of the River Thames, providing the option for beautiful strolls through Canbury Gardens into Kingston town centre or towards Richmond.

It falls within the catchment for a number of incredibly well-regarded local state and independent schools, whilst other amenities such as Albany Park Canoe & sailing Centre and Canbury Gardens Tennis Centre are close by.

Kingston's Zone 6 railway station provides a frequent service into London terminals offering up to nine trains an hour in two directions and is just 0.6 miles (12 minute walk) from the property.

Regular bus links into Kingston and Richmond offer alternative transport links also.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Canbury Park Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A very well presented three bedroom Victorian family house
with south facing garden and significant scope to extend
both on the ground floor to the rear and into the loft.

The ground floor comprises an entry hall with large double
reception/dining room with feature bay window. A generous
separate ktichen is also provided. The first floor offers three bedrooms, the largest of which spans the width of the house, as well as a bathroom, whilst a second four-piece bathroom can be found on the ground floor as well. The property offers ample potential to extend to the rear on the ground floor and into the loft (subject to the necessary permissions). Externally, the property opens out onto a wellmaintained, south facing rear garden.

The house is located on Canbury Park Road and within just
0.3 miles (7 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 railway
station offering up to 7 trains an hour, in two directions, to
London terminals. Alternatively, Norbitons’ Zone 5 railway station is just 0.5 miles (10 minute walk) in the opposite direction. Furthermore, all that the town centre has to offer is on your doorstep including the River Thames and Canbury
Gardens. The property also falls within the catchment for
very well-regarded local schools.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This 4-bedroom semi-detached family home is situated a stone’s throw from Beverley Park in a most desirable area of New Malden and within the catchment of Burlington Infant and Junior School.

The house is an ideal family home with 4 bedrooms over two floors, with the master in the attic space having an en-suite bathroom with additional shower cubicle.

Centrally heated and double glazed the ground floor has two reception rooms with the rear giving the option to knock through to the kitchen if required.

There is direct access from the dining room to the garden accessing onto a large sun patio. Facing southerly an ideal area for entertaining and alfresco dining. Steps take you down to the lawn area and raided shrub borders. So, whilst being elevated this garden cleverly has no gradient.

Egmont Road is a sought-after location with houses often selling within the early stages of marketing. The High Street and Mainline Station are all within walking distance as are additional public spaces. Overall, this is a delightful residential area offering varying styles of property for all and whoever choses to make this house there home will be most fortunate.

EPC rating: D Council Tax Band: E

About Kingston East

This is more than an address. It’s a destination!

Located on the popular Kingston Road, Kingston East is an exciting new development of studios, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 2 and 3 bedroom duplexes that will enhance this part of Londonsexisting village feel with public and private open green spaces.

New Malden is just a short walk away. Here, you have everything you need;shopping, supermarkets, places to eat and beautiful open spaces, including ManorPark and Berrylands Nature Reserve.

With an impressive public space to people ratio, Kingston tops the list as the bestLondon boroughfor most outdoor space. With 183 parks, gardens, recreation grounds and nature reserves, there is an outdoor space for every 970 people, making Kingston the onlyLondon boroughwith one park per thousand residents.*

Of course, being able to come home to green spaces is what makes KingstonEast even more attractive. Close to the developments entrance is an open publicarea that has been designed to allow plenty of direct sunlight in, ensuring a warmwelcome for those who want to take advantage of the space.

There is also a residents landscaped podium courtyard at the heart of the development, offering a generously-sized space for residents to relax in.

Under a mile to New Malden Town Centre

24 minutes to London Waterloo

address: Uxbridge Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription: An outstanding one bedroom upper ground floor conversion apartment with a stunning conservatory which opens to the lovely communal gardens. Located on one of the highly regarded river roads within walking distance of Surbiton mainline station, Kingston town centre with the Thames at the end of the road. The many benefits include a stunning living room with tall grand ceilings, ample sitting and dining space and French doors opening to the conservatory. The newly refurbished conservatory is spacious and light (used as a bedroom) with shutters, 'velux' windows and French doors to the gardens. There is a small separate kitchen. A double bedroom and a period style white and stone bathroom with a free-standing roll top bath and a shower above. Gas central heating. A secluded, enclosed mature communal garden with tranquil seating areas. Sold with a Share of the Freehold and a lease in excess of 900 years.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful Victorian detached family home has potential to extend, subject to planning permission. There are three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a large garden with a studio/office and off-street parking.

Tolworth Road has easy access to the A3 and is just over a mile away from both Tolworth and Surbiton town centres, offering their high streets and train stations.

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription: An exquisitely refurbished, brilliantly presented two bedroom lower ground floor apartment with separate entrance and private patio garden. Located within the leafy Oak Hill area, a short walk from the Surbiton mainline station and high street. The many benefits include a lovely living room entered from the French doors which open to the garden, there is ample sitting and dining space, an ornate fireplace, and polished wooden floors which stretch through the accommodation. The stylish semi open plan kitchen is a contemporary shaker style with oak surfaces and integrated appliances. An inner hallway with storage leads to two good size bedrooms and a sumptuous white, stone and tiled bathroom with a shower over a handmade Japanese deep soaking bath. Double glazed windows, gas combination boiler supplemented with electric radiators. The secluded private garden is a tranquil outside space complimenting this lovely home. Parking on a first come first serve basis plus bike storage. Sold with a Share of the Freehold and a lease in excess of 900 years.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Positioned in this sought-after commutable location moments away from both New Malden and Motspur Park railway stations, utilising its frequent service to London Waterloo. This five-bedroom family home is arranged over three floors. Key areas within this lovely home have been enhanced and remodelled to provide exceptional, flexible living space.
The accommodation on offer comprises of a large entrance hallway, superb large living room to the front with an attractive bay window. The main heart of the home is an amazing open plan kitchen/dinning/living room that is the main focal point of this family home with direct access out to the rear garden. Further accommodation on the ground floor includes a W/C, utility room and direct access to the integrated garage.
On the first floor you will discover a sizable landing that leads to three double bedrooms, one benefiting form an en-suite shower room. Located off the landing is a modern family bathroom.
On the second floor you will also find access to two further double bedrooms with the master boasting an en-suite bathroom and fitted wardrobes. There is also an abundance of storage in this room, with easy access to both loft/under eaves space and a large storage cupboard.
Externally to the rear is a wonderful garden mainly laid to lawn with some established borders and trees. There is also potential to add a large summer house/garden office at the bottom of the garden. To the front is an attractive brick paved drive offering off road parking for a several cars which leads to the integral garden. Sold with no onward chain.

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Winkworth Surbiton are pleased to officer this spectacular Art Deco, mansion building apartment offering three large double bedrooms.
Crescent Court is a superb block of apartments built in the 1930’s. Situated in a conveniently located just 0.2 of a mile from Surbiton Main line station which offers direct and fast service to London Waterloo. As well as being in the heart of Surbiton town with its abundance of local amenities like Waitrose and green outdoors spaces.

This amazing apartment is situated on the third floor via staircase or lift access. The accommodation on offer is well planned and bright. It comprises of a welcoming entrance hallway with a range of storage cupboards. There is a modern fitted kitchen with a modern range of wall and base units, contrasting hard stonework top and quality integrated appliances. A door from the kitchen provides rear access to the secondary staircase. The open plan living room/dining room is the main focal point of this lovely home and boosted by some attractive period features such as the attractive Art Deco fireplace and the direct access to a private balcony, which is ideal for all alfresco dining. The bedroom accommodation on offer includes three generously proportioned rooms with one offering built in wardrobes. The lovely master bedroom also benefiting from a modern on-suite shower room. Located off the hall is a splendid modern family bathroom finished to a high specification. Other benefits of this apartment are intercom entry system, gas central heating, resident parking, attractive communal gardens, and a share of Freehold. Viewings highly recommend.

detailedDescription:
Sapphire Mansions is stunning development of eight new build apartments on Coombe Lane West.

Location

Located at the Kingston end of Coombe Lane West and within 450m of Norbition railway station. Norbiton railway station provides a regular link to London Waterloo (25 mins) with at least four trains an hour at peak times. The centre of Kingston is easily reached via the frequent 57 bus route on Coombe Lane West and is around one mile away. Kingston upon Thames offers an extensive range of shopping with the fabulous Bentalls shopping centre, John Lewis and a Theatre and Cinema Complex. Richmond Park offers around 1500 acres of open space and is one of London's Royal Parks, known for its wild deer and is within one mile. The property is conveniently located for local schools with a number of fee/non fee paying schools within one mile.

Source of distances: Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Description

This magnificent gated development has been designed and finished to a very high standard and contains a mixture of one bedroom, two bedroom and three bedroom apartments.

All of the properties have smart engineered parquet flooring, Haecker German kitchens and beautiful Crosswater bathrooms.

The development has a wonderful communal garden, a 10 years build guarantee and an allocated parking space with each apartment.

- Ground rent = £250 pa
- Estimated service charge = £1,000 pa
- 250 year leases

Situated in this desirable North Kingston location, between Norbiton Railway station and conveniences and Richmond Park with Kingston Town Shopping hub and river scene close by.<br/><br/>Large Roof Terrace (shared)<br/><br/>location<br/><br/>Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities are both within easy reach, as is the A3 trunk road offering fast access to central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 motorway network. Norbiton British Rail station is a few minutes’ walking distance and provides frequent services to Waterloo with its underground links to points throughout the City.

The pedestrian access into Richmond Park which is an area of outstanding beauty provides a picturesque setting in which to picnic, go horse riding, jogging or just take a leisurely walk. Theatres at Richmond and Wimbledon are also popular alternatives to the West End together with an excellent choice of restaurants. There are also numerous schools in the area for all ages in the public, state and international sectors.

detailedDescription:
Sapphire Mansions is a stunning development of just eight new build apartments situated on the edge of the Coombe Estate in Kingston. The properties have all been finished to an incredibly high standard to include engineered parquet flooring, Haecker German kitchens, beautiful Crosswater bathrooms, allocated parking and a 10 year building guarantee.

Number 4 is a two double bedroom, two bathroom first floor apartment featuring an impressive open-plan kitchen/dining/reception room and the added advantage of a private terrace.

The development is ideally located in this sought after Coombeside position between Kingston, New Malden and Wimbledon Village with their extensive range of shops, boutiques and restaurants. address: Church Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
A stunning one bedroom apartment presented beautifully throughout and situated on the ground floor of this modern purpose built development completed in 2013.

As a result the property still benefits from its original NHBC guarantee until 2023 Well-proportioned, it comprises a large reception/dining room, which is in turn open-plan to a horse-shoe shaped and bright kitchen complete with a range of integrated appliances. Access to a private terrace is provided. A large double bedroom with fitted wardrobes is provided along with stylish modern bathroom. Additional features also include an integrated sonos speaker system. Externally, the property opens out onto immaculately maintained communal gardens to the rear.

Marketed as Sophia Court when originally launched in 2013, the development is located on Church Road, which is incredibly quiet and convenient for all of Kingston's amenities. It falls equidistant from both Kingston's Zone 6 and Norbitons's Zone 5 railway station, both of which are within just 0.5 miles (10 minute walk) of the property. Kingston station offers a particularly frequent service, in two directions, to London Waterloo.

Kingston town centre is a short walk from the property with all the usual high street names available, whilst Norbiton's Coombe Road parade of independent shops and restaurants is also nearby.

The River Thames is just the other side of the town centre and offers a varied range of restaurants and bars as well as Canbury Gardens, whilst those looking for even more outside space need not look any further than London's largest Royal park - Richmond Park, accessed via Kingston Gate.

address: Thetford Road, New Malden, Surrey KT3
detailedDescription:
A superb five bedroom Edwardian house with a large south facing garden in a highly desirable road.

Location

The property is located in a great position to access New Malden's bustling High Street where there are numerous cafés, restaurants, retail outlets and supermarkets. At the far end of the High Street is New Malden station with excellent commuter services to Waterloo. There are many schools in the area in both the state and private sectors and the sporting and fitness enthusiast is well catered for.

Description

A superb and well-presented five bedroom period home, successfully combining luxury living with Edwardian charm. As soon as you enter the front door, you are greeted by the wide and welcoming entrance hall complete with period features.

The property has a great entertaining space, including a stunning open-plan kitchen/family room that opens up onto a large, landscaped, southerly-facing garden with a built-in, mains gas BBQ area. The gourmet kitchen not only provides the perfect place to entertain, but also features underfloor heating, marble countertops, high-end appliances, a boiling water tap, an Insinkerator, and air conditioning.

There is a large utility room, complete with a dedicated sink, integrated drying rack, and room for a washer and dryer. At the front of the house is a separate reception room with a fireplace and provides the ideal setting for relaxing after work. There is also a guest cloakroom.

The first floor features three double bedrooms, three well-presented bathrooms (two are en suite) and a fourth bedroom which is ideal for working from home. The principal bedroom features bespoke built-in wardrobes and a recently installed air conditioning unit.

There is another generous double bedroom on the top floor which has fantastic potential to extend, subject to the usual consents.

The garage includes shelving for additional storage. There is off-street parking for several cars on the driveway.

This home has space for the growing family and low running costs due to energy efficiency measures.

The property is chain free.

Come and view this wonderful house, you'll be delighted you did!

Square Footage: 2341 sq ft

address: Beresford Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented and bright Victorian family home has been lovingly maintained and fully modernised to a high specification, whilst having been extended both to the rear on the ground floor and into the loft.

The property benefits from wooden floors throughout, and the ground floor comprises a reception to the front with feature bay windows and an additional large open-plan kitchen/dining room, ideal for families and entertaining, with bi-fold doors spilling out to the garden. Additional features include a downstairs W.C. / Utility Room and underflooring heating throughout.

The first floor offers two generous double bedrooms, both of which span the entire width of the house, as well as a bathroom with additional shower, and a further single bedroom, whilst the second floor provides another two excellently proportioned double bedrooms and shower room.

Externally, the property opens out onto a very well maintained private garden.

Beresford Road is located in North Kingston and one of it's most sought after roads. Nestled conveniently for all the local amenities, it sits within 0.5 miles (10 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 railway station, providing a frequent service in two directions to London terminals. Additionally, Norbiton's Zone 5 railway station is located within the same distance for an alternative connection. A number of choice schools can be found nearby, which is a draw for much of North Kingston in particular. The property falls within the catchment for a number of these. Furthermore, the property is conveniently located for access to Richmond Park's Kingston Gate, the River Thames and Kingston town centre itself, offering an array of stores and restaurants.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase this bright and spacious three bedroom end of terrace house within the prestigious Broom Park riverside development, which boasts exclusive use of stunning landscaped gardens, incorporating a Japanese water garden, which sweeps down to the banks of the River Thames.
As you enter there is an immediate feeling of space and light. The front lounge is exceptionally wide and opens through to a good size dining room, flooding the space with natural light through dual aspect windows to the fore and rear which overlook the beautiful garden. The good size kitchen can be accessed by both the lounge and the dining room and has sliding doors onto the sunny rear garden. The kitchen itself has an array of white cupboards, electric double oven, four ring induction hob, washing machine, dryer, fridge freezer and dishwasher.
The ground floor further benefits from a downstairs W.C. And under stairs storage.
The first floor provides three double bedrooms, all with fitted wardrobes and generous windows. The master to the fore has an en-suite bathroom with a white suite and shower over the bath. The two bedrooms to the rear are served by a family bathroom, complete with a shower over the bath, vanity sink and skylight.
Externally, the sliding doors are dressed with wisteria and lead to a beautiful secluded south-facing garden, tastefully paved with planted borders, a wonderful crockery surrounded pond, timber shed, that all important rear access and a raised patio adorned with a vine covered pergola, giving a perfect setting for al-fresco dining on a warm summer evening overlooking a quiet oasis.
Further benefits include a garage with an electric door.
The beautifully tended communal gardens stretch down to the River Thames, where there is a ramp to make getting kayaks, paddle-boards and boats in and out very easy for those who are keen to make the most of the river.

address: Beresford Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to buy in one of North Kingston's most desirable locations. This yellow brick, four bedroom semi-detached, period family home is located in the sought after North Kingston and is in a particularly quiet location whilst remaining within close proximity to Kingston main line station, town centre, Richmond Park and plethora of local schools.

The property has been transformed and updated throughout to the highest standard. The ground floor comprises of a front reception room with feature fireplace and bay window. The added benefit of access through to the rear or front garden from the main entrance, ideal for families with prams, bikes and/or pets. Storage space has been utilised under the stairs offering ample space for shoes, coats and other day to day appliances. From here the property boasts a beautifully finished and well thought out kitchen and separate dining space. The bespoke kitchen space offers everything a modern family needs, including integrated appliances. From here either the dining/living space or the garden can be accessed via the side door or French double doors. The garden itself is larger than average for North Kingston; a decked area directly off of the double doors for seamless transition for outdoor dining, ideal for summer BBQs. A low maintenance artificial lawn, perfect for children to play on, with a fully kitted out Dunster House summer house, with electricity, currently being used as an office.

On the first floor there are two double bedrooms and a spacious family bathroom with bath and shower finished to an incredibly high standard. The second and final floor offers two large double bedrooms with another well finished bathroom which is en-suite to one of the rooms. Beaming with light throughout, this family home is warm and welcoming with that special feeling as soon as you walk through the door! The property further benefits from off-street parking for one car.

Viewing by appointment only and an absolute must see!

address: Lower Teddington Road, Hampton Wick, Surrey KT1
detailedDescription:
An enchanting two storey Victorian boathouse

Location

The Elms Boathouse forms part of this prime conservation area within just a few hundred metres of Hampton Wick mainline station, providing a direct train service into London Waterloo.

Hampton Wick also offers a quaint array of local shops for day to day requirements whilst just over Kingston Bridge (within approximately half a mile) the more extensive shopping amenities are available with many of the major retail outlets evident.

Local schools, both private and state, enjoy an excellent reputation, as do the many and varied local sport clubs, including the much acclaimed Lensbury.

The commuter is further served by access onto the A308 (within approximately three quarters of a mile) which in turn adjoins the A3, thereby providing access into central London and the City. The A316 is also within easy reach and adjoins the M3 at Sunbury or Central London in the other direction, via the A4. The M3 in turn adjoins the M25 Motorway, connecting Gatwick and Heathrow international airports.

Description

Perched on a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames The Elms Boathouse is an enchanting Victorian boathouse that is approached via a long gated driveway in between 32 and 34 Lower Teddington Road.

The property has been sympathetically and creatively extended by our clients to provide charming riverside accommodation over two levels with 1050 square feet of accommodation and 410 square feet of boathouse.

Square Footage: 1050 sq ft

address: Rushlight Mews, Leatherhead Road, Malden Rushett KT9
detailedDescription:
Substantial house set in gated development overlooking fields.

Cairds are delighted to present this impressive modern house, situated in a private gated development backing onto prime Surrey countryside.
Located in the village of Malden Rushett, between Epsom and Oxshott, this substantial home offers buyers over 2,000 square feet of contemporary living space over three floors. Upon entering the ground floor there is a generous hallway which leads firstly to a separate reception room to the front of the property. This is currently utilized as a playroom but would make a perfect living or TV room. To the rear of the property lies one of the key selling point of the property, a huge open plan kitchen/living/dining room. This space offers truly flexible accommodation with a bright modern, fully integrated kitchen and large lantern skylight bring down plenty of natural light. There are bi-fold doors running across the back of the property which provide access out onto the rear garden and patio. The kitchen enjoys a breakfast bar, integrated wine fridge, induction hob, oven, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. Next door there is a large downstairs toilet and a separate utility room ideal for keeping the living space tidy and peaceful.
Upstairs there are three double bedrooms, one of which enjoys en-suite facilities, and the family bathroom. On the second floor there are two double bedrooms including the master, both of which enjoy en-suite bathrooms. A note to buyers - not only is the property presented in excellent condition throughout, the back bedrooms enjoy views over the fields and woods beyond. There is underfloor heating to the ground floor and radiators serve the first and second floors.
Outside there is a large rear garden with an excellent size patio, outdoor lighting and hot tub.
To the front of the property there is parking for 2 cars & 2 visitor bays, exterior lighting and privately controlled gates.

An enclosed porch leads to a wide reception hall which in turn gives access to a double aspect thru lounge (Previously two reception rooms that could easily be divided again.). The kitchen is well proportioned and has a side door to the gardens.
Stairs leading to a large first floor landing take you to the three bedrooms, bathroom, and separate WC.

The very secluded and breath-taking rear garden is divided into sections of lawn with paved area. The mature shrubs, borders and trees give privacy and seclusion. Oxford Crescent is to the southwest of New Malden. Local shops provide convenience and the protected Hogsmill woodland conservation area is within a 5-minute walk.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented 57 ft. X 11 ft. Widebeam canal boat situated on a residential annually renewable mooring at Harts boatyard. The boat provides an open-plan kitchen/reception room with a breakfast bar and modern appliances. The bedroom has built-in cupboards and there is a modern shower room which was refitted in 2019. The vessel benefits from a central heating system, with the added advantage of a wood burner, this was all newly fitted in 2019. Harts Boatyard is set in a truly stunning location nestled between Kingston Upon Thames and Surbiton, and opposite Hampton Court Park. There is an abundance of lovely walks nearby and the views of Home Park are totally unspoilt. It benefits from direct rail access from Surbiton into London Waterloo in under 20 minutes. Surbiton offers a great selection of pubs and restaurants and Kingston town centre is just a 15 minute walk away alongside river Thames, or take a boat and moor up outside John Lewis for easy access to the shops. Harts boatyard itself has an on-site pub with stylish bar and restaurant that offers exclusive riverside dining.

address: Kingston Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
A spacious two double bedroom purpose built flat forming part of A development known as dollary court, over A parade of shops on the kingston road. For the past ten years the property has been an investment property let as A three bedroom flat to students. That part of kingston road is conveniently located midway between kingston and new malden town centres. The property has three main rooms, all of A similar size and A modern 13’7 (4.1M) X 8’4 (2.5M) fully fitted kitchen/diner with built-in oven and hob, which works very well as A communal room. The entrance hall is wide and L-shaped with two useful built-in storage cupboards. The bathroom is double aspect with A modern white suite. The floors are laminate wood effect to the main rooms and hallway, and the kitchen and bathroom have black ceramic tiled floors. The property benefits from gas fired central heating provided by A vaillant combination boiler and the windows are double glazed.

The property is currently let at A rent of £1440PCM on A one-year AST agreement finishing on the 7th August 2021. This is an ideal investment property at A very reasonable price.

General Information

kitchen: Fitted on three sides with beech effect units comprising base units and wall cupboards, two 3 drawer units, black granite effect work surface with inset stainless steel sink with lever mixer tap. Built-in stainless steel gas hob, electric oven and chimney extractor. Plumbing for washing machine and space for fridge/freezer.

Bathroom: Dual aspect, white suite with panel enclosed pressed steel bath, mixer taps and shower attachment, shower rail and curtain, pedestal wash hand basin, mirror above, dual flush W.C., heated towel rail, two double glazed windows.

Lease: 91 years remaining

maintenance/insurance charge: £137.42 per month.

Total floor area of flat: 57m.sq/613sq.ft. EPC: C.

Council Tax Band: C.

address: Clifton Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented and extended four bedroom
Victorian semi-detached house in North Kingston

This beautiful architect-owned and designed semi-detached home is located in a quiet, child-friendly and modern living environment. The build was completed in 2016 to highest specifications. The house has a luxurious appearance, beautiful detailing and style and boasts storage.

Exclusive building materials have been used, resulting in exceptionally high standard throughout. The ground floor comprises a reception to the front with feature bay window with shutters and a wood burning stove. The extension to
the rear allows for an incredible entertaining space with reception and large open plan modern kitchen/dining area. A downstairs W.C. And separate utility room are also provided. There is underfloor heating throughout this floor. The first floor offers two double bedrooms which spans the width of the house, along with large family bathroom with double sinks. There is a separate washing/drying and linen cupboard on this floor. The loft has been converted to include two additional double bedrooms and second spacious family
bathroom.

The property opens out via sliding glass doors onto the back garden with beautiful permanent plants, trees and borders throughout. The decked back area catches the afternoon sun and is perfect for entertaining. Artificial grass makes it low maintenance and tidy all year round. The garden shed has a concrete floor and offers additional storage with permanent shelves. In the front of the house is additional secured access to a covered side storage area for up to 5 bicycles and water hook up. Side access has also been retained for easy routes from the front to rear of the house.

Clifton Road is an exceptionally popular residential street in the heart of North Kingston. Situated within just 0.4 miles (8 minute walk) of Norbiton's Zone 5 railway station it offers convenient access in two directions into London terminals.

Furthermore, if falls within the catchment of Outstanding Ofsted rated schools nearby whilst a number of sought after independent schools are within close proximity.

Access to both the River Thames and Canbury Gardens is great, whilst Richmond Park's Kingston Gate offers the opportunity to enjoy the largest Royal Park in London covering an area of 2,500 acres. From its heights,
uninterrupted views of St Paul's Cathedral can be enjoyed, 12 miles away, whilst the Isabella Plantation offers a 40 acre Victorian woodland garden created in the 1830's and is best known for its evergreen azaleas, which line the ponds and streams. Created by Charles I in the 17th century as a
deer park, it is of national and international importance for wildlife conservation.

Kingston town centre offers a varied and comprehensive choice in shops via the High Street and Clarence Street as well as both Bentalls & John Lewis department stores. Kingston Riverside also offers a number of well known and popular restaurants.

address: High Street, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
This stunning Victorian period house, situated in the heart of Hampton Wick, is offered in excellent decorative order, having been thoughtfully renovated throughout.

There is a spacious double reception room, featuring a beautiful living area with marble fireplace and raised bay window, and a large formal dining area to the rear. This bright and airy room opens into a stunning kitchen/breakfast room with a shaker-style kitchen featuring a large breakfast bar, integrated appliances, plentiful storage and underfloor heating. A glass roof floods light into this excellent, flexible entertaining space.

Upstairs there is a large master bedroom with fully fitted wardrobes and two large windows providing plenty of natural light. There are a further two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is also a large loft space which is ideal for converting into a fourth bedroom and bathroom, subject to planning permission.

To the back of the property is a beautiful landscaped, private, walled garden which has the added benefit of rear access and an outbuilding with power. The property also qualifies for resident and visitor parking.

The High Street in Hampton Wick is the perfect spot with excellent railway links directly accessing London Waterloo and plentiful local amenities. Kingston Bridge and town centre are easily accessible along with The River Thames, Bushy Park and Home Park for beautiful parkland and riverside walks.

Launch Saturday 10th July
An elegant double bay fronted Edwardian detached family home with accommodation approaching 1650 sq ft arranged over two floors. To the rear of the property is an impressive double reception room with patio doors leading out onto a delightfully landscaped westerly aspect rear garden. To the upper floor there are four bedrooms and modern family bathroom. There is also the added bonus of potential to extend into the loft (stnc). Externally there is off street parking to the front and storage to the side.

Located in this premier North Kingston road within close proximity of Richmond Park and moments from Canbury Gardens and the River Thames, St Albans Road is an extremely sought after address. address: Elm Road, North Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
This house only has A small decked area for outdoor space, but....... Its south facing so gets heaps of sunlight and is ideal for outdoor bbq's or entertaining as it has bifold doors opening into the kitchen/dining area, and if you want A big space to play with the children its opposite st lukes recreation grounds so you can run around with your children or dog to your hearts content and you dont even have to cut the grass!.

And...the bedroom layouts are slightly unusual, they having mezzanine (raised floor) areas, which by the way every child that will view the house will absolutly love, but us parents are A little confused over! However.... These mezzanine floors can be very easily removed, its only A suspended floor... And once removed will give 2 super high ceiling bedrooms. The house also has potential to extend by adding A loft extention either A piggy back or A dorma style (STPP as usual) which will then give you either A superb 4 bedroom home with 3 bathrooms or A 5 bedroom house with 2 bathrooms on this prime north kingston school road.

It really is A fabulous home, at A great price and still has plenty of potential to put your mark on it and make it your own, call greenwoods now to book A viewing and see for yourself the beauty of this house.

this is A superb 3 double bedroom, 2 reception room, detached house located on elm road, just 75MTRS from st lukes school and close to A number of the other fabulous kingston schools. Also, just A short walk to kingston train station and town centre.

The house is located on Elm Road one of North Kingston's best residential roads, the property has a small paved front garden, leading to the front door, once inside the ground floor has been fully extended to include the side passageway to maximise available internal space and this space has been transformed into a large, open plan entrance hall, leading to the heart of the house, which is the family living space, with dining area, extra-large kitchen, with free standing appliances and plenty of stainless steel worktop area and storage units, there is a breakfast bar overlooking the patio and bi-fold doors leading to the rear terrace. To the rear of the kitchen is a separate room that can either be used as a home office or utility room and ground floor shower room and WC. Finally, there is also a further and separate, bright, front reception room giving a quiet space from the hubbub of the family area.

The stairs to the first floor have been lengthened and widened to make them child and adult friendly (a nice change to the usual steep staircase of these properties), there are 3 double bedrooms, the oversized master is at the front of the house and has plenty of space for built in wardrobes, there is full sized bathroom with shower over and bedroom 2 has been cleverly configured to give a study area and stairs up to the bed area on the mezzanine deck. The final double is at the rear of the house, with space for a double bed and wardrobe.

This first floor retains the ability to be extended into the loft space using either a piggyback extension or a standard double Dorma extension (stnc) to provide a master ensuite bedroom and make this a large stunning 4-bedroom property.

To the front of the house is a private paved and walled garden with gate, and at the rear there is a wonderful decked private courtyard area, ideal for BBQ's or outdoor entertaining.

The property is neutrally decorated throughout, with wood flooring downstairs and wood/carpet upstairs, the windows are all double glazed and the house has gas central heating.

Location: It is just a 10-minute walk to Kingston Train station with trains to Waterloo taking just 26 minutes or a 15-minute walk to central Kingston with its amazing shops, restaurants and bars or Richmond Park, Kingston Gate is just a 12-minute walk away with its amazing wildlife, walks and bike rides. Importantly for families it is close to some of the amazing North Kingston schools including, St Luke’s, Latchmere, St Agatha’s, Alexandra, Tiffin Girls and Boys, or Kingston Academy to name just a few. It is also conveniently located for the nearby Elm Park with its open green space and playground. By car it is close to the A3 which serves both London & the M25.

detailedDescription:
Exceptional opportunity to purchase this wonderful north kingston three double bedroom, two reception room, family home, with large garage and driveway parking for 1 car and A beautiful rear, southwest facing garden, located on deacon road which is only A 10 minute walk to kingston mainline station. Or town centre with its outstanding shops and restaurants.

The property also has huge potential to extend both into the loft, to make a large master ensuite bedroom or two double bedrooms and to the rear with a ground floor single story rear extension to provide a new open plan kitchen/dining room, and a ground floor utility/wet room and whilst still maintaining a separate front reception room, there is also plenty of scope to build a new studio/garage at the rear of the garden and still maintain a parking space all (STPP).

The property comprises of; side entrance door, leading to a large entrance hall and front reception room, with feature fireplace and bay window. At the rear is a large open plan kitchen and dining room with side kitchen door and double patio doors leading to the beautiful rear garden.

The property is neutrally decorated throughout and has a combination of wood flooring, tiles, and carpets upstairs.

Upstairs there are 3 good sized bedrooms the master bedroom is at the front of the house with built in wardrobes and sink unit, the second bedroom is at the rear overlooking the garden and the third is in the centre of the house. There is a large also a family bathroom with separate shower and bath.

To the rear of the property is a wonderful private garden with mature boarders and shrubs and laid with paving, ideal for outdoor entertaining and at the very rear is a large brick work shed and garage with driveway parking for one car. Being South facing it really captures the sun from midday onwards. To the front of the property is a small private garden with a beautiful selection of natural flowers and shrubs.

Deacon Road is just a short distance from some of the areas very best schools including St Luke’s, Alexandra, and Kingston Academy. It is just a short walk to the local shops in Norbiton or just a 12 walk to Kingston town centre with its fantastic shopping areas, restaurants, or to Kingston train station with trains to waterloo taking just 26 minutes or to Richmond Park, Kingston Gate, with its amazing wildlife, bike, or horse rides.

This is an excellent opportunity to purchase a 3-bedroom semi-detached house with a huge potential to extend (STPP) just a short walk from Kingston town centre and station and next to some excellent North Kingston Schools.

Investors - Gross Yield for Renting

Purchase Price 2 Bed = £369,000

Rental income £1350 pcm therefore over 12 months = £16,200

therefore £369,000 divided by £16,200 = 22.77

We then divide 100% by 22.77 = 4.4% gross yield

address: Aragon Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Open house by appointment only Saturday 3 July 1PM to 3PM - Exceptional opportunity to purchase this outstanding North Kingston 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom, 2 reception room, extended family home, with driveway parking for 2 cars and a beautiful rear, south facing garden, laid with Astro turf and with rear garage and rear access. It is located on Aragon Road just a short walk from Kingston Academy, Fernhill or Tiffin Girls schools, or a 15 minute walk to Kingston mainline station, or town centre with its outstanding shops and restaurants.

Please see our virtual 3d tour of this property.

The property comprises of; off road driveway parking for 2 cars leading to front door and into bright entrance hall, on the right side is a double reception room with living and dining areas that opens up at the rear to the fully integrated, high specification kitchen, with granite worktops, high gloss grey units, fitted with dishwasher, washing machine, fridge, freezer, gas hob and electric oven, there is also a separate utility area, skylights and bifold doors from the dining area, lead to the stunning rear garden. On the left side of the entrance hall is another large front reception room with a rear storage room which could be converted into either a utility room or an ensuite (5th bedroom). Finally on the ground floor is a fully tiled shower room.

On the first floor there are two large double bedrooms, front and rear and the master bedroom with ensuite shower room, all of the bedrooms have built in wardrobes, and there is fully tiled family bathroom with shower over bath.

The loft has been converted into two rooms, a double bedroom facing the rear with heaps of natural light and a separate home office.

The property is beautifully decorated throughout and on the ground floor, has a combination of wood flooring and large porcelain floor tiles, with carpets upstairs. The house has a gas boiler and is fully glazed and has high speed broadband.

The rear garden is accessed via bifold doors at the rear of the dining area, leading out onto a raised deck and then a substantial rear garden, laid mainly with Astro Turf, which is pet and play friendly, ideal for outdoor entertaining or play for young children. It also has mature boarders comprising of bushes, mature foliage and small trees. At the very rear of the garden is a full-sized storage garage and a rear access gate to the rear alleyway, ideal for bringing bicycles or returning from muddy walks.

Aragon Road is only a 5-minute walk from Ham Parade with its wonderful selection of local shops, or 10 minutes to Ham Common and the Thames Riverside Walkway, or to Richmond Park Kingston Gate. However, and most Importantly for families, it is in very close proximity to Kingston Academy, Fernhill Primary or Tiffin Girls, or indeed to Grey Court or Latchmere Primary so is an ideal family location for parents wanting to move their children into the superb North Kingston Schools.

This is an impressive 4-bedroom 3 bathroom, and 3 reception room property that has been beautifully extended and finished to a high specification, and with the benefit of driveway parking. It is just a short walk from Kingston town centre and station and next to some outstanding North Kingston Schools.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Park Road, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT1
detailedDescription:
A charming Georgian house dating back to 1800 directly opposite Bushy Park

Location

The property is enviably located and is within just a few hundred meters of both Bushy Park and the charming shops and village atmosphere of Hampton Wick, where there is also a mainline train station - with a direct service into London Waterloo. Whilst marginally further afield and just the other side of Kingston Bridge one can find the comprehensive network of social, recreational and shopping facilities that Kingston has to offer, including a great selection of riverside restaurants and a John Lewis department store.

Local schools, both private and state, enjoy a truly excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

The 1,100 acres of wonderful deer inhabited spaces of nearby Bushy Park (and the grounds of the world renowned Hampton Court Palace) an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life.

Description

A Georgian family home built between 1832 to 1837 in a delightful, sheltered position only moments from Bushy Park. The property was originally part of Park House which served as a school until 1870 and then divided in 1923. This property is a combination of the original Park House, the coach house and stable block and was transformed in 1999 by the current owners into a single family dwelling.

The accommodation is arranged over two floors only and extends to 4313 square feet. The ground floor has high ceilings throughout and is dominated by a breath taking 40' kitchen/conservatory which opens onto the rear garden. There are two original reception rooms, the larger formerly used as a refectory and school room, both benefit from exceptionally tall windows. Crossing over into the stable side of the building there is a further entrance and staircase, spacious bathroom, utility room and integral double garage which still retains the original herringbone flooring and wood panelling from the days it was used as stables.

The staircase for the main house up to the first floor is dominated by a double height tower giving light, volume and access to a family bathroom and four bedrooms, two of which are double. Accessed via a separate staircase, there are three further bedrooms, a bathroom and a galley kitchen.

The house is well screened by a wide front garden and has delightful mature rear garden of appropriate proportions to the house. In addition to the double garage there is further off street parking for several cars.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Stunning three bedroom semi detached family home on the highly sought after Windsor Avenue with off street parking for two cars and attractive landscaped garden, enviably situated in a quiet and secluded position with green views to both front and rear. The property has been superbly refurbished and beautifully appointed by the current owner, offering light and spacious extended accommodation, finished to a high standard throughout. Features include an inviting front aspect reception, impressive open plan kitchen/diner with bi-folding doors to the garden, modern family bathroom, downstairs WC, gas central heating, double glazing, quality floor coverings and ample inbuilt storage. The property also provides potential for extension into the loft and creation of a further bedroom suite, subject to the necessary planning consents.

Accommodation comprises entrance porch and hallway with guest WC and stairs rising to the first floor, leading into the bright reception room with attractive square bay window and cast iron feature fireplace. To the rear of the property, the beautiful open plan kitchen/diner is flooded with natural light from skylight windows and bi-folding doors opening onto the garden. The kitchen area itself comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and breakfast bar area incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, inbuilt fridge and dishwasher, and further space for appliances. The kitchen/diner also benefits from under-floor heating as well as an over-sized utility cupboard with three full height doors concealing a full size freezer, washing machine and tumble dryer. To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles and a generous single, with range of inbuilt wardrobes to the master - plus a family bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is enviably located in a quiet residential road with views across the kcl/lse playing fields to the front, and local allotments to the rear. Windsor Avenue also boasts easy access to stations at both Berrylands and New Malden with excellent links to Central London and the surrounding area, as well as numerous regular bus routes. Nearby Surbiton and New Malden each offer a wonderful array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants, with Kingston also within easy reach for a greater variety of branded shopping as well as a theatre and cinema. The banks of the River Thames - fantastic for riverside walks and cycling - are also closeby and the area is well served by excellent local schools, and lovely open spaces.

Seller’s Comments

'This property is a lovely, light and airy family home. It's best features include the kitchen diner, which was recently extended to create a bright and spacious living area. This includes bifold doors, allowing a great view into our lovely landscaped garden. The other thing which makes 9 Windsor Avenue special is it's outlook, with views across the kcl/lse playing fields and local allotments to the front and back, respectively.

The property is also in an excellent location, with a park and playground and a lovely nature reserve very close by, as well as the ever popular Woodies pub an easy walk. New Malden high street is also walking distance, with lots of popular restaurants and shops, as well as a leisure centre. It's also less than 10 minutes to Berrylands station and around 20 to New Malden station, with their frequent trains to London, Kingston and Hampton Court. Kingston (and its many shops and restaurants) and the River Thames is also only 30 minutes walk (or 10 minutes by bike). Bushy Park and RIchmond Park are also only a short cycle/drive away. There are numerous state and private schools and nurseries within walking distance.'

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Just over 1600 sq ft is this substantial three double bedroom, semi detached period home. The property has the perfect blend of modern, stylish and practical finishes that compliment the original and endearing period features found throughout the house. The ground floor comprises an entrance hall which immediately leads onto the spacious reception room with wooden floors throughout. From here, access to the downstairs shower room as well as the kitchen dining room is available. Opening into the kitchen diner you are immediately welcomed with bursting light from the garden through the double bay windows and french doors. A stunning feature fireplace with stove draws the attention of the room, whilst dining table and chairs seat six people comfortably. The upstairs boasts three sizeable bedrooms and a separate family bathroom, externally a storage room can be found with access via an external staircase.
This family home further benefits from a breath-taking private rear garden, off street parking and car port. Located just off the popular Groves area of New Malden, ideally located for easy access to the High Street's plethora of shops and amenities, New Malden station with fast and frequent links into Central London. Located close to Berrylands train station and within a short distance to Surbiton centre, this recently refurbished two double bedroom maisonette offers spacious and well presented accommodation throughout.
Positioned on the first floor, the apartment has an L shaped hallway that leads to all rooms within the property. The accommodation comprises a spacious lounge, two double bedrooms, a modern kitchen with integrated oven and gas hob and a new bathroom with shower.

address: St. Albans Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
At the front of the property off the spacious entrance hallway is the first main reception room with high ceilings, original period features such as cornicing and beautiful fireplace as well as a bay window letting in plenty of natural light. Further down the hallway is a second reception room currently being used as a playroom. Behind this room is a useful utility room providing side access into the garden. There is also a downstairs cloakroom and storage cupboards located in the hallway. The back of the property opens up into a bright and spacious contemporary open plan kitchen/dining/reception room with kitchen island, skylights above and sliding doors leading out onto the garden. Upstairs on the first floor is a modern family bathroom with separate walk in shower and bath and four good-sized bedrooms, the main bedroom with walk in wardrobe and en suite shower room.

Outside
The property has a beautifully maintained landscaped 69 ft. Rear garden. Leading out from the sliding doors of the kitchen is a raised patio area perfect for enjoying outdoor dining. A lawn area leads down to a further secluded decked seating area. Additionally, in the garden is a storage shed and a pretty brick built home office.

Situation
St. Albans Road is conveniently located for access to Kingston town centre with its array of shops, restaurants and transport links. Kingston is renowned for excellent schools making the area popular with families. The property is just 0.7 miles from Kingston station which has a frequent service to London Waterloo. The Kingston gate entrance to Richmond Park is only 0.9 miles away and Canbury Gardens and the River Thames are just 0.3 miles away.

detailedDescription:

Full description:
shared ownership (Advertised price represents 25% share. Full market value £510,000). A rare chance to buy a shared-ownership apartment within a beautiful, double-fronted Victorian house. The property, which is on the lower ground floor, features a spacious entrance hall with fitted storage and an open-plan kitchen/reception room with bay window. The main bedroom has an additional, rear-facing, bay window and there are two further double bedrooms and a bathroom with overhead and separate hand-held shower. Internal insulation, timber-framed sash windows with high performance glazing and a modern gas central heating system help bring energy-efficiency up to recent standards. The building has gated grounds including a communal garden and a parking area with a space for this apartment. Alternatively, Surbiton Railway Station, which provides services to a number of destinations including regular trains into Waterloo, is only a short walk away. St. Matthew's Primary School is very close by and Ofsted-rated 'Good' plus there are a number of other well-thought-of schools in the local area.

Tenure: Leasehold (125 years from 2014).
Minimum Share: 25% (£127,500). The housing association will expect that you will purchase the largest share affordable.
Shared Ownership Rent: £556.33 per month (subject to annual review).
Service Charge: £201.95 per month (subject to annual review).
Ground Rent: £300.00 for current year.
Guideline Minimum Income: Dual - £43,000 Single - £48,200 (based on minimum share and 10% deposit).
Council Tax: Band D, Royal (London) Borough of Kingston upon Thames. Priority is given to applicants living and/or working in this local authority.

detailedDescription:
Laurels are delighted to present this four/five bedroom, semi-detached family home that is situated on a highly sought-after residential road in Berrylands. Located within walking distance of both Berrylands & Tolworth Stations (Zones 5), this property offers fantastic links to London and the A3. It is also within close proximity to a number of outstanding local schools and is surrounded by a plethora of shops, leisure facilities and green open spaces.

The ground floor comprises a dual aspect living/dining room, downstairs toilet and contemporary kitchen with integrated appliances. Continuing on there is a separate utility room and office/fifth bedroom that has access via it’s own front door. The first floor boasts four bedrooms, three of which are doubles, a three-piece family bathroom and seperate toilet.

Further benefits include potential to extend (STPP), off-street parking for multiple vehicles, picturesque South-facing garden with patio area, easy access to both Gatwick & Heathrow Airports and ample storage throughout.

Early viewings are highly recommended as not to miss out!

address: Canbury Avenue, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
An extended five bedroom semi-detached Victorian house with off street parking and westerley facing garden located in a very popular street in North Kingston

The ground floor comprises a reception to the front of the house with extended kitchen incorporating a utility roon as well as additional extended reception to the rear.

The first floor offers three generous bedrooms with family bathroom, two of which span the width of the house, whilst the loft has been converted to provide an additional two double bedrooms and second family bathroom.

Externally, the property opens out onto a mature rear garden, whilst off street parking is provided to the front.

Canbury Avenue is located in North Kingston and one of it's most sought after roads. Wider than most in the area and lined with mature trees, it is nestled conveniently for all the local amenities and sits within 0.4 miles (7 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 railway station, providing a frequent service in two directions to London terminals.

A number of choice schools can be found nearby, which is a draw for much of North Kingston in particular. The property falls within the catchment for a number of these.

Furthermore, the property is conveniently located for access to Richmond Park's Kingston Gate, the River Thames and Kingston town centre itself, offering an array of stores and restaurants.

SeOUL Residential is proudly present this newly refurbished four bed semi-detached Victorian house in the heart of New Malden. On the first floor, there are three double bedrooms with light grey coloured carpet, a superb modern family bathroom. The second floor is occupied by the largest bedroom with a large eaves, making perfect use of storage potentially.

The element of light is apparent in this home, with large windows for every spaces. In the rear, there is a large green garden, with a spacious workshop/office at the end of the property. The property has a big front garden potentially change into off-street parking space. No Onward Chain.

detailedDescription:
An attractive detached Victorian villa situated in this prime North Kingston location offering spacious accommodation in excess of 1100sqft and tremendous potential to expand further on the ground floor and into the loft to create a substantial family home likely approaching 2000sqft (Subject to necessary consent). The ground floor provides a spacious double reception room spanning 23 ft with large bay window and feature fireplace and direct access to a sunny 40 ft south facing garden. There is also a fully fitted kitchen to the rear which flows into the dining area reaching an impressive 22 ft, this also has access to the garden via patio doors. The first floor provides three large double bedrooms, generous split level landing, modern family bathroom and a separate toilet. The property is being sold with no onward chain - Viewings are highly recommended!

Shortlands Road is a popular residential street ideally situated in the sought after North Kingston area. The property is conveniently positioned for Richmond Park, the River Thames and Kingston station giving direct access into Waterloo and the A3 which serves both London & the M25. Kingston town centre with its array of shops, restaurants and bars is a short distance away. The standard of schooling in the immediate area is excellent within both the private and state sector.

address: Lancaster Close, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

***3D Virtual Tour Available*** Offered with vacant possession and no upper chain is this spacious two double bedroom, first floor flat located in a purpose-built block in a quiet cul-de-sac. Lancaster Close is ideally situated in North Kingston close to Richmond Park, Ham, Kingston upon Thames with good schools and a variety of shops, transport links and amenities nearby. The property benefits from a share of freehold and a long lease in excess of 900 years and has been lived in and enjoyed by the current owners for over 30 years. The light and airy and well-proportioned accommodation briefly comprises: Communal entrance with stairs to first floor, private entrance hallway with storage cupboard, a good sized reception room with bay window, master double bedroom, a second good sized double bedroom, fitted kitchen with a range of wall and base units incorporating an integrated electric oven with gas hob with extractor hood, integrated fridge/freezer, washing machine and slimline dishwasher, a door leading to stairs to communal gardens and a bathroom/wc with a white three piece suite. The property benefits from gas-fired central heating via a combination boiler and uPVC double glazing. Externally, there are well kept mature communal gardens providing an enjoyable outside space comprising of lawn, flower beds and mature shrubs. The vendor has advised that there is an option for the owner to have a garden shed for storage. On-street parking is available and the service charge is £1800 per year. Viewing comes highly recommended.

address: Somerset Road, Norbiton, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
An attractive three bedroom Victorian semi detached house with accommodation approaching 1200 sq ft arranged over three floors. The property has been extended over the years to create a well balanced layout perfect for family living. The ground floor comprises a stunning front reception room with feature fireplace and bay window, middle dining room with additional feature fireplace which opens onto a modern kitchen with lovely skylight allowing plenty of natural light to enter the room. The first floor offers two double bedrooms and a modern shared bathroom. The second floor provides a stunning master bedroom with en-suite bathroom and a separate study area. Externally there is a private landscaped rear garden. There is also scope to expand on the ground floor (subject to necessary consent).

Somerset Road is a popular residential street ideally situated for Kingston town centre with its extensive range of shops, bars, restaurants and station offering a direct service into Waterloo. The A3 which serves both London and the M25 is a short distance away and the standard of schooling in the immediate area is excellent within both the private and public sectors. A bright and spacious 4 double bedroom semi detached family home ideally located in this ever popular road just moments from excellent bus links, local shops and amenities, A3 and Surbiton mainline station with fast train into London Waterloo. Also within the catchment area for good schools.

This property comprises a good sized reception room to front aspect with feature fireplace, open plan fitted kitchen dining room with original fireplace and with doors onto the rear garden and a ground floor WC.

To the first floor there are two good sized double bedrooms, family bathroom and further double bedroom to rear aspect. The loft space has been converted to create a spacious master bedroom with ample eaves storage and ensuite shower room.

Outside this property benefits from having a private rear garden with side access and studio / workshop to end. To the front there is off street parking.

Kingston and Surbiton's Zone 6 mainline railway stations are within 0.6 miles (13 minute walk) and 0.9 miles (17 minute walk) respectively, whilst the latter offers connections into London terminals in as little as 17 minutes. Queens Promenade and the River Thames are within just 0.4 miles (8 minute walk) offering leisurely walks into and
out of Kingston. Furthermore, it is well situated for access to both Kingston and Surbiton railway stations and falls within the catchment for well-regarded schools.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Chesfield Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A very well presented three bedroom end of terrace house with garage located in a very popular residential street in North Kingston.

The ground floor comprises a double reception/dining room as well as separate modern kitchen, whilst the first floor offers three generously proportioned bedrooms, all with fitted wardrobes as well as stylish family bathroom.

Externally, the property opens out onto a low maintenance rear garden with side access gate and is also provided with a garage.

Chesfield Road is an exceptionally popular residential street in the heart of North Kingston, just off Kings Road. It is located within 0.5 miles (a 10 minute walk) from Canbury Gardens which is nestled along the River Thames, and is the same distance (in the opposite direction) from Richmond Park which covers 25,000 acres of open parkland.

Kingston town centre is also within convenient walking distance, offering a comprehensive choice of large department stores such as John Lewis and Bentalls, together with a wide range of independent boutiques and familiar High Street names in the immediate vicinity.

Kingston Riverside provides a wonderful choice of well-appointed restaurants or just the option of a leisurely stroll along Queens promenade. Kingston's railway station is within 0.5 miles (10 minute walk), offering 5 trains an hour at peak times into London Waterloo in 32 minutes. Bus links also provide alternative connections to Ham & Richmond, Wimbledon & Putney and throughout the rest of London.

The property is also conveniently situated for a number of excellent schools locally, falling within the catchment for many, whilst options such as Tiffin Girls are also highly desirable and nearby..

address: 5 Hardman Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Well presented one bedroom first floor apartment set within a popular development with remote control operated covered parking. Superbly situated in the heart of Kingston within just a short walk of the railway station and an array of shops, bars and restaurants and quietly set back within attractive communal grounds.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage/airing cupboard, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with Juliette style balcony and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, electric hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. Double doors from the reception room open through to a well sized bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe, and there is a stylish shower room with walk-in shower suite and elegant tiling.

The property is enviably located within just a few minutes' walk of the centre of Kingston with it's huge array of shops, bars, cafes, restaurants and leisure facilities, including cinema complex. Kingston station is also within a short walk for excellent rail services into Central London and the surrounding area. Additionally, Richmond Park, Bushy Park and Home Park are close-by, and the banks of the Thames offer a variety of lovely bars and restaurants along the riverfront.

Ideal as a first time or investment purchase, viewings of this lovely property are highly recommended.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 125 years from 25 December 1994 - 98 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is £69.14pcm. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Seller’s Comments

This flat is centrally located in the heart of the town minutes walk from bars, restaurants and shops although it remains set back enough to avoid the noise associated. It also benefits from being minutes walk from both the train and bus station making it extremely well located for commuting. The flat its self is tidy and compact and benefits from a lovely quiet communal garden.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

This is more than an address. It’s a destination!

Located on the popular Kingston Road, Kingston East is an exciting new development of studios, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 2 and 3 bedroom duplexes that will enhance this part of Londonsexisting village feel with public and private open green spaces.

address: Beresford Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
An impressive Victorian semi detached family home extensively refurbished and extended over the years to provide accommodation in excess of 1860 sq ft arranged over three floors. The ground floor features a front reception room, Utility room with WC, side extension providing a gym/office and stunning open plan kitchen/dining/family room with bi-fold doors leading directly onto a south facing rear garden. The upper floors provide four double bedrooms and three bath/shower rooms.

Beresford Road is a particularly sought after residential tree lined road within the popular North Kingston area and ideally positioned between Richmond Park and the River Thames. The property is conveniently positioned for both Norbiton and Kingston stations giving direct access into Waterloo, and the A3 which serves both London & the M25. Kingston town centre with its array of shops and restaurants is a short distance away and the standard of schooling in the immediate area is excellent within both the private and state sectors.

detailedDescription:
Priced to Sell – Beautiful 2 Bed Apartment in Surbiton

A unique opportunity to own this beautiful 2-bedroom apartment in a highly sought-after part of Surbiton. Wonderfully bright, this impressive apartment boasts natural sunlight from all angles, having been renovated and maintained to a high standard. It offers 2 double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes, an open plan granite kitchen/ reception room, a fully tiled bathroom with Grohe walk-in shower, off-street parking and a private entrance.

Burney Avenue is in a picturesque part of Surbiton, recognised for its proximity and a short walk to Surbiton town centre, Surbiton Station and the River Thames. It has fast transport links to Waterloo (15 mins) and Woking (17mins), a low crime rate and safe environment, excellent schools, and a vast array of local shops, bars, restaurants, and amenities. Surbiton has consistently been recognised as a leading area to live in London, providing an enchanting, peaceful and sociable environment, which is enhanced by its fast transport links to major roads, public transport networks and airports.

Being Share of Freehold, this apartment holds strong investment value having the additional benefit of no ground rent or service charges. It is suitable for a couple beginning their life together, a single buyer to live alone or rent out the second bedroom, or as a rental property being close to Kingston University and 25 minutes door to door to Waterloo
