address: Manorgate Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A superb Victorian house which has been carefully extended by the current owners to combine fine period features with light, space and the needs of a modern family. The house has an impressive entrance and an elegant double reception room with a high corniced ceiling, a wide bay window, oak flooring and a marble fireplace fitted with a wood burning stove. This formal reception space is complimented by an amazing Kitchen/Dining/Family Room which is flooded with natural light from two roof lanterns and bifold doors opening onto the terrace and rear garden. The kitchen has been professionally designed and includes a central island unit and breakfast bar, larder store cupboards, a 2 door gas Aga plus a hob and conventional oven/microwave. The adjoining Dining Room will accommodate a refectory style table and chairs plus a settle bench and this room opens up into a Family room creating a fantastic space for entertaining or comfortable family living. The house has a combined cloakroom/wet room/utility room on the ground floor, a very useful and usable cellar and a gated and covered recycling/bin storage area.

There are 4 double bedrooms spread over the two upper floors served by two bathrooms with separate showers plus a useful single 5th Bedroom or Study on the first floor (the house offers plenty of options for those working from home).

The property has a 76' long South facing garden which has been beautifully landscaped and includes a shaped lawn with mature borders well stocked to provide colour and cover. Specimen trees and shrubs include a grape vine, a fig tree, an apricot and a pear tree around which has been built a tree house which will make children the envy of their friends. A paved stone terrace providing the perfect setting for outdoor entertaining adjoins the rear of the house and pathway leads past the lawn to the rear of the garden and a timber deck and pergola. At the rear of the garden, and something of a rarity for a period house of this type in Kingston, is a double garage with a remotely controlled garage door.

Manorgate Road is residential road which has been designated a Home Zone with mature planting put in place, along with other traffic calming measures, to reduce the dominance of cars and to prioritise the needs of pedestrians, cyclists and children. There is a well-supported Residents Association and a real sense of community which has grown even stronger over the last 18 months as more people have spent more time at home. The house is within walking distance of local shops, cafes and restaurants and the green open space of Richmond Park - attributes which have become increasingly important in recent times. The area is highly regarded for the quality of its schooling, in both the private and state sectors, and for its communication links. For those people travelling into central London the nearby Norbiton Rail Station (Zone 5) offers an easy commute into London Waterloo (from 29 minutes at peak times) whilst the A3 provides fast access to London's airports at Gatwick and Heathrow and the rest of the motorway network. The riverside town of Kingston upon Thames offers an excellent range of shops and other local amenities including branches of John Lewis and Waitrose, the Bentalls shopping centre and both a cinema and theatre.

The property is offered for sale with the benefit of no onward chain of related purchases.

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This characterful two-bedroom apartment in Shelley Court forms part of the Grade ii-listed Parkleys Estate, built by renowned development architects Span in the 1950s. Parkleys was the first development by Span co-founders Eric Lyons and Geoff Townsend and is one of London’s finest residential modernist estates. It is set among beautiful communal gardens planted with flowering trees, and expansive stretches of lawn that are much loved by residents. The estate is located in leafy Ham, a pretty suburb with a lovely high street, which sits between Richmond Park and the River Thames in south London.

The Architect

Span are perhaps the most celebrated of all 20th-century British residential developers. Many of the developments that they worked on throughout the south of England are now listed, and they are renowned for their outstanding, yet simple, modern architectural style and their considered landscaping.

The Tour

This apartment is situated on the first floor of Shelley Court and enjoys views across the communal gardens, which are laden with white birch trees, shrubs and wildflowers. The current owner has thoughtfully preserved the Span-designed elements while introducing careful modern touches.

Inside, a neat hallway leads to dual-aspect living and kitchen spaces. A series of original Crittall windows overlook the gardens below and allow copious amounts of natural light into the living area. The kitchen adjoins the living space via an original glass divider and reeded door, both of which aid the flow of natural light in a design quite typical of Span developments. The mid-century kitchen has been incredibly well preserved and retains its original taps and fittings.

Two bedrooms and a bathroom lie off the hallway. Both bedrooms retain their original cabinetry, which provides plenty of storage space, and overlook the gardens below. The bathroom has been recently restored by the current owners and is lined with modern, dove-grey tiles and fitted with chrome sanitary ware, resulting in a calm, light-filled space.

The communal areas and landing are of particular note in this estate; they have been impeccably executed with decorative brick, glass and bespoke Span details that have been lovingly maintained. Each apartment has a private external store and there are communal drying and bike storage rooms.

The Area

Ham is a picturesque district in southwest London located between Richmond upon Thames and Kingston upon Thames. It unfurls around a large, open common and is renowned for the quality of its period architecture, the most notable example of which is Ham House, described by the National Trust as “the most complete survival of 17th-century fashion and power”. There is a parade of shops in Ham, including a monthly farmers’ market plus wider shopping and dining opportunities in Richmond and Kingston.

Richmond and Kingston both have fast train connections into central London.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 960 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £2,400 per annum
Parking: There is unallocated residents parking in the estate
Council Tax Band: D

address: Coombe Lane West, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A most impressive modern, detached residence that has been subject of a recent comprehensive programme of refurbishment and extension, using high quality materials, fixtures and fittings and now provides a super home equipped with all modern conveniences, ideal for family life and entertaining. The spacious and well-planned accommodation provides 3 reception rooms, 5 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms providing almost 3,000 sq. Ft (267 sq. M), of useable living space, arranged over three floors.

On the ground floor, the accommodation comprises: Entrance hall; reception room; family room; a stunning open-plan kitchen/dining/reception room with double sliding glass doors to the terrace and the garden; study; utility room and cloakroom. The whole of this floor has underfloor heating.

On the first floor there are 4 bedrooms, one with an en-suite shower room, and a family bathroom. On the top floor is the magnificent and spacious master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and splendid, far reaching southerly views.

To the front of the house is off-street parking for several cars and to the rear there is a generous entertaining decked terrace (with storage beneath) with steps down to a lawned, southerly facing garden with flower and shrub borders and a garden shed.

The house is ideally located for several excellent state and independent schools including Coombe Hill Infants and Junior School (Outstanding Ofsted rating) Coombe Boys and Coombe Girls, Rokeby, Marymount International School, Holy Cross, Kingston Grammar and Tiffin Boys and Tiffin Girls.
It's also convenient for both Kingston Town Centre and Wimbledon where there is an excellent selection of shops, boutiques, restaurants and theatres. The combined 3200 acres of Wimbledon Common and Royal Richmond Park are also nearby. EPC Rating C.

Substantially upgraded by the current owners the apartment benefits from underfloor heating and air conditioning throughout fibre optic home broadband enabling download speeds up to 910 Mb for full high definition video conferencing custom-built storage built by Neville Johnson built-in surround sound and viewing wall in the reception room and Siemens appliances to the kitchen including a 48 bottle capacity wine cooler. A west-facing balcony is accessed from the reception room offering magical views across the River Thames.

Kingston Riverside is an exclusive development built by an award winning developer in 2013. The development benefits from communal gardens to the ground floor as well as a stylish roof garden on the sixth floor along with an on-site concierge. Ideally located moments from Kingston town centre where you will find an array of restaurants bars and shops including John Lewis and The Bentall Centre. Kingston Railway is located within 0.3m of the property offering a regular service into London. The development also benefits from direct access to the riverside offering residents the opportunity to enjoy the beautiful surroundings on offer

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide price of £650k to £685k. A charming character Link Detached Farmhouse, forming part of an exclusive courtyard of period farm buildings converted in 1999.

The property is beautifully presented and completely renovated in December 2020 by the current owners, The property offers a superb marriage of contemporary and character style to suit both the modern or country lifestyle.

From the attractive central courtyard area, the front door opens into an open plan living area provides excellent space for both entertaining and relaxing, featuring a living room with fabulous solid wood parquet flooring and open fire, opening to a dining area and also opening to the fitted country house kitchen and integrated appliances. The utility room is also off the kitchen, with an additional sink, extensive cupboards to match the kitchen and door to the rear.

On The first Floor are the Three Double bedrooms and Family bathroom. The large master bedroom comes with fitted wardrobes and modern, re-fitted bathroom. There is also a family bathroom, with a Victorian style white suite and on the first floor there are two further double bedrooms.

The property also features, gas central heating, double glazing and a double garage.

About The Property

The Farmhouse dating back to1874- The farmhouse was originally the farm office for the estate where the workmen collected their weekly wages and it was lived in by the farm manager and his family. The properties were redeveloped in the ‘80’s and there are now 9 properties making up a community with communal gardens and a paddock.

Location

This rural peaceful idyll is situated tucked away between the A3 and the A243 letterhead road with easy access to M25 and the A3 The existing farm has now been broken up into 4 working livery stables popular with equestrians from local areas. There are other old properties dotted around this rural oasis with wonderful country walks and direct footpath access to nearby Claygate with it’s wonderful independent shops and eateries including the ever popular Hare and Hounds. Wimbledon is only 15 minutes by car and Chessington south is within walking distance with direct train links to Waterloo via Wimbledon.
Perfect for someone looking to downsize with a refreshing rural theme but still with easy access to London.

address: Kingston Hill Place, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
A spacious two double bedroom first floor apartment with a lift located in a beautifully maintained gated development with a share of the freehold and parking.

Location

Kingston Hill Place is a secure gated community set in nine acres of beautifully landscaped gardens off Kingston Hill with views of Richmond Park.

Richmond Park offers 2368 acres of open space perfect for walks, riding and cycling. The area also offers a number of golf courses between Coombe, Wimbledon and Richmond.

There are many good restaurants, shopping facilities, cinemas and theatres in Wimbledon and Kingston. Kingston town centre offers excellent shopping facilities at the Bentalls shopping centre.

Train servces from Kingston provide easy access into Waterloo via Clapham Junction. Frequent bus services run into both Kingston or Putney. There are many popular schools in both the private and public sector including Rokeby for boys, Coombe Hill Girls School, Wimbledon High, Holy Cross for girls, Kings College School for boys and Marymount International School.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

A superb first floor apartment located within a beautiful mansion building set within stunning and extensive grounds in this highly sought after Kingston Hill Place development. There is both private parking and visitor parking available.

The development benefits from a mews like atmosphere and excellent communal facilities; a swimming pool, well equipped gym, sauna and solarium with changing facilities. There is direct lift access to the swimming pool complex.

The apartment offers wonderful lateral living space and opens into a central hallway. To the front is generous reception room with an attractive fireplace and wonderful green views of the landscaped gardens. Alongside is a contemporary kitchen with a good range of fitted units and cupboards with stone work surfaces and integrated appliances. The principal bedroom overlooks the gardens to the front with a stylish en suite bathroom and well designed fitted wardrobes. There is a second double bedroom with a walk in wardrobe and a guest bathroom.

Chain free.

Square Footage: 1280 sq ft

At 378 Ewell Road, interiors have been designed to make fantastic open plan living spaces – bright, spacious, contemporary. The location

The bustling centre of Surbiton has everything you need. Just 11 miles from central London, with glorious parkland on the doorstep, Surbiton has been described as ‘one of the capital's best-kept secrets’ with a flourishing community offering excellent local amenities in addition to fast and easy access to the capital. Central London is just 20 minutes away by train and the A3 is less than a mile away which leads directly into London or out towards the M25 and the wider motorway network. Surbiton is served by many high street brands including Waitrose, Sainsbury's and M&S which co-exist with a wide range of independent stores.

Connections – The apartments are conveniently located for both Tolworth and Surbiton Stations, with fast and frequent services to London Waterloo. By car, the nearby A3 leads directly to Central London, with London Heathrow a mere 12 miles away. Both the M3 and M25 are situated 7 miles away.

Shopping - Surbiton has a fantastic selection of high street brands including Waitrose, Sainsbury’s, and M&S. It also boasts a wide range of independent stores and boutiques, and a popular farmers’ market. Nearby, Kingston upon Thames has some of London’s best shopping, including John Lewis and the Bentall Centre.

Entertainment - Surbiton’s Maple Road is well-known for eclectic bistro-style cafés, bars and restaurants and is a vibrant destination for a night out. The critically acclaimed Rose Theatre is nearby in Kingston upon Thames, along with a wider selection of eateries and leisure activities.

Parks and Sporting Opportunities - The apartments are located opposite Alexandra Park in Surbiton, and close to some of the country’s finest outdoor spaces including Richmond Park, Bushy Park and Hampton Court Palace. The River Thames is just a short stroll away for boating activities and riverside walks. The area also offers excellent gyms, sports facilities, and Surbiton & Hampton Court golf clubs.

Education - Surbiton is a wonderful place to bring up children, with an outstanding choice of highly rated state and independent primary & secondary schools. With a safe environment for children of all ages.
Help to buy

You can buy your new home with just a 5% deposit if you take out a Help to Buy Equity Loan. Under the scheme, the Government lends you up to 40% of the purchase price, so you only need a mortgage for the remaining 55%. Help to Buy Equity Loans are interest-free for 5 years and can be repaid at any time or on the sale of your home. The scheme is open to first time buyers as well as homeowners looking to move.

The loan is interest-free for the first 5 years. In year 6, you pay a fee of 1.75% of the loan. The fee increases annually by an amount equal to the Retail Price Index (rpi) + 1%. The loan can be repaid at any time at an amount equal to 40% of the market value, whether the property value has increased or decreased in value. Partial repayments are allowed at a minimum amount of 10% of the market value at the time of repayment. The loan must be repaid on the sale of the property or upon the expiry of the mortgage term, whichever comes first. A set fee may be payable upon completion of the mortgage.

Bedrooms

- Carpets to all bedrooms
- Shaker style fitted wardrobe to master bedroom
General/security

- Cycle storage
- Video entry to all apartments
The location

The bustling centre of Surbiton has everything you need. Just 11 miles from central London, with glorious parkland on the doorstep, Surbiton has been described as ‘one of the capital's best-kept secrets’ with a flourishing community offering excellent local amenities in addition to fast and easy access to the capital. Central London is just 20 minutes away by train and the A3 is less than a mile away which leads directly into London or out towards the M25 and the wider motorway network. Surbiton is served by many high street brands including Waitrose, Sainsbury's and M&S which co-exist with a wide range of independent stores.

Connections – The apartments are conveniently located for both Tolworth and Surbiton Stations, with fast and frequent services to London Waterloo. By car, the nearby A3 leads directly to Central London, with London Heathrow a mere 12 miles away. Both the M3 and M25 are situated 7 miles away.

Shopping - Surbiton has a fantastic selection of high street brands including Waitrose, Sainsbury’s, and M&S. It also boasts a wide range of independent stores and boutiques, and a popular farmers’ market. Nearby, Kingston upon Thames has some of London’s best shopping, including John Lewis and the Bentall Centre.

Entertainment - Surbiton’s Maple Road is well-known for eclectic bistro-style cafés, bars and restaurants and is a vibrant destination for a night out. The critically acclaimed Rose Theatre is nearby in Kingston upon Thames, along with a wider selection of eateries and leisure activities.

Parks and Sporting Opportunities - The apartments are located opposite Alexandra Park in Surbiton, and close to some of the country’s finest outdoor spaces including Richmond Park, Bushy Park and Hampton Court Palace. The River Thames is just a short stroll away for boating activities and riverside walks. The area also offers excellent gyms, sports facilities, and Surbiton & Hampton Court golf clubs.

Education - Surbiton is a wonderful place to bring up children, with an outstanding choice of highly rated state and independent primary & secondary schools. With a safe environment for children of all ages.
Help to buy

You can buy your new home with just a 5% deposit if you take out a Help to Buy Equity Loan. Under the scheme, the Government lends you up to 40% of the purchase price, so you only need a mortgage for the remaining 55%. Help to Buy Equity Loans are interest-free for 5 years and can be repaid at any time or on the sale of your home. The scheme is open to first time buyers as well as homeowners looking to move.

The loan is interest-free for the first 5 years. In year 6, you pay a fee of 1.75% of the loan. The fee increases annually by an amount equal to the Retail Price Index (rpi) + 1%. The loan can be repaid at any time at an amount equal to 40% of the market value, whether the property value has increased or decreased in value. Partial repayments are allowed at a minimum amount of 10% of the market value at the time of repayment. The loan must be repaid on the sale of the property or upon the expiry of the mortgage term, whichever comes first. A set fee may be payable upon completion of the mortgage.

address: Caversham Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
An exceptionally well presented and charming three bedroom detached Victorian house located moments from the town centre and Fairfield Recreation Ground.

Arranged naturally over the ground and first floor, the property retains much of its original character whilst having been fully modernised throughout. The ground floor comprises a beautiful open plan double reception room, with feature fireplace and bay window at the front, as well as wonderful entertaining space to the rear incorporating a large reception/dining room. At the back of the house there is large and well proportioned modern fitted kitchen. The first floor offers three bedrooms of varying size, the largest of which spans the width of the house and a modern family bathroom is also provided.

Externally, the property opens out onto a well maintained bright rear garden with side access and return for which the property offers scope to extend on the ground floor and first floor to the rear.

The property on Caversham Road is on a quiet residential road full of beautifully uniformed Victorian houses and located centrally for the town centre as well as moments from the green space of Fairfield recreation ground.

Furthermore, it is within just 0.3 miles (6 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 railway station, offering up to nine trains an hour, in two directions, to London terminals. It is even closer to the town centre itself, offering an array of shopping facilities and riverside restaurants.

Kingston Grammar school is moments away whilst other well regarded shools are nearby.

address: Winchester Close, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A superbly presented, bright and spacious detached family home offering in excess of 3500 Sq Ft across three floors. The property has been recently refurbished throughout comprising 5/6 bedrooms, four family bath/shower rooms (2 en-suite) and fantastic living accommodation with direct access to a beautiful mature garden.

Ideally located on a private road off Kingston Hill, this stunning family home comprises approximately 3562 Sq Ft across three floors with living accommodation with direct access to private garden and off street parking for several cars.

When entering the property you are immediately greeted by a large entrance hall with plenty of storage, you then have a large triple aspect reception room with direct access to the garden, modern fitted kitchen / dining room and utility room. Additionally there is a study, downstairs WC and storage room with integral and external access.

The first floor occupies the principle bedroom with en suite and a balcony with views over the garden, two further bedrooms (one with a balcony), two further bathrooms (one en suite) and a dressing / bed room. Upstairs you then have two further bedrooms with a bathroom and connecting eave storage.

Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities are both within easy reach as is the A3 trunk road offering fast access to central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 motorway. British Rail train stations at Norbiton and Kingston provide frequent services to Waterloo and Vauxhall with underground links to points throughout the City; the nearest tube stations are Wimbledon and Putney.

The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses, tennis and squash clubs. The pedestrian access into Richmond Park which is an area of outstanding beauty provides a picturesque setting in which to picnic, go horse riding, jogging or just take a leisurely walk. Theatres at Richmond and Wimbledon are also popular alternatives to the West End together with an excellent choice of restaurants. There are also numerous schools for all ages in the public, state and international sectors.

There is study with skylight above located off the reception room which provides access into the integral garage. At the back of the property is a kitchen/dining room overlooking the rear garden and large window looking into the bright and spacious conservatory. The conservatory takes full advantage of sunny views into the garden and also has access to a cloakroom and separate utility room. Upstairs there is a contemporary bathroom, storage cupboard and four good sized bedrooms, including the principle bedroom with en suite shower room.

Situation
Set in a prime central Kingston location the house is conveniently located for access to Kingston town centre with its array of shops, restaurants and transport links. As well as the excellent schools nearby, the Fairfield Recreation Ground is close by, meaning this is a great location for families. The property is 0.4 miles from Kingston station which has a frequent service to London Waterloo and Surbiton station is just 1.2 miles away with a fast service to London Waterloo. Hampton Court, Bushy Park, Richmond Park and the River Thames are within easy reach.

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

An exciting and rare opportunity to acquire this well located, extremely spacious split level 5 bedroom licensed HMO ideal for rental investment, occupation or development (STPP).

Situated within an attractive Victorian building, this maisonette is arranged over the entire first and second floors of the building with a large loft space above considered suitable for conversion to provide additional accommodation, subject to the requisite consents.

The property is well located in an attractive area of Surbiton, within walking distance of the High Street and B.R. Station with its fast and regular rail links into London Waterloo.

The accommodation currently consists ground floor private entrance with internal staircase up to the first floor where there are 2 double bedrooms, a separate reception room, separate kitchen/diner and two bathrooms/W.C. A very spacious first floor landing has a further internal staircase leading to the second floor where there are three further double bedrooms and access to the roof space.

The property is fully let and currently produces a rental yield of circa £2,000 per calendar month but there is considerable scope to improve the rental income achievable per room through modernisation/extension and/or the creation of en-suites to each room. Alternatively, we believe there is also scope for the sub-division of the existing maisonette to form a number of smaller self-contained apartments either using the existing first and second floor accommodation and/or extension into the roof space (STPP) to potentially create a third unit.

The property will be offered on a new 999 year lease at a peppercorn ground rent.

Please call Blakes Chartered Surveyors and Estate Agents for further information or to arrange a viewing.
title: 5 bed maisonette for sale

address: Warren Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
At 8,493 sq ft (789 sq m), this superb, detached mansion is perfectly situated in the middle of the highly regarded private Coombe Estate and offers 6 double bedrooms, 4 reception rooms, self-contained staff maisonette and a leisure complex including a cinema, gym, sauna / steam and jacuzzi room and a fabulous games room.

Thoroughly advanced with integrated sound, networking and filtered air flow, the design of this house makes wonderful use of tall ceilings, glass and curves to accentuate the light and design maximising the contemporary modern ambiance that is obvious throughout. Built over 4 floors, each serving its own purpose.

The lower ground houses the leisure complex. With a bespoke cinema room for all to enjoy, there is no reason to leave the house. The gym is complimented by a jacuzzi, a steam room and a sauna. On the other side of this floor, the games room is perfect for parties. The self-contained staff apartment has a large studio room, a kitchenette and a shower room. Accessed through the house it also has a private access via the side of the house.

At ground level, the kitchen has all the units and fittings and more that are expected in a house of this calibre and has the dining room and the garden room (with a separate access to the leisure complex) to either side. The drawing room, family room and home office/library together complete this floor.

The upper two floors house the bedrooms. 6 doubles with 4 ensuite bathrooms and a further larger family bathroom. The master has a dressing room and three of the bedrooms have balconies overlooking the gardens.

Outside, the garden faces south east and has been landscaped offering meandering paths through lavender and other plant beds all surrounding a well maintained lawned garden. Parking for several cars to the front is through electric gates that lead to the integral garage. The house is reached through the manned security gates from Coombe Lane West.

address: London Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
An exceptional three bedroom apartment with large private balcony situated within just a short walk of Kingston town centre and station.

Situated on the first floor, this modern apartment comprises three well-proportioned bedrooms and two stylish modern bathrooms, one of which is offered as an en-suite shower room, and an open kitchen reception dining room. The kitchen comes complete with a range of integrated Bosch appliances including washing machine, fridge freezer, dishwasher and wine cooler, whilst the reception room spills out onto an oversized private balcony.

Additional features include zoned underfloor heating throughout, full pre-wire for Sonus music systems and a secure indoor cycle store.

Please contact our Kingston Sales office for more information regarding potential rental figures as well as lease and maintenance details.

This highly sought after apartment offers an ideal opportunity for both investors and professionals.

It is located within just moments of the historic Old London Road providing access directly into Kingston town centre, and also within close proximity to Kingston Hospital.

Furthermore, it is within 0.4 miles (8 minutes walk) of the railway station offering connections into London Waterloo and Richmond in 30 minutes and 19 minutes respectively.

detailedDescription:
A well-appointed, purpose built one bedroom apartment with allocated parking, located within a popular gated development.

Situated on the ground floor, the property is well-presented throughout and comprises generous proportions throughout incorporating a double bedroom, bathroom and reception dining room with open plan kitchen.

The development itself is also provided with an allocated parking space as well as visitor parking for guests.

Offers Court is located on Winery Lane and is a very quiet and secluded development of apartments.

It is within 0.7 miles (15 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 mainline railway station offering a frequent connection in two directions to London terminals, whilst the town centre itself is within a shorter walk offering an array of popular shops and restaurants including those nestled directly along the River Thames.

Additionally, and within just 0.2 miles (4 minute walk) is the green open space of Fairfield Recreation ground.

address: Lower Teddington Road, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
This rarely available modern one-bedroom freehold house was built to a high-specification with an emphasis on quality fixtures and fittings. The property comprises; a spacious reception room with French doors to a private garden overlooking stunning communal gardens, a downstairs WC, a separate semi open-plan kitchen and on the first-floor a shower-room and large bedroom with fitted wardrobes.

The property also benefits from off-street parking.

Thameside Place is an exclusive gated development with stunning communal gardens situated directly on the banks of this particularly scenic stretch of the Thames. Located in Hampton Wick, you will find everyday amenities such as chemists, bakers, dry-cleaning, small supermarket outlets and coffee spots at Hampton Wick High-Street, alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants.

Nearby Kingston town centre is a short journey by bus, car or by walking/cycling along the river. Kingston, with its excellent shopping facilities and parking, offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques to leading High Street brands, along with a John Lewis, Bentalls department store and Waitrose supermarket.

Prospective purchasers should note that children under the age of 16 years are not permitted to permanently reside at this property.

detailedDescription:
Mulberry Court is a new development of 34 elegant apartments for independent retirement living, set in beautiful landscaped gardens, which offers buyers the opportunity to downsize to their dream lifestyle. This light and airy two-bedroom, ground floor apartment benefits from a private patio which extends the living space and offers views of the stunning shared gardens. This newly built property is designed for comfort and convenience, arranged over one floor, with generous width doors and corridors. The interior is classic contemporary in style, with engineered oak floors, a fireplace with feature stone surround in the living area and high quality fitted carpet to the bedroom. Through the entrance hall, separate kitchen, dining and living space, the layout has been carefully thought through for flexible living. The kitchen features fully integrated appliances, composite stone worktops and matching full height splashbacks. There is a separate utility closest off the hallway housing the combination washer/dryer. The master bedroom features an en-suite bathroom with level access shower, and the family bathroom a double ended bath. The development has been finished to a very high standard, with incredible design flair by developer Lifestyle Residences, a family-owned business.

Apartment owners enjoy access to Mulberry Court's stylish shared facilities including a deli café, library area, club room, flexible event space and beauty salon. The stunning communal garden, created by a Chelsea Award-winning design team, offers areas for quiet relaxation as well as for socialising and outdoor dining. Owners benefit from the convenience and security of an on-site concierge, and can tailor a range of services from cleaning and housekeeping to support with additional care needs. Every apartment is equipped with video entry phone to the main entrance, and a Tunstall call system linked to the concierge and a 24-hour call centre. The development features private underground parking, accessible by lift, and charging points for electric vehicles.

Mulberry Court is located a stone's throw from the banks of the River Thames, in the heart of Hampton Wick. There is a range of local shops, restaurants and amenities including the Post Office on the doorstep. In addition to the local amenities on offer in Hampton Wick, Kingston Town Centre is only 0.4 miles away and benefits from a wide array of popular high street brands. During the summer months Kingston riverside really comes alive with regular boat trips up and down river to Hampton court, Richmond and beyond. Hampton Wick station is less than a 0.2 mile walk from the development, with six trains an hour offering an easy journey into central London, Richmond, Wimbledon, Clapham Junction and beyond. There are excellent bus connections to the local area including Kew Gardens, Teddington and Twickenham all within a 20 minute ride.

Hampton Wick is blessed with glorious green spaces, including Bushy Park and Home Park, which together with the Thames Path, offer endless options for walking and cycling, in addition to the range of local sports clubs for tennis, golf, swimming and bowls. For culture fans, there are world famous historic sites including Hampton Court Palace nearby, as well as a thriving theatre scene, live music, foodie and horticultural events.

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
At the front of the property is a bright and spacious reception room with feature fireplace, bay window and views into the garden. The kitchen is located in the middle of the ground floor with French doors opening onto the walled garden. There are a further two reception room, a study, cloakroom and utility room on the ground floor, as well as a separate courtyard. Upstairs there is a family bathroom with separate shower and bath and three spacious bedrooms, all with built in storage space. Situated at the end of a rural Lane Barwell Cottage sits amongst a cluster of properties having an open outlook over formal gardens, neighbouring paddocks and farmland. The mature gardens include many trees, shrubs, pond and a Weeping Willow as well as a timber built workshop outbuilding with ideal storage space. To the rear of the property is a detached double garage that provides further storage and additional parking to the side suitable for several cars.

Situation
Situated at the end of Barwell Lane, the property is surrounded by farmland and paddocks, with numerous livery facilities available, such as Kingston Riding Centre, which is ideal for equestrian enthusiasts. Although the location has a rural feel the property is conveniently situated for access to Surbiton and Kingston town centres with their array of shops, restaurants and transport links. Chessington South station is only 0.6 miles away and is in London Travel zone 6.

detailedDescription:
Three bedroom semi detached house with garage, garden, parking and no onward chain!

Cairds are delighted to present this three bedroom, semi detached house offered with no onward chain. Situated at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac this property benefits from being at the end of the close and a large rear garden.
To the ground floor there is a modern kitchen with aspect over the front drive, gas hob, electric oven and space for built-in appliances. Off the hall is a downstairs loo, storage cupboard, stairs and to the rear of the house, the main living room. The living room is an excellent size with rear aspect over the back garden and double doors leading directly onto the rear patio.
Upstairs there are three bedrooms and the family bathroom which is bright and modern with contemporary stone tiles and a white suite.

address: Fallow Court, 1 Coombe Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
This incredibly bright and well-proportioned, two bedroom apartment is very well presented throughout and flooded with light.

Located on the second floor and serviced by lift and stairs, the property comprises two double bedrooms and one stylish modern bathroom.

A large reception/dining room with feature private balcony offers excellent entertaining space combining with an open-plan modern kitchen, complete with a range of integrated appliances.

Coombe Road is a popular residential street in Kingston. Situated within just 0.2 miles (5 minute walk) of Norbiton's Zone 5 railway station it offers a frequent connection into London terminals.

The A3 is also nearby for alternative routes into and out of London. Furthermore, if falls within the catchment for well-regarded schools nearby whilst a number of sought after independent schools are also within close proximity.

Richmond Park's Kingston Gate offers the opportunity to enjoy the largest Royal Park in London covering an area of 2,500 acres. From its heights, uninterrupted views of St Paul's Cathedral can be enjoyed, 12 miles away, whilst the Isabella Plantation offers a 40 acre Victorian woodland garden created in the 1830's and is best known for its evergreen azaleas, which line the ponds and streams. Created by Charles I in the 17th century as a deer park, it is of national and international importance for wildlife conservation.

Kingston town centre offers a varied and comprehensive choice in shops via the High Street and Clarence Street as well as both Bentalls & John Lewis department stores. Kingston Riverside also offers a number of well-known and popular restaurants.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A newly renovated, six-bedroom, four-bathroom semi-detached family home featuring nearly 3,000 sq. Ft. Of net internal floor area, boasting an exceptionally large open-plan living room and kitchen, high specification fittings throughout and a spacious garden and off-street parking.

Recently extended in 2019, this semi-detached family house benefits from newly fitted features throughout the house including underfloor heating in the living room and the kitchen, double-glazed windows, bi-fold doors to the garden, boiler, rewiring and brand-new kitchen and bathrooms. It has an additional newly-built 330 sq. Ft. (30 sq.m.) unit in the rear garden.

The property features a paved dual driveway and opens up to an extremely light, spacious double living room with an open-plan kitchen. There are three well-sized rooms (including one en-suite) on the ground floor, a separate dining room area adjoined to the kitchen and a guest bathroom. Three bedrooms are found on the first floor, two of which are en-suites with the third one featuring an extremely spacious utility/storage room area.

Situated in close proximity to Kingston and Wimbledon High Street, the property enjoys a variety of local amenities including John Lewis and the Bentall Centre in Kingston and local restaurants in the New Malden area. The location is also only a short driveway from some of the best green spaces in London, including Richmond Park and Bushy Park.

It is only a few minutes walk away from New Malden railway station, which has direct connection to central London via Clapham Junction and Waterloo in under 30 minutes.

The property is ideally situated in the vicinity of many outstanding local schools. These include Tiffin and Coombe Girls School, as well as a great range of private schools including Holy Cross Preparatory School and Rokeby School for juniors and Kingston Grammar School and Wimbledon High School for seniors.

detailedDescription:
An historic six bedroom family house with off street parking and a double garage with superb views of Richmond Park to the rear.

Location

Fairlight is located on Kingston Hill and around 480 metres from Richmond Park, being one of London's Royal Parks, offering 2368 acres of open space perfect for walks, riding and cycling.

The area also offers a wide range of recreational activities including boating on the River Thames, a number of golf courses between Coombe, Wimbledon and Richmond, tennis, squash and fitness at the Roehampton Club and David Lloyd Leisure Centre.

There are many good restaurants, shopping, cinemas and theatres in Wimbledon, Kingston and Richmond. There are many popular schools in both the private and public sector including Rokeby for boys, Coombe Hill Girls School, Wimbledon High, Holy Cross for girls, Kings College School for boys and Marymount International School.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

One of the oldest properties on Kingston Hill with parts of the property dating back to Charles II with additions made in the early/mid19th century.

The house offers a wealth of period features with extensive oak panelling, intricate cornicing, open fireplaces, leaded and stain glass windows, a Minstrel gallery and three metre ceiling heights in the reception rooms.

The private, mature back gardens lead down to the wall of Richmond Park with spectacular views of the Park from all the rear rooms of the house.

The property is accessed from Kingston Hill, a solid oak front door opens to an entrance lobby with a pitched ceiling and a decorative skylight. The lobby leads to an impressive Minstrel galleried entrance hall with wood flooring and exposed beams to a pitched ceiling. There are two original wood panelled walls and an open brick fireplace with a stone hearth and wood burner. Bi folding doors open to a family room to the front with a dual aspect and features wood panelled walls. French windows allow direct access to the gardens. A wood panelled study with a double aspect to the front and the side has built in cupboards and shelving with an attractive fireplace. The drawing room is located to the rear and features intricate ceiling plasterwork, floor to ceiling windows and French windows opening to the rear garden. A paved terrace runs across the width of the drawing room and overlooks a mature, private 131' garden largely laid to lawn with a timber Gazebo. Alongside the drawing room is a formal dining room with half wood painted panelled walls, decorative cornicing, a marble fireplace and a fitted recessed glass cabinet. There is also a guest cloakroom/shower room.

A wonderful kitchen/breakfast room offers an extensive range of painted units with open shelving, solid wood worktops, fully integrated appliances and a free standing American style fridge. The fully fitted utility area is conveniently located off the kitchen.

Upstairs, the principal bedroom offers views to the rear and the side, ornate cornicing, built in wardrobes and shelving complete with an en suite bathroom with a separate glass shower and heated towel rail. There are a further five double bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes/cupboards and a large family bathroom.

Square Footage: 4080 sq ft

address: Coombe Ridings, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
An exceptional seven bedroom family house of over 8,200 sq ft with a double garage and a south west facing garden in a prime Coombe location.

Location

Coombe Ridings is a sought after private street within the Coombe estate. The street is located towards the summit of Coombe Hill allowing the house to offer far reaching south facing views.

Coombe Ridings is located off Kingston Hill and around 480 metres from Richmond Park, being one of London's Royal Parks, offering 2,368 acres of open space perfect for walks, riding and cycling. The area also offers a wide range of recreational activities including boating on the River Thames, a number of golf courses between Coombe, Wimbledon and Richmond, tennis, squash and fitness at the Roehampton Club and David Lloyd Leisure Centre.

There are good restaurants, shopping, cinemas and theatres in Wimbledon and Richmond and excellent schools in the private and public sector including Rokeby for boys, Coombe Hill Girls School, Wimbledon High, Holy Cross for girls, Kings College School for boys and Marymount International School.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Description

A wonderful opportunity to purchase an exceptional detached house of 8,300 sq ft, in one of the most desirable roads within the Coombe Estate. The house has just been completed and offers an exceptional level of specification throughout.

The front entrance to the house makes quite a statement, with a wonderful feeling of light and space by virtue of a double height ceiling and an open staircase. Porcelain flooring runs across the ground floor and basement with Marble to the stairways.

A spectacular kitchen/family room is located at the rear of the ground floor and offers wonderful lateral space, over 37' wide. Full height glass sliding doors open to a large balcony with wonderful views of a beautifully landscaped south west facing rear garden. The stunning luxury Krieder Kitchen features a porcelain island with colour selectable incident lighting, a full height Gaggenau wine cabinet, a Quooker tap with boiling/chilled/sparkling water, fully integrated Miele appliances, a 6 position induction hob with an overhead extractor and a motorised and illuminated pop-up extractor. Off the living space is a formal dining room and to the front an elegant drawing room. There is also a utility room fitted with Miele appliances and garaging.

The lower ground floor offers great flexibility of use, with a cinema room, gymnasium, shower, steam and sauna, plant room and a wine store.

The state of the art home cinema features an 11 speaker Dolby Atmos sound system, an Apple 4K TV, and Epson 4K ceiling projector, a 3.2m x 1.6m screen and low level floor wash lighting.

The first floor has a wonderful principal bedroom suite with a balcony offering green views of the garden, a separate sitting room/home office, dressing room and a luxurious bathroom with a secondary hot water pump circuit providing instant hot water to all taps and showers. There are a further three double bedroom suites on this floor, one of which is ideal for a nanny with its' own access from the garage.
All the en suites feature wet room style walk-in showers with
wall hung WCs with Duravit and Villeroy & Boch, fixtures and fittings.

There are a further three bedrooms on the second floor, one with an en suite shower room, a family bathroom, a study, store room and excellent eaves storage.

Bespoke Neatsmith wardrobes are fitted in all main bedrooms with Neatsmith linen cupboards on the 1st and 2nd floors.

The specification includes underfloor heating on all floors serviced by a Mitsubishi Air Source Heat Pump and Worcester Bosch boiler. All rooms can be temperature controlled individually. The plant room houses ample hot water storage with water softener servicing all rooms.

There is a Rako lighting control system which also provides control to the pre-wired electric blinds in all main rooms. On/off times are fully programmable throughout the entire house and garden areas. Illuminated coffer ceilings are in all the main rooms with Air Conditioning to south facing rooms. The house is also fitted with a heat recovery system for the basement.

Control 4 screens on all floors provide access to the intercom, gate entry video/intercom, external cameras and lighting control. There are TV/internet access points to all main rooms and all bedrooms complete with multiple WiFi access points around the house.

The plot is approximately 0.5 acre in total, and the impressive rear garden enjoys some elevated views. There is a double garage, excellent off street parking and front electric gates.

Square Footage: 8230 sq ft

address: Coombe Ridings, Coombe, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
An exceptional newly built and spacious seven bedroom family home, by the current owners to very high specifications with eye to detail offering accommodation arranged over four floors. The property offers stunning views reaching as far as the Gherkin in Central London from the ground floor terraces and first floor balcony and all rear bedrooms.

The gated property via an intercom, is approached via a resin bound forecourt offering ample off street parking and a double width garage to a covered stone portico and solid front door with a separate annex door to the side. On entering this spacious home, one is greeted into a porcelain tiled galleried reception hall with a Burvills custom designed high quality oak hand rails and iron balustrade on marble steps and marble surround to the landing. The whole house benefits from under floor heating and air conditioning to all the rear rooms and pre piped to the front rooms. The ground floor living areas and first floor bedrooms feature coffered ceilings with LED discreet lighting to the recesses. The windows have been pre-wired to accommodate electric curtains and blinds along with the rako lighting linked to the Control 4 home automation system found in the boot room between the utility room and garage also home to the Worcester boiler and consumer units.

The kitchen boasts a range of wall and base units with a breakfast bar home to the 6 ring induction hob and sink in a slate effect surface with Evoline flip power supply sockets with usb points. The comprehensive range of built in appliances comprise of a miele tall refrigerator, freezer, oven, combined steam/microwave oven, plate warmer, coffee machine, dishwasher and Gaggenau wine cooler. This bright and lovely room combined with the family living area offers access to the porcelain tiled terrace flush with the internal space enjoys stunning elevated views reaching far afield. There are steps leading a lower level and eventually onto the garden level. Off the kitchen is the formal dining room or second TV room.

The lower of the house offers a home cinema with 11 speakers, 3 sub woofers, Epsom projector. All the TV’s and cinema room are connected to Netflix, apple TV and Sky Q. The gym offers views of the rear garden and access onto the terrace with slate chippings, with plumbing and water connections buried in the pillar should a bar be installed. Also to this level is a steam room, sauna with Nordic spruce wood and a shower room. There is an area prepared for a wine cellar capable of accommodating over 200 bottles and ducting to the outside for cooling. The plant room is beautifully laid out and fully labelled for easy maintenance.

The first floor is home to the principal bedroom suite with walk in dressing room and large en suite bathroom and a private lounge also accessible from the landing with doors to the balcony with breath taking leafy views. There are two further bedrooms with en suites and fourth which could be used as a nanny suite with its own entrance or home office. The second floor offers three further bedrooms with two bathrooms (1 being en suite) and a large study/TV area and a walk in store room off the family bathroom.

An exceptional bright family home with immense versatility.<br/><br/>location<br/><br/>Kingston Hill is conveniently located close to Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities. The A3 offering fast access to central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 is also close at hand. The nearest train station is Norbiton, a 20 minute walk and provides frequent services to London Waterloo and Vauxhall (approximately 25-30 minutes) with their underground links to points throughout the city. The train journey from Norbiton to Waterloo at peak times is 4 trains per hour. With a rail season ticket, car parking can currently be included. There is a bus service from the top of the hill which takes 8 minutes.

The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses and tennis and squash clubs. Richmond Park, the largest of the capital’s eight Royal Parks at 2,368 acres of natural beauty, is close by and provides a picturesque setting in which to picnic, go horse riding, cycling, jogging, or just to take a leisurely walk. Theatres at Wimbledon and Richmond are popular with local residents, with many a new production debuting here before launching in the West End and both also have an excellent choice of restaurants.

There are numerous private, state and International schools for all ages within the immediate vicinity, including Coombe Hill Infants and Junior School, Rokeby School for boys, Holy Cross Prep School for girls, Marymount International. Kings College Wimbledon, Kingston Grammar for boys and Wimbledon High School for girls are also close by.

detailedDescription:
This brilliantly bright and spacious 3-bed, 2-bath apartment of 1029sqft is situated on the 1st floor with lift access. Part of the Newlands House development, these brand-new homes have been designed to reflect the historic Victorian architecture that encapsulates this part of Surbiton. Comprising of one, two and three-bedroom apartments this fully private residential development is nestled within the Oakhill Conservation Area.

Stone Real Estate are proud to present, Newlands House inhibits the restoration and conversion of No.3 Oakhill (Newlands House) and the erection of three new residential blocks. Residents at Newlands House will benefit from beautiful, landscaped grounds and high specification new homes.

Each two-bedroom apartment at Lockwood House prides itself for spacious internal accommodation between 750 - 925 square feet and includes key amenities such as:
* High specification throughout
* Lift and ramp access
* Off-street parking available
* Family bathroom and en-suite shower room
* Bespoke Italian designed kitchens
* High-speed WiFi
* Many apartments offer private outdoor space
* Close to shops, bars, restaurants, leisure facilities and the River Thames

The location of Newlands House boasts excellent transport links and is situated within 300 metres of Surbiton Mainline station. With regular trains (10 per hour) to London Waterloo (20 mins) and Clapham Junction (10 mins), Surbiton station also connects residents’ to the South East and South Coast (Woking, Reading, Basingstoke, Portsmouth, Southampton).

Newlands House is situated approximately 800 metres from local bus routes provided on Ewell Road and Victoria Road providing easy access to Kingston, Twickenham and Ealing Broadway and is just a six minute walk to the river Thames!
Surbiton station has been identified as a Crossrail 2 station. If approved, Crossrail would provide direct access to Victoria, Tottenham Court Road, Euston, and Kings Cross

Studio Flat, presented in good decorative order and offering Vacant possession.

The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible, buyer friendly method of purchase. We do not require the purchaser to exchange contracts immediately but grant 56 days to exchange and complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the action, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000 including VAT which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The legal Pack can be downloaded for free from the auction website or requested from our Auction Department.
Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is generally no more than 10% more than the advertised start price. Both the starting price and reserve price can be subject to change. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction.

detailedDescription:
A truly stunning and extended, four bedroom semi-detached Victorian house with private rear garden, located on a popular residential street.

Finished to the highest specification throughout, the ground floor comprises a lovely reception to the front with feature fireplace and bay window, whilst a beautiful extension to the rear allows for a wonderfully bright and open plan kitchen/reception/family room, which in turn spills out onto a very well maintained rear garden. The kitchen also comes complete with a range of integrated appliances and breakfast bar.

The first floor offers two generous double bedrooms and stylish modern bathroom whilst the loft has been converted to offer an incredibly well-sized master bedroom with en-suite and a further bedroom/study area.

Villiers Road is a very popular residential street located within convenient reach of Athelstan and Fairfield Recreation Grounds. Furthermore, it is well situated for access to both Kingston and Surbiton railway stations and falls within the catchment for well-regarded schools..

address: Villiers Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
This two bedroom flat is situated on the ground floor of a small private block and benefits from designated off street parking for one car and two bathrooms.
The property is ideal as an investment or for first time buyers. Decorated in neutral colours throughout the flat offers spacious accommodation in an excellent location.

The accommodation comprises;
• Reception room with large windows overlooking the front garden. Wood flooring. This is a spacious room with plenty of space for a dining table but is currently being used as a bedroom
• Master bedroom with ensuite shower room and WC. Built in wardrobes
• Second double bedroom overlooking the garden
• Family/guest bathroom with full bath and shower over, basin and WC
• Fully fitted kitchen with a range of wall and base units and a breakfast bar. Window overlooking the rear garden. This is a lu-ittle dated but perfectly serviceable

There is a large communal garden to the rear of the property and off street parking (designated) to the front.

The property is situated in a quiet enclave off Villiers Road and it is a short walk to all the amenities of central Kingston upon Thames. There is a good local bus service into Surbiton.

The flat is well presented and has been well maintained. There is gas CH off a combination boiler and the flat is double glazed.
The flat is currently tenanted with the tenant having been served notice although if purchased by an investor they are willing to remain.

Service charges: £1200 per annum

Council Tax Band: D Kingston upon Thames

address: Kingston Hill, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
This spacious family home, with Victorian additions, is beautifully presented and offers versatile accommodation with four reception rooms, six bedrooms, and four bathrooms. The house has retained a wealth of period features such as original beams and cornicing to the ceilings, shutters to the windows, wooden floors and fire-places.

Outside
The garden provides an ample lawn as well as paved terrace areas. Additionally there is a double garage and off street parking for several cars.

Situation
Kingston Hill is conveniently located close to Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities. The A3 offers fast access to central London. Both Gatwick and Heathrow airports, via the M25, are also close at hand. The nearest train station is Norbiton, a 15 minute walk, which provides frequent services to London Waterloo (approximately 25-30 minutes) and Vauxhall with their underground links.
The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses, tennis and squash clubs and Richmond Park with its 2,368 acres of natural beauty. There are numerous private, state and International schools for all ages within the immediate vicinity, including Coombe Hill Infants and Junior School, Rokeby School For Boys, Holy Cross Prep School For Girls, Marymount International. King’s College Wimbledon, Kingston Grammar For Boys and Wimbledon High School For Girls.

address: Nigel Fisher Way, Chessington, Surrey KT9
detailedDescription:
Situated in leafy Chessington, recently named by The Guardian as one of the most popular areas for Londoners craving outside space to search for property, Hawes & Co are proud to present this four double bedroom, three bathroom detached modern family home - the largest four bedroom property in the development - with detached double garage and spacious driveway, ideally located in Chessington. Having been the show home for the development, the property is finished to a high standard throughout. The spacious hallway leads to a spacious living room to the front, and onto the rear dining room. The study/office space is in a quiet corner of the ground floor, also accessed via the hallway. To the rear of the property is the combined kitchen and family room, a real star of the show! To the first floor are four double bedrooms, including the main bedroom and another bedroom - both with en-suites, and the family bathroom. Externally, the large south-facing rear garden has been enlarged by the current owners, who have purchased an additional piece of adjoining land. To the front, there is off-street parking for four cars, as well as a large double garage. Close-by are local shops and services and well-regarded schools, as well as Chessington South railway station, and stops for the K4,71,465 and 467 buses. Also worth noting are the solar panels, which produce c. £1,200 of income per annum. Viewing highly recommended!<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Bright and well presented two double bedroom first floor flat with long lease and no chain, conveniently located in the heart of Surbiton, close to transport links and fashionable amenities. The property has been well maintained and appointed, offering light and spacious accommodation spanning approximately 740sqft, with stylish interiors throughout. Features include an inviting reception room, well equipped kitchen, elegant bathroom, gas central heating, double glazing, and wood effect flooring.

Accommodation comprises a wide entrance hallway with doors to all rooms, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing, entertaining and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized double bedrooms, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and tiled walls.

The property is located within a short walk of Surbiton station, and close to numerous regular bus routes providing links to the surrounding area. Surbiton itself offers a wonderful array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants, with nearby Kingston providing a greater variety of branded shopping as well as a theatre and cinema, and of course, the banks of the River Thames - fantastic for riverside walks and cycling. The area is also well served by excellent local schools, and lovely open spaces.

A rare and exciting opportunity has arisen to purchase a spacious three-bedroom, two reception room, top floor apartment located in a sought-after block. The property is situated on the third floor of Ingram House with its own west facing private balcony enjoying views of Royal Bushy Park and Royal Paddocks Allotments. Entrance hall | triple aspect double reception room | study | dining room | kitchen/breakfast room | utility room | guest cloakroom | principal bedroom with en suite | five further bedrooms, one with en suite shower room | two family bathrooms | play room/landing

detailedDescription:
A stunning Victorian detached property offering 1,151 sq ft of accommodation. The property benefits from a spectacular extended open plan living/dining/kitchen area which successfully combines a modern and contemporary styled interior within a handsome period home.

The ground floor accommodation consists of an entrance hall, a spacious reception room, a shower/cloakroom and a spectacular architect designed extended reception room/kitchen incorporating distinct living and dining areas with French doors leading to the rear garden.

The first floor accommodation consists of a landing, a master double bedroom providing access to a 'Jack & Jill' four piece bathroom with door to landing, a second double aspect bedroom and a single bedroom/study.

Outside to the front is a garden which is laid to block paved hardstanding providing off street parking for one vehicle, a gate provides side access leading to the rear. To the rear is a westerly facing garden incorporating areas laid to lawn, gravel and patio with raised flower and shrub borders.

Bonner Hill Road is a popular residential road ideally located for Fairfield Park, the River Thames and Richmond Park's Kingston Gate, which offers over 2,500 acres of Royal parkland to enjoy. Access to both Richmond and Kingston centres are incredibly convenient and the property falls within the catchment for a choice of private and Ofsted rated Outstanding state schools.

address: Surbiton Court, St. Andrews Square, Surbiton KT6
detailedDescription:
The property comprises two bright and spacious bedrooms, a cosy reception room, a contemporary bathroom and a modern kitchen with space for dining table and separate utility area, including additional sink. The property also has a separate storage cupboard, comes with a garage and is set within beautifully kept communal gardens.

Situation
Situated just off St. Andrews Square, the property is conveniently located for access to both Surbiton and Kingston town centres. Surbiton station is just 0.4 miles to Surbiton station with a frequent fast train to London Waterloo. The popular Maple Road, with its farmers’ market and selection of independent cafes, pubs and shops is just steps away and Kingston riverside walk, leading into Kingston town centre, is also within easy reach.

Additional Information
The lease was granted in 1964 for 1000 years and the property also has a share of the freehold.

The seller informs us that the service and maintenance charges amount to approximately £128 per month.

detailedDescription: An excellent, spacious two double bedroom top floor conversion apartment set a grand Victorian house. Located on a tree lined avenue within a short walk of Surbiton mainline station and high street. The many benefits include a good size living room with ample sitting and dining space a period fireplace and sash window. A separate modern fitted kitchen with a built-in oven hob and hood. Two generous size double bedrooms. There is a modern white bathroom suite with a shower over the bath. Gas central heating. Sold with a Share of the Freehold a lease in excess of 900 years and no onward chain.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Brae Court, Kingston Hill, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Superb, bright, two double bedroom upper floor apartment with lift access, communal roof terrace, in this stylish gated development, it is within the catchment of coombe infants, juniors, girls and boys schools as well as other north kingston schools including tiffin boys, kingston grammer and is next to kingston hospital and norbiton train station with trains to waterloo taking just 24 minutes, or 10 -15 minute walk into central kingston, or 8 minute walk to richmond park (kingston gate)

The property is inside this fabulous gated and secure private residential block with beautiful mature communal gardens and off road parking and with lift access or stairs to the apartment. It comprises of good size entrance hall with all rooms leading from this, large bright living and dining room with superb south facing views to the rear of the property, over the communal gardens to Kingston Town Centre, . The master bedroom also faces the rear and has built in wardrobes and the second is a small double/large single, once again with built in wardrobes. The Kitchen has been recently updated with built in units and worktops and free standing appliances, the bathroom is fully tiled with shower over bath. This really is a sizeable 2 bedroom property with impressive views both to the front and rear

Brea Court is one of the most beautiful and well kept apartment complexes in the area, it has an art deco style to the internal decoration of the communal areas, the gardens are superb and are a delight to stroll around or picnic in, there is also a communal roof terrace for residents with lift access and the apartment also benefits from residential parking for one car and gated vehicle and pedestrian access giving both security and peace.

Brae Court is conveniently located close to Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities. The A3 offering fast access to central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 is also close at hand.

The nearest train station at Norbiton is just a short walk along Wolverton Avenue. This provides frequent services to London Waterloo and Vauxhall (approximately 20 to 25 minutes) with their underground links to points throughout the city. The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses and tennis and squash clubs.

Richmond Park, the largest of the capital’s eight Royal Parks at 2,368 acres of natural beauty, is close by and provides a picturesque setting to watch the abundant wildlife, or to take long walks, cycle or horse rides.

Theatres at Wimbledon and Richmond are popular with local residents, with many a new production debuting here before launching in the West End and both also have an excellent choice of restaurants. There are numerous private, state, and International schools for all ages within the immediate vicinity, including Coombe Hill Infant and Junior School, Coombe Girls and Boys, Rokeby School for boys, Holy Cross Prep School for girls, Marymount International, Kings College School as well as Kingston Grammar, Tiffin Boys and Girls Schools, most within walking distance or short bus/car journey.

Council tax Band C

EPC band D

Service Charge is approx £2000 pa. (but includes heating and hot water)

Ground Rent £150

Lease - 100 years

Viewing is strictly by appointment only through sole agents Greenwoods Residential Sales.

Important Information

Measurements, areas and distances are approximate. Floor plans and photographs are for guidance purposes only and must not be relied upon for any purpose. All appliances listed in these details are only ‘as seen’ and have not been tested by Greenwoods Residential, nor have we sought certification of warranty or service, unless otherwise stated. These details are offered on the understanding that all negotiations are made through this company. Neither these particulars, nor verbal representations, form part of any offer or contract, and their accuracy cannot be guaranteed.

Offer Procedure

Greenwoods Residential, is contracted by the seller to establish how anyone who wishes to make an offer on this property intends to fund its purchase and their buying status. When making an offer on this property, you will be asked a series of questions relating to the means by which you intend to buy the property and whether or not your offer is dependent on the sale of another property. This information, along with the amount of your offer, will then be forwarded onto our client for consideration. All offers on this property should be made through this office.

This stunning, modern one bedroom apartment is finished to an exceptional standard throughout. Boasting two private balconies and no onward chain, this is a must-see property.

You are instantly impressed by the spacious reception room with its floor to ceiling windows which flood the living and dining areas in natural light and provide stunning views and sunsets. The high specification, fully fitted kitchen is situated just off this room - perfect for entertaining.

The double bedroom has its own large balcony and an extensive walk-in storage cupboard. There is also a beautifully designed bathroom and a useful cycle store located within the building.

The property is perfectly located in the heart of Hampton Wick with the River Thames, Bushy Park, Home Park, Kingston town centre and Teddington High street all on its doorstep. There are excellent transport links being close to Hampton Wick station with direct access to London Waterloo.

detailedDescription:
Property Overview

An excellent family home in immaculate condition with three bedrooms located within close proximity to Surbiton town centre with its array of excellent schools, shops, supermarkets, bars and mainline station for excellent links into central London.

Upon the ground floor is a large entrance hall with storage space leading to a downstairs WC, a study/office (which could become a 4th bedroom, if required) and a very large inviting living room complete with a featured fireplace.

There are double French doors that open into the extended kitchen/ dining area with a range cooker and all other appliances house within beautiful light oak kitchen furniture. Velux windows ensure plenty of light and double doors open onto the large private and mature sunny garden.

This home is simply stunning, boasting 3 Bedrooms, the Master bedroom has built-in stylish wardrobes with sliding doors as well as modern sunken lighting that can be tailored to your liking. Furthermore, having two well-presented bedrooms, a double and a single offering excellent accommodation. The bathroom situated on this floor has a tastefully modern suite with tiled marble floor and is completed with a heated towel rail.

Area Overview

Just 0.7 miles from the property is Surbiton station with regular services running through Raynes Park, Wimbledon and Clapham Junction to London Waterloo making it an ideal location for London commuters. Surbiton and Kingston also hold a vast number of shops and restaurants including the Bentall centre with over 50 stores.

There is a vast majority of top-performing schools in the area, including Surbiton High School (0.6miles), Bedlesford School (0.7) and Lime Tree Primary Schoo (0.6).

Council Tax Band: E

detailedDescription:
A one bedroom retirement apartment located on the ground floor which has been redecorated and re-carpeted Riverstone Court was constructed by McCarthy & Stone (Developments) Ltd and comprises 38 properties arranged over 3 floors each served by lift. The Development Manager can be contacted from various points within each property in the case of an emergency. For periods when the Development Manager is off duty there is a 24 hour emergency Appello call system. Each property comprises an entrance hall, lounge, kitchen, one or two bedrooms and bathroom. It is a condition of purchase that residents be over the age of 60 years, or in the event of a couple, one must be over the age of 60 years and the other over 55 years.
Please speak to our Property Consultant if you require information regarding Event Fees that may apply to this property.
