address: London Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A very well proportioned two double bedroom apartment with residents parking, within an incredibly popular period development in the heart of Kingston town centre and offered with no onward chain.
The property

A very well proportioned two double bedroom apartment with residents parking, within an incredibly popular period development in the heart of Kingston town centre and offered with no onward chain. Situated on the ground floor, the property offers a very spacious entrance hall as well as a large reception dining room complete with feature fireplace. As one of the largest of the designs within the development, a separate eat-in kitchen/diner is provided with a modern kitchen and integrated appliances, as well as two large double bedrooms and modern bathroom. Externally, the property opens out onto a beautifully maintained communal gardens whilst residents are provided with parking. In addition, it is possible to rent a parking space within a secure and enclosed communal garage. Built between 1933 and 1935, Norbiton Hall stands on a historic site which between 1309 and 1535 formed part of a large estate owned by Edward Lovekyn and then by John Lovekyn, respectively bailiff and mayor of Kingston, who founded and developed the grade II listed Lovekyn Chapel standing on the corner between Old London Road and Queen Elizabeth Road. The chapel is located in the grounds of Tiffins Grammar School.
The location

Norbiton Hall is located on Birkenhead Avenue and London road and within a short walk of Kingston town centre as well as Norbiton's parade of shops on Coombe Road. Kingston's Zone 6 railway station is within 0.5 miles (9 minute walk) and offers an incredibly frequent connection to London terminals in two directions. Kingston town cente is comprehensive with a wide range of well known names as well as independent shops. It is nestled along the River Thames where a number of restaurants can be found also.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
The Personal Agent is pleased to present this four bedroom semi-detached home, situated in a highly sought after road in Motspur Park with the train station just 0.4 miles away as well as green open spaces nearby.

The property comprises an entrance hall with access to understairs storage, doors to; front aspect kitchen/dining room with space for a dining table, wall mounted boiler, the kitchen comprises a range of eye and base level units with builtin oven and hob with space for further utilities, rear aspect living room with a door opening to the rear garden, from the hall there is a door to the downstairs W/C.

On the first floor there are three bedrooms, two doubles and a single, one with an ensuite shower room and fitted wardrobe, all served by the family bathroom. On the second floor there is a further double bedroom with built-in units.

Outside the rear garden measures approximately 80ft with a paved terrace across the rear of the property, ideal for outside entertaining, the remainder of the garden is mainly laid to gravel with mature planted borders, to the rear of the garden there is a decked terrace and a shed.

Motspur Park is a village in its own right, with a row of shops, including a library, Chemist and a pub, The Earl Beatty. There are 6 playing fields (green belt and cannot be build on) close by, including the Sir Joseph Hood memorial playing fields, which includes tennis courts, playing area and a putting green, and the Mayflower Park is just short walk away, the small wetlands are home to herons, cormorants, kingfishers and swans. Motspur Park is also is home of the Fulham Football club training ground.

Motspur Park Station is just 0.4 miles away and offers 4 trains hourly with direct links to Wimbledon (6 Minutes) as well as Waterloo (25 minutes) providing easy access to tube lines. There are bus routes at the end of the road providing links to Kingston and Tooting Broadway which offer a more comprehensive range of shopping facilities, with a Tesco Superstore just a 6 minute walk away.

The property is ideally located for access to the A3, offering easy access to London and Surrey.

Freehold

address: Richmond Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A 1930’s build detached family house set on broad plot with garage, off street parking and 84’ west facing rear garden.

The current owner is in the process of obtaining planning permission to allow for substantial extension, re-model and modernisation to allow for a 2500-3000 square foot home incorporating five double bedrooms and four bathrooms.

The ground floor will comprise a large reception, excellently proportioned study/second reception and incredible kitchen/dining/family room to the rear with separate utility and W.C. Furthermore, a substantial garden office is proposed to the rear of the garden.

The property is located on Richmond Road in North Kingston and within each reach of the River Thames, providing the option for beautiful strolls through Canbury Gardens into Kingston town centre or towards Richmond.

It falls within the catchment for a number of incredibly well-regarded local state and independent schools, whilst other amenities such as Albany Park Canoe & Sailing Centre and Canbury Gardens Tennis Centre are close by.

Kingston's Zone 6 railway station provides a frequent service into London terminals offering up to nine trains an hour in two directions and is just 0.9 miles (18 minute walk) from the property.

Regular bus links into Kingston and Richmond offer alternative transport links whilst Ham Parade is just a short walk away.

address: Coombe Park, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
An incredible opportunity to acquire a superbly presented, substantial family home located within one of the most prestigeous gated developments within South West London. Coombe Park is a tranquil, yet highly convenient location with easy access to the A3 for Gatwick & Heathrow Airports whist being only 6 miles to Knightsbridge with Richmond Park & Wimbledon Common a short cycle away.

The spacious entrance hall including a marbled tiled floor, contemporary crystal chandelier and bespoke, integrated fish tank leads to two generous reception rooms, a huge conservatory with access to the garden and stunning kitchen/family room designed by Halcyon Interiors. The kitchen includes an excellent range of units by Alno with integrated appliances by Miele and Gaggenau. The dining/family area includes a drop down projector screen. A study, utility room and guest cloakroom completes the ground floor. An impressive indoor pool and jacuzzi are located on the lower ground floor.

The first floor comprises a huge master bedroom suite with doors to a balcony overlooking the garden. There is an extensive fully fitted ‘his and hers’ dressing area leading to the magnificent marble slab en-suite bathroom. This includes a whirlpool bath and rainfall walk- in shower by Ripples of Mayfair. There are three further bedrooms all with en suite facilities, fitted wardrobes and LED TVs. The first floor self-contained staff accommodation, accessed via the integrated garage, offers a kitchen/reception room, bedroom and shower room.

The second floor provides two further bedroom suites plus large reception room and study/ third bedroom.

Coombe Park is a highly sought after, prestigious gated community offering a tranquil environment while being ideally located close to Kingston, Wimbledon & Wimbledon Village centres with Richmond Park & Wimbledon Common easily accessible. The area offers a wide range of sporting activities including several golf courses and popular schools.

detailedDescription:
The ground floor, with underfloor heating throughout, has a spacious entrance hall with a grand walnut staircase to access all floors with atrium, off which is the first reception room currently set up as a cinema room with built in projector screen. Through double doors in the entrance hall the property opens up into a contemporary kitchen/dining/reception room with separate utility room, bay window in the dining area, kitchen island and skylights above letting in plenty of natural light. Sliding doors from the kitchen/dining room open out to the south west facing garden creating the perfect entertaining space.

On the first floor the spacious galleried landing currently comprises a study area and access to four bedrooms. The principle suite located on this floor includes a walk in wardrobe, an en suite bathroom with separate shower and Juliette balcony. A further bedroom has an en suite shower room and the remaining two have access to a Jack and Jill shower room. Upstairs on the second floor is a further bedroom with sky lights and eaves storage, a games room and a spacious bathroom. At the front of the property is a large, walled driveway and side access to the rear garden.

Outside
The spacious 180ft garden comprises a landscaped paved seating area including two striking water features either side and located at the end is a large, modern outbuilding with two sets of bi-folding doors, already set up for internet, telephone, TV and utilities, perfect for use as a home office, games room or storage for classic cars.

Situation
The property is located in Southborough conservation area and has convenient access to both Surbiton and Kingston town centres with their array of shops, restaurants and transport links. Surbiton station is just 0.5 miles away with a frequent fast service to London Waterloo. Surbiton and nearby Kingston, Wimbledon and Hampton are renowned for their excellent state and independent schools making the area popular with families.

A wonderful semi-detached family home offered for sale in beautiful condition throughout. There is also a cloakroom and a fourth bedroom and upstairs there is a master bedroom with an en suite shower room, two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The landscaped rear garden has some established plants and trees as well as a patio which provides an incredible serene, sunny oasis to entertain, enjoy morning coffee, or evening meals. There is also a good size studio room and a large covered area to the side with access to the front and the property also has parking for two cars to the front. EPC rating C. The buyer will fully benefit from the solar panels by receiving up to £200 a year of Feed-In Tariff and saving on electricity bills. There is no onward chain and viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Presenting this elegant and stylish apartment positioned in the heart of Kingston upon Thames.
This exquisite property is the perfect blend of being both expansive and sophisticated. Nestled peacefully in the highly desirable Avante Court development the property sits just 0.6 miles from Kingston Train Station making this the perfect home for commuters and for those who are looking to take advantage of the first class shopping facilities Kingston upon Thames has to offer.
Spanning across 538 Sq. Ft the property enjoys generous room sizes that are uncommon with similar apartments within Kingston upon Thames and this is noticed immediately upon entering the property. Boasting well-balanced accommodation arranged off a central hallway the property comprises one double bedroom benefitting with built in storage. Just off the hallway is the contemporary bathroom boasting a modern white suite and is tiled from floor to ceiling.
The hub of the home is a testament to open-concept design starting with the kitchen, fully integrated and equipped with fridge-freezer, washing machine, dishwasher and oven and hob.
Avante Court is perfectly positioned in the centre of Kingston upon Thames with easy access to London Waterloo via Kingston Train Station and the River Thames for those who enjoy long walks on those warm summer evenings.

The added bonus is the large, secluded, well maintained communal garden to the rear - a wonderful place to enjoy and entertain.

This apartment is ideally located close to Surbiton mainline station where you can get the fast train into Waterloo (17 min), the high street that has a variety of shops, bars and restaurants and a number of primary and secondary schools with outstanding Ofsted results.

detailedDescription:
A well presented extended four bedroom semi detached family home offering bright and spacious accommodation in the heart of Berrylands.

Ideally located in this quiet residential road just a short walk from good local shops and amenities, and excellent bus routes located conveniently for Surbiton and Berrylands mainline stations serving London Waterloo with a travel time of 20 to 30 minutes. It is situated in the catchment area for some top schools to include Tiffin Boys and Girls, Surbiton High, Nonsuch High, Grand Avenue Primary and Christ Church Primary to name but a few.

This property comprises a spacious porch and entrance hall leading to the large through lounge, dining room to rear extension, ground floor WC and good sized fitted kitchen.

Stairs to the first floor leads to a spacious landing. There is a master bedroom to rear with en-suite shower room, three further bedrooms and the family bathroom. Further features include gas central heating and double glazing.

Outside this property benefits from a large well maintained rear garden (88 ft) with a summer house, resin paved and decked area. To the front there is off street parking, an integral garage and a newly done resin driveway.

address: Royal Quarter, Seven Kings Way, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A very well proportioned two bedroom, two bathroom apartment within the ever popular Royal Quarter development.

Situated on the third floor, this bright purpose built apartment is incredibly well presented throughout and enjoys aspects towards the communal gardens. The property comprises a generous and open plan kitchen/recepion/dining room. The kitchen comes with a range of intergrated appliances, whilst the reception spills out onto a larger than average L shaped balcony. Two bedrooms are provided as well as two modern bathrooms, one of which is en-suiite to the main bedroom.

Residents at the Royal Quarter benefit from a number of exclusive benefits including concierge and gym whilst the property is provided with a secure underground parking space.

The Royal Quarter is an award winning development, built by St George and completed in 2006.

One of the biggest draws of this very popular development is its location, situated within moments of the River Thames, Kingston town centre and railway station.

Kingston's Zone 6 railway station offers an incredibly frequent service, in two directions, to London terminals. Canbury Gardens is also on the development's doorstep, offering the opportunity to benefit from leisurely strolls along the River Thames. A number of pubs and restaurants line the River at Kingston Riverside as well.

Kingston offers a wide variety and choice when it comes to education and the property falls within close proximity of a number of them, both state and independent as well primary and secondary.

Richmond Park's Kington Gate is also within reasonable distance and, as London's largest, it offers over 2500 acres of Royal parkland.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

***Video Tour Available upon request***We are delighted to offer to the market this charming and deceptively spacious three bedroom house located on Park Road in the heart of Hampton Wick. This beautiful period property has been owned by the vendors for over 25 years and has been a very happy and well-loved family home. The well- presented accommodation briefly comprises: Entrance hall with space for a side unit and stairs up to first floor, a spacious dual aspect reception room providing dining area and living area with attractive feature fireplace with Yorkshire sandstone surround and log burning stove, attractive fitted shelves and cupboards to the alcoves and oak floors. Towards the rear of the property there is a ground floor w.c. And a breakfasting kitchen with a range of fitted wall and base units with granite worktops, Belfast sink, integrated appliances and a useful utility cupboard with plumbing for washing machine and space for a tumble dryer. There are double French doors that open from the kitchen onto the private courtyard providing an enjoyable al fresco dining space. To the first floor, there is a good sized landing area illuminated by a window located over the stairs, there are three good sized double bedrooms, the largest located to the front of the property with fitted wardrobes and an enclosed shower cubicle, a second large double bedroom follows with fitted wardrobe and workstation ideal for home working and to the rear of the property there is a third double bedroom leading onto the family bathroom/w.c. With a white three piece suite and attractive tiling with a vanity sink unit with Kirkland slate and cherrywood. From the landing area there is loft access, the vendor has informed that this is boarded and insulated with light and pull-down ladder and provides a good-sized storage space. Externally to the front of the property there is on-street residents permit parking available and to the rear of the property there is a good sized private enclosed courtyard garden with flower beds, and well-kept mature shrubs, plants, lights, flagstones and gate leading to the rear of the property providing an enjoyable and pleasant outside space flowing conveniently from the breakfasting kitchen with ample space for dining table and chairs. The property benefits from gas-fired central heating and replacement double glazing throughout most of the property.
All in all, this is a beautifully presented period property with a great deal of charm and character, a unique and welcoming family home providing conveniently located accommodation for a variety of buyers with viewing coming highly recommended. Park Road is one of Hampton Wick's sought-after streets with a range of character properties and is located just off Hampton Wick High Street with a variety of local shops and amenities and transport links with Hampton Wick Station providing train services to London in approximately 30 minutes. Royal Bushy Park, Home Park, Royal Paddick's allotments are also within very easy walking distance as is Kingston Town Centre with a range of leisure and shopping activities on hand. ***Video Tour Available upon request***

address: Cleves Court, 16-18 St. Mark's Hill, Surbiton KT6
detailedDescription:
Located less than five minutes’ walk to Surbiton train station with multiple options of trains directly linking to London Waterloo, the fastest of which is only 16 minutes, this extremely well sized ground floor, two double bedroom apartment not only has one of the very best locations available, but also boasts rooms sizes far beyond normal expectations of apartments around the Surbiton area.
Immediately after walking through the front door you will notice the amount of space on offer and tiled corridor giving a sense of brightness and clean lines. You will be greeted into other parts of the property with beautiful wood flooring, which extends through and into the lounge and bedrooms. The bathroom is tiled from floor to ceiling and benefits from a modern white suite with a shower over the bath. Beyond the bathroom is the master bedroom, containing large built-in wardrobes which allows you to take full advantage of the entirety of the floor space, the second double bedroom is spacious with more than enough space for storage and a double bed .
Low voltage lighting throughout the flat following a recent rewiring of and venetian blinds allows brightness as well as privacy throughout the flat.
The well-proportioned lounge not only enjoys a spacious living area but room for a dining area and boasts a large window with venetian blinds for privacy allowing natural light to flood into the room. A good size separate fitted kitchen features tiled flooring, gas hob, fridge freezer, dishwasher and washing machine and plenty of storage. Further benefits include a private garage in a self-contained residents parking area and visitors parking at the front of the development.
The flat is a shared freehold which has numerous benefits and facilitates the efficient management and control of the block through a residents committee.
Offered completely chain free and benefitting from a share of the freehold, this is a fantastic opportunity for anyone who is looking for a spacious property, which not only has one of the best locations for commuting, but also has amazing access to Surbiton town centre and all the shopping and lifestyle benefits including bars and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Property Description

Chancellors are delighted to offer this well presented split level 3 double bedroom maisonette with a balcony to the market.

Property Details

This property boasts three double Bedroom split level, a balcony, open plan kitchen/living room, bathroom and additional w/c. Double glazing and a Lease on excess of 100 year. This maisonette further benefits being close to local schools and amenities and easy access to the A3 and public transport links.

An early viewing is highly recommended.
This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold.

This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.

Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.

The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.

The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.

Referral Arrangements

The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted.

Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive payment for the recommendation and you will be informed of any referral arrangement and payment prior to any services being taken by you.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

***Video tour available*** An immaculately presented, excellently located one bedroom ground floor apartment is offered to the market with no upper chain. The property is offered with vacant possession and has recently been redecorated throughout and offers its next owner the opportunity to move in and enjoy the property straight away. The well-proportioned light and airy, welcoming accommodation briefly comprises: Secure communal entrance, private entrance hall with three convenient storage cupboards, an inviting reception room opening onto the kitchen/diner with a large window overlooking the garden to the front of the property and onto open green spaces beyond, attractive flooring and fitted kitchen units with a range of attractive cupboards, washing machine and a newly installed electric oven and hob. There is ample space for a dining table and chairs making this an ideal space in which to relax and entertain.
There is a good-sized double bedroom with a large built-in wardrobe with newly fitted carpet and a pleasant shower room/wc with a white suite, large shower and contemporary tiling. There is a large private additional storage space located in the block on the ground floor providing very useful shed style versatile storage. The property is very well presented and would be ideally suited to a variety of buyers given its neutral decoration providing a blank canvas on which to place one's own stamp.
Externally there is a pleasant communal garden area to the front with lawn, shrubs and flowerbeds overlooking a pleasant green space providing ideal outdoor spaces in which to enjoy the warmer months. On street parking is available. Cowper Road is located on the perimeters of Ham Common, home to the local cricket club and charming annual fairs. The flat has a rural outlook within walking distance of Ham Gate and Richmond Park. A variety of local shops and amenities are close at hand on Tudor Drive and Ham Parade which holds a monthly farmers market. Perfectly situated between Kingston upon Thames and Richmond upon Thames.
The property is offered with 92 years remaining on the lease. Ground rent of £10 a year and annual service charge of £974.62. Viewing comes highly recommended.

description
A rare opportunity to purchase this highly sought after four bedroom Detached Berg-design family residence located on one of New Malden's most premier "Coombeside" roads within the catchment for numerous sought after school catchments, including Coombe Girls and Coombe Infants.

Additional benefits include garage to side, off-street parking, potential to extend further into the loft and rear (stpp). Internal viewing recommended for this rare to the market, highly sought after family home.

Property Description

A well-presented five bedroom semi detached house in Chessington that includes an annex with off street parking for several cars.

Property Details

Chancellors are delighted to welcome to the market this five bedroom property set on a spacious corner plot ideal for extension potential STPP. The property is located within close proximity to both Chessington Main line stations as well as Tolworth train station, a number of local amenities and within catchments of a number of outstanding local schools.

The property currently comprises of five bedrooms which are spread out over two floors one of which is located in an annex area with direct access through to the kitchen dining room, there is also an advantage that the property has an rsj fitted between the two kitchens so the wall can be taken out to make a larger kitchen. There are also two additional family bathrooms and an additional reception room.
The property is set on a spacious and rarely available corner plot which offers huge potential to extend the property further STPP. The large garden also houses a green house and a large shed and the house also benefits from CCTV being installed. With so much to offer we recommend your earliest viewing to avoid missing out on a property sure to have high levels of interest.

detailedDescription:
A superb and rarely available spacious five bedroom link detached 1950s built chalet bungalow. Situated on a spacious plot and its own private driveway this property is offered in immaculate condition throughout. This lovely home comprises welcoming entrance hall, spacious living room, a conservatory overlooking the mature west facing rear garden, stunning modern fitted open plan kitchen/ dining area, three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The first floor offers a further two double bedrooms with a modern jack and jill bathroom with plenty of eves storage. Guilford avenue is located in a lovely quiet residential road near to all the local shops and amenities that Surbiton has to offer and only a ten minute walk (0.6 miles) from Surbiton station. Must be viewed to appreciate all the fine features this property has to offer.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Summary
We are proud to present this large and spacious, three bedroom, semi-detached chalet bungalow situated in the highly sought after Seaforth Avenue, boasting three double bedrooms, two bathrooms and large private rear.

Description
Accommodation to the ground floor comprises of a bright entrance hallway, three piece bathroom suite, front double bedroom with bay window, modern fully fitted kitchen with dining area and living room to the rear with doors leading to a lovely mature rear garden with sun trap to the rear of the garden. The shed located in the garden also benefits from power.

The first floor features a spacious master bedroom with free standing wardrobes and a modern three piece en-suite shower room and a single children's bedroom with eave storage.

Further additional benefits include side access, ample storage space in loft above the living room and further potential to extend (STPP).

Seaforth Avenue is situated in the popular Motspur Park area of New Malden with a variety of amenities on its doorstep including a 24 hour Tesco, post office, library, butchers and hairdressers.

There are ample schools in the area covering all ages with lots of child friendly places within walking distance including, Sir Joseph Hood Park and Rascals soft play.

In addition, Seaforth Avenue is located with easy access to either Motspur Park or Raynes Park stations, bus routes to Kingston or Wimbledon and quick access to the main A3.

A viewing is highly recommended!

address: Riverstone Court, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Retirement development exclusively for those aged 60 and over.

This apartment has been refurbished throughout by the current owner and now benefits from a Brand New Shower Room (with window), Modern kitchen as well as being recarpeted and decorated. Situated on the top floor and at the end of the development this larger than average corner flat benefits from plenty of natural light and with the neutral decor giving you a sense of being bright and airy throughout.

This apartment really is one of a kind within a popular development and is ready for someone to move into straightaway and with the added benefits of being close to car park and other amenities, as well as views over gardens and plenty of natural light throughout it trually is a lovely flat.

Kingston town centre. Brief description; 1 double bedroom with built-in wardrobe, reception room, modern shower room with window, modern kitchen and hallway with airing/storage cupboard

The development itself benefits from a daily Development Manager, Appello 24hr service (Pull cord system), laundry room and a Residents' lounge. In addition, Kingston Hospital is only a 2 minute drive away. Despite being an urban development Riverstone still benefits from an attractive front garden and secluded patio area accessible from the residents' lounge. If a town environment is your priority, Riverstone Court is a great choice!

Kingston Bus and rail stations are moments away, with easy access to London, Richmond, Heathrow and many other local destinations. During the summer months Kingston riverside really comes alive with regular boat trips up and down the river to Hampton Court, Richmond and beyond. For the outdoor lovers, Richmond Park with its abundance of wild and plant life is only a short drive away. Within the 3.69 sq. Miles of Royal parkland, Richmond Park is home to many free roaming deer, and with its meandering walking and bike trails complemented by pleasant cafés, it is easy to see why the park attracts visitors from all over the world and is a real bonus for the local community.

detailedDescription:
Summary
Two double bedroom penthouse apartment positioned within this highly requested development that is just a few years old!

Description
The property boasts far reaching views over the chimney tops from every room. Other features include two double bedrooms, a private balcony, two bathrooms and a secure underground parking space.

Ewell Road offers a wide selection of local restaurants, convenience stores and a co-op. Central London is so easily accessible either by road or rail, City life is within easy reach. The A3 is under a mile away giving access to the M25 and the rest of the motorway network. Surbiton Station is a short walk away providing several trains per hour to both Clapham Junction and Waterloo (15 minutes on the fast train). For your down-time at home, Surbiton and Kingston town centres offer everything you need, from high street stores, cafes, bars and restaurants to cinema, bowling and theatre. There are many open green spaces to relax and enjoy making the weekend wind-down effortless.

Specification:
* Communal roof terrace with far reaching views
* Two generous storage cupboards in the hallway
* Fully fitted interior designed kitchen
* Silestone worktop and stainless steel splashback
* Amtico (sun bleached oak) floor finish
* Fully integrated AEG appliances
* Video entry system
* Lift serviced
* Secure underground parking
* Cycle storage
* 10 year building warranty
* Private balcony

address: Panther Quay, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
Designed to provide the best mix of property and the water, this 2 bedroom yacht-house is modelled on modern streamline motor yachts yet appointed to allow high ceilings, excellent natural light, picture windows and great views.

Accommodation comprises stylish open-plan integrated kitchen and dining area with solid wood flooring and bi-fold doors leading to a large entertaining deck. On the lower floor a large reception room below an atrium has extensive views upstream whilst the spacious master bedroom with en suite bath and shower has wrap around windows looking downstream. The second bedroom with en suite looks directly out onto the river. There is a separate guest WC and various utility areas and there is the potential to easily add a 3rd bedroom should a buyer require and plans can be provided for this from the owner.

This outer well insulated vessel with full heating and air conditioning has uninterrupted views and is the trophy of three yacht houses and is located on a well maintained secure mooring next to Kingston Bridge. The superb Kingston Town centre is a short walk away with its abundance of shops, restaurants, bars and gyms. Hampton Wick railway station is a short walk. Mooring charges are £11,200 per annum. Current mooring agreement is until 31 August 2113.

address: Alfred Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
Offered to the market is this charming three bedroom end of terrace Victorian family home. Located on a quiet residential street close to some good schools, transport, green spaces and offered with no onward chain.

Currently arranged over two floors and extended already on the first floor, the property offers the opportunity to further extend both into the loft and to the rear on the ground floor, (STPP). Currently, the property comprises two separate receptions with separate kitchen and bathroom. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms and further single bedroom, with a study or dressing areaoff this room. Externally, the property opens out onto a very generous, south facing rear garden which would be great for families or entertaining, there is also a front garden too.

Alfred Road is a ever popular residential street in Kingston and is ideally located for access back into the town centre. In addition it falls within the catchment for well-regarded local schools with outstanding Ofsted resuts and conveniently situated for Athelstan recreation ground. It is also located within a mile of both the River Thames, Surbiton and Kingston railway station which gives you a fast train service to London Waterloo.

Viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Property Description

Central location close to the Station and Town Centre and set on the new River Walk development a stunning luxury two double bedroom apartment.

Property Details

The apartment is situated on the sixth floor, the top floor of the apartment block.
General

- Flush oak veneered apartment internal doors
-White sliding doors on to balcony from living/dining area and master bedroom
- Feature 144mm high skirting throughout
- Feature 75mm architrave throughout
- Contemporary polished chrome door handles and fittings
- Fitted wardrobes in both bedrooms
- All units are covered by a 10 year NHBC building warranty starting October 2014
-Underfloor heating and ventilation system throughout
- Double glazed windows with perfectly fitted bespoke Luxaflex blinds in the living/dining area and master bedroom
Kitchen

- Customer designed European fitted kitchens
- Stone worktops with recessed drainer shelf
- Stainless steel single undermounted bowl with insinkerator under sink waste disposal unit and mixed tap with pull down spray head
- Siemens stainless steel appliances including fan assisted electric oven, induction hob, microwave combination oven, dishwasher, built-in fridge freezer and washer dryer (located in utility cupboard)
Bathroom & en-suite

- Villeroy & Boch sanitaryware
- Polished chrome brassware
- White low profile shower tray to ensuite with clear glass screen
- Bespoke wall mirror with demister
- Oak wall display with glass shelving
- Below sink vanity cupboard with countertop
- Chrome electric heated towel radiators
- Porcelain stoneware tiling to floor and walls surrounding bath/shower
Electrical

- Home Network System with Cat 5 for Hi Fi Video, TV, Data and Audio connections
- Telephone/Home Network points to living/dining area, kitchen and bedrooms
- Mains operated smoke/heat detectors with battery
- Directional LED ceiling downlighters with mood lighting and digital dimmer to the living/dining room and master bedroom
-Skirting LED lighting strip in the hallway
Security

- Door entry system with audio visual colour screen
- CCTV security system to entrance lobbies and external areas
- Fused spur for future alarm system installation by owner
Heating

-Open Water Heat Pump System
- Underfloor heating throughout
- Chrome electric heated towel radiator in bathrooms
Flooring

- Porcelain stoneware tiling to wet areas
- Engineered wood flooring in hallway, living/dining and kitchen areas
- Carpet to bedrooms
- Softwood timber decking to balcony (currently covered by artificial grass)
Communal terrace

-Access to a large communal terrace and gardens on the 5th floor of the development
Bike storage

- A secure communal bike storage room is located on the ground floor of the development

address: Grange Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
Stunning two double bedroom, raised ground floor apartment, in this beautiful period property that has been beautifully upgraded, open plan living, dining and kitchen with beautiful french windows with views to the rear or east, perfect for morning sun - it is part of A small boutique residential block of just 6 flats in this period building, with allocated parking and A private half shed or bike lock up. It is located on A quiet no through road just A few minutes walk from the centre of kingston.



This really is a stunning apartment consisting of a central communal stairs to the front entrance, leading to the large central entrance and stairway, the apartment its own internal front door, at the rear of the property is the bright, stylish, open plan living/dining/kitchen with brick faced feature fireplace, two large inwards opening French windows both with black external railings. The kitchen has smart high gloss units and a white quartz worktop with electric hob, oven, extractor and full-sized fridge freezer. There is a good sized second bedroom with side window and a fully tiled guest shower room and wc. The master bedroom is at the front of the property, it has stunning bay windows made up of three double sash, floor to ceiling windows ensuring the room is bathed in sunlight, there is also a beautiful ensuite shower room.

The apartment is immaculately presented throughout, with laminate flooring, wonderful high ceilings and has been finished throughout to a very good level, it also benefits from a long 105-year lease, and private allocated parking for one car, plus a separate half shed/bike store.

The property is located on this much sought after central Kingston upon Thames residential no through road, it is just 0.4 miles from Kingston railway station with trains to London Waterloo taking just 26 minutes, or a 5 minute walk into Kingston town centre with its wide selection of amazing shops, restaurants and bars, or riverside walks along the River Thames footpaths to either Hampton or Richmond.

Lease – 105 years (approx.)

Ground Rent £250 pa

Service Charge £126 pcm or £1520 pa (includes contribution to sinking fund)

Allocated Parking - 1 Car

Viewing is strictly by appointment only through Greenwoods Residential Sales & Lettings

This information, along with the amount of your offer, will then be forwarded onto our client for consideration. All offers on this property should be made through this office.

address: Coombe Park, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
The property, with accommodation over three floors, lies within beautifully landscaped grounds of approximately 0.39 of an acre and further benefits from 3 reception rooms, 2 studies, principal bedroom with en suite bathroom, and dressing area, 4 further bedrooms with one having a private study area, family bathroom, two showers (one en suite), guest cloakroom, forecourt for several cars.

Built Circa 1954, this delightful property boasts charm and character with a wonderful mature South facing rear garden with an amazing pond with waterfall feature and well tendered lawns. In July 2015, planning permission was granted for a new four storey detached family home of approx. 13,599 ft2 (1,263 m2) Gross Internal Area which will offer six bedrooms, 6 bathrooms, a self-contained staff annex, exceptional living space and garaging for six cars (Plans available upon request).(Consent number 15/14426/ful).<br/><br/>location<br/><br/>Coombe Park is a 32 acre, secure, private gated estate, set in leafy surroundings only 6.5 miles from Knightsbridge and within easy reach of central London, the South Coast and Heathrow and Gatwick airports via the A3 and M25 Motorway. With Richmond Park on the doorstep, the largest of the capital’s 8 Royal Parks and the biggest enclosed space in London, its 2,368 acres of natural beauty are home to the beautiful Isabella Plantation, Pembroke Lodge and herds of Red and Fallow deer. This fabulous area is also home to five golf clubs, including the prestigious Coombe Hill Club.

The All England Lawn Tennis Club and Wimbledon Village are a mere 5 minute drive away, where one can enjoy a variety of specialist boutiques and a wide range of restaurants catering for most tastes. Wimbledon Common is also close at hand, where one can enjoy a variety of activities from cycling to horse riding. Wimbledon Theatre is a popular choice for local residents with many a new production debuted before launching in the West End. Coombe, Kingston and Wimbledon are also home to a wealth of good schools catering for all ages, including private and state with a variety of international educational establishments. There are also private school buses serving schools further afield.

Directions

Turn off Kingston Hill into Coombe Park and continue until you reach the security gates. Once through, take the left fork where the property can be located on the right-hand side.

detailedDescription:
Summary
An attractive and beautifully presented extended three/ four bedroom semi-detached family home situated in a popular location. This super house enjoys exceptional ground floor living space, a pretty garden with a large timber cabin, a generous driveway. The property is 1/2 mile from the station.

Description
A most attractive spacious and beautifully presented extended three/ four bedroom semi-detached family home situated in a popular location. This super house enjoys exceptional ground floor living space which opens on to a pretty garden with a large cabin (potential work from home office), there is a generous driveway to the front. The property is located within just 1/2 of a mile from local shops, great local schools and Malden Manor Station.

Worcester Park & New Malden are located on the borders of Surrey & South West London. Located just 10 miles from Central London, It is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to London's Waterloo via Clapham Junction & Wimbledon in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. We are located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and London's Gatwick & Heathrow Airports. Local bus services will get you to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes.

The attractive & bustling High Street's enjoy a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Costa, Caffe Nero, Boots, wh Smiths & Superdrug as well as an array of independents. There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and a diverse array of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to the area's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks including the vast and picturesque Nonsuch Park, formally the site of Henry viii's Nonsuch Palace.

address: York Road, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
Introducing this two bedroom family home, boasting elegant and stylish interiors. The property is situated within close proximity to Kingston train station and Norbiton Train Station, less than a mile away offering frequent services to London Waterloo making the property perfect for commuters and those looking to take advantage of the first class shopping facilities Kingston upon Thames has to offer.
Bright and spacious the home's main living area is at the front of the property and enjoys generous floor space with a cosy fire place. The bathroom and kitchen are positioned beyond the lounge at the rear of the property which includes plenty of storage space with direct access to the private rear garden, perfect for entertaining guests. On the first floor is where the two double bedrooms are found both benefitting from built in storage. Further benefits include gas central heating and double glazed windows.
The property would make not only an ideal investment but also perfect for families looking to take advantage of the size and location of the property especially as it is offered to the market with no onward chain.

Kingston is renowned for its excellent schools and the property is positioned just a short distance from Kingston's lively shops providing first class shopping facilities, bars and restaurants.

address: Canbury Park Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Retaining much of its original charm and character features, the ground floor comprises a reception room to the front of the house with additional reception and kitchen to the rear.

The first floor offers two double bedrooms, the largest of which spans the width of the house, as well as large family bathroom.

Externally, the property opens out onto an incredibly bright and well-maintained, south facing garden with part-lawned and part-raised decking to optimise use of the sunshine captured.

The house is located on Canbury Park Road and within just 0.1 miles (2 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 railway station offering up to 7 trains an hour, in two directions, to London terminals.

Furthermore, all that the town centre has to offer is on your doorstep including a wide range of independent boutique style shops as well as the usual high street names including John Lewis and Bentalls. A wide range of cuisine is on offer with an eclectic mix of restuarants along the River Thames and Canbury Gardens is nearby for a leisurely stroll along the river.

The property also also falls within the catchment for Outstanding Ofsted rated schools. EPC=D

Description

This magnificent property is located at the Kingston end of Coombe Lane West and within 450m of Norbiton railway station which provides direct links to London Waterloo (25 mins) with at least four trains an hour at peak times. Kingston Town Center is only around one mile away and can be easily reached by taking bus 57 which is stopping in Coombe Lane West. Kingston upon Thames has an extensive range of shopping with the fabulous Bentalls shopping centre, John Lewis along with a Theatre and Cinema Complex. Richmond Park offers around 1500 acres of open space and is one of London's Royal Parks, known for its wild deer and is within one mile. The property is conveniently located for local schools with a number of fee/non fee paying schools within one mile.

Number 6 is a top floor three bedroom/two bathroom apartment featuring an impressive open-plan kitchen/dining/reception room and attractive views over the communal gardens from the private balcony.

The development is ideally located in this sought after Coombeside position between Kingston, New Malden and Wimbledon Village with their extensive range of shops, boutiques and restaurants. Norbiton Station which gives direct access into London Waterloo is close by and the A3, which serves both London & the M25, is easily accessible by car. The standard of schooling within Kingston & Coombe is excellent within both the private and state sectors. detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A spacious two double bedroom third floor apartment located in a purpose-built block and a popular residential riverside development in Teddington close to the River Thames. The property is offered for sale with vacant possession and no upper chain and is in need of refurbishment, offering buyers an ideal opportunity to purchase a property onto which they can place their own stamp.

The spacious accommodation briefly comprises: Communal entrance hall via secure entry phone system, with caretaker's office, lift to third floor, private inner hallway with storage cupboards, bedroom two/second reception room, kitchen, a large reception room with riverside view, bathroom/wc, master double bedroom with en-suite bathroom. The property benefits from double glazing, residents permit parking and communal riverside gardens. The vendor has indicated that this property will be sold with an extended lease.

Hamble Court is conveniently located in Broom Park just off Broom Road in Teddington, providing very easy access to Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames and Teddington. Royal Bushy Park and Home Park are also close by making this an ideal location of those looking to be close to local shops and amenities as well as green spaces.

Hampton Wick station is close by with trains to London Waterloo in approximately 35 minutes. A 3D virtual tour is available as are socially distance viewings, with viewing coming highly recommended. Please contact us for information regarding the lease. Service charge is £1,242.36 per half year and ground rent is £150 per half year.

detailedDescription:
A bright, beautifully presented two-bedroom, two- bathroom apartment in this period conversion, with two allocated parking spaces to the front of the property. Ideally located just a short walk from good bus links, local shops and within easy reach of both Kingston town centre and Surbiton high street. Surbiton mainline station offers regular fast trains into London Waterloo.

This character property comprises a spacious open plan kitchen/living area with a bay window to the front, a modern fitted kitchen and handy utility cupboard.

It boasts a good size master bedroom with an en-suite shower room and generous fitted wardrobes with additional storage above.

A second double bedroom can be found to the rear of the apartment, currently being used as a nursery but would make a perfect guest bedroom.

The apartment also offers a master bathroom with over bath shower.

Book A viewing 24/7 via our unique online service by clicking the link in the brochure or by telephone.

detailedDescription:
This immaculately presented rare one bedroom apartment with direct access to a private rear garden has been recently refurbished by the current owner to an exceptional standard throughout and is ideally located within walking distance to Kingston and Surbiton stations. Superbly designed to offer an abundance of natural light and well proportioned rooms throughout, this fully renovated property is the perfect blend of past and modern design. This well presented flat benefits from a semi open plan bespoke fitted modern integrated kitchen with quality appliances including a Bosch cooker, oven, microwave, angled black glass hood, dishwasher, fridge and a layer of kitchen cupboards giving lots of space for even the most avid cook. The property further benefits from a reception room to the rear of the building with access to the rear garden, contemporary bathroom, bedroom, additional storage areas externally (shed) and internally (main entrance lobby). This property is offered to the market with no onward chain and majority of the furniture and contents will be included.

detailedDescription:
Summary
We are delighted to offer this substantial, sympathetically extended, 6/7 double bedroom, 3 bathroom, semi-detached tudor influenced family residence, providing generously proportioned rooms and a versatile layout arranged over 3 floors. Offered to the market with no onward chain.

Description
We are delighted to offer this substantial, sympathetically extended, 6/7 double bedroom, 3 bathroom, semi-detached tudor influenced family residence, providing generously proportioned rooms and a versatile layout arranged over 3 floors. Offered to the market with no onward chain.

While this property is situated on one of New Malden's premier tree lined roads within a walking distance to the High Street, it also boasts a large extension just off the fully fitted kitchen with utility to the rear of the property, a light and airy dining room, a spacious home office/reception room, a front reception room, downstairs shower and WC, as well as another bedroom/music room to the ground floor.

Continued to the first floor are further 5 bedrooms and a family bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi bath. Continued to the second floor is a large master bedroom complete with en suite shower room, eaves storage and separate kitchenette.

Further benefits include a large paved driveway to park numerous vehicles, a lovely south facing private rear garden, complete with mature willow tree and shrubs. In addition this fully double glazed property has ample storage, gas fired central heating and a stylish warm theme throughout.

detailedDescription:
Summary
Barnard Marcus are delighted to welcome to the market this spacious and well presented two double bedroom family home with a wraparound garden ideal for extending the current home further STPP. A must view to avoid missing out!

Description
Barnard Marcus are delighted to welcome to the market this spacious and well presented two double bedroom family home with a wraparound garden ideal for extending the current home further STPP.
The property is situated within close proximity to local shops and is within easy access of both the M25 and the A3. Chessington South railway station is nearby with direct trains to London Waterloo (35 mins) and there is public bus services to both Epsom, Ewell and Kingston nearby. There is well regarded local schooling for all ages, both state and independent. Local amenities include the ever popular Chessington World of Adventures.
The property itself boasts two reception rooms, a modern kitchen with access directly out to the garden, two double bedrooms with a modern family bathroom. The property goes on to offer a garden which wraps around the rear and side of the property and would be ideal for extending the current home in to should you wish to increase the square footage of the property. Your earliest viewing is strongly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious two double bedroom modern apartment ideally located in this ever popular development in the heart of Kingston town centre with its wide range of shops, amenities, River Thames, excellent bus links and mainline train station.

This property comprises a spacious entrance hall with ample storage, open plan fitted kitchen/dining/living room with door onto the large private balcony, master bedroom with ensuite shower room, fitted wardrobes and doors to the balcony, further good sized double bedroom and modern bathroom.

Outside this property benefits from having access to the sun terrace to the top floor and communal gardens. Further benefits include lift access, entry video phone system and gated allocated parking.

Leasehold : 115 Years Approx.
Service Charge £274 pcm Approx.
Ground Rent £275pa. Approx.

General Information

Being Sold by goto Online Auction

Starting Bids from £470,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Online Auction. The Online Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

If the Buyer Information Pack has been produced and provided by goto Group any successful purchaser will be required to pay £354.00 (including VAT) towards the cost of the preparation of the pack. These can then be used by your solicitor to progress the sale.

There are no other fees or charges payable to the Auctioneer however, there are other costs to consider such as:
• Stamp Duty Land Tax (sdlt) is applicable if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England, Wales or Northern Ireland.

Property Description

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.
• You will need a Solicitor to act for you during the conveyancing and your Solicitor will advise you in relation to the associated costs. If you do not have a Solicitor, we can recommend the services of one of our Panel Solicitors.

detailedDescription:
Winkworth Surbiton are pleased to present this immaculate split level one bedroom apartment located in the heart of Surbiton on Victoria Road, which has immediate access to all of the local shops and eateries, such as Sainsburys, Meagans, Ex cellar & Wags n Tales. It is ony a few minutes’ walk to the Surbiton mainline station with a fast trainline service to London Waterloo which only takes 15-20 minutes.
The accommodation on offer comprises of a welcoming and light entrance hall leading up to a large landing that could be used as a dinning/office area space. There is a well-proportioned living room with an stunning feature fireplace. The modern kitchen has a range of matching wall and base units with contrasting granite work tops and a stainless-steel integrated extractor over the gas hob, and microwave. Further accommodation on this level is a large double bedroom and superb modern shower room which is finished to a high specification. This delightful property benefits from a wealth of period features, gas central heating and modern double-glazed windows. Viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Summary
** we are still open please call for viewings and valuations **

Barnard Marcus are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning and spacious three bedroom semi detached family home set on a popular and sought after residential road. Chessington Hill Park is a quiet and popular cul de sac.

Description
Barnard Marcus are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning and spacious three bedroom semi detached family home set on a popular and sought after residential road.

Chessington Hill Park is a quiet and popular cul de sac on the borders of Chessington/West Ewell, giving easy access to the A3, convenience from shops at Chessington North and its train station. For more comprehensive shopping both Epsom and Kingston are just a short drive away offering a variety of shops as well as entertainment, sports facilities and eateries. For those that enjoy the outside, Horton Country Park is just a short drive away.

The location also comes under four grammar school catchments based on selection criteria which are Tiffin Boys School, Sutton Grammar School for Boys, Tiffin Girls School, Nonsuch High School for Girls. In addition to this the property is also located within two outstanding state schools covering the nursery and primary schools which you can reached within 5-8 mins Danetree Primary School, West Ewell Primary School and Nursery.

The property itself boast three spacious bedrooms, a bright reception room, open plan kitchen dining room, modern family bathroom. The property also goes on to offer a private and landscaped rear garden which faces open grass fields which is ideal for keen joggers and dog walkers alike; along with off street parking to the front.

With so much to offer we recommend your earliest viewing to avoid missing out on this property.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented Victorian semi-detached property offering 940 sq ft of accommodation over two floors. The property offers the scope, subject to planning permission, to extend into the loft space to create two additional bedrooms and a separate bathroom.

Piper Road is a popular residential road ideally located for Fairfield Park, the River Thames and Richmond Park's Kingston Gate, which offers over 2,500 acres of Royal parkland to enjoy. Access to both Richmond and Kingston centres are incredibly convenient and the property falls within the catchment for a choice of Ofsted rated Outstanding state schools.

detailedDescription:
Property Description

A modern and deceptively spacious two double bedroom apartment that also includes two bathrooms in the heart of Kingston.

Property Details

The apartment is situated on a private first floor lobby offering privacy. Its contemporary interiors feature modern neutral colourways, accented by the warmth of natural materials.
Two, well-appointed bathrooms are calming spaces to enjoy.
General

- Flush oak veneered apartment internal doors
- Feature 125mm high skirting throughout
- Feature 75mm architrave throughout
- Contemporary polished chrome door handles and fittings
- Fitted wardrobes to both bedrooms
- All units are covered by a 10 year NHBC building warranty starting October 2014
- Ventilation system throughout
- Double glazed windows with perfectly fitted bespoke Sunwood venetian blinds
Kitchen

- Customer designed European fitted kitchens
- Stone worktops with recessed drainer shelf
- Stainless steel single bowl under-mounted sink with Insinkerator? Food waste dispenser, and mixed tap with pull down spray head
- Siemens stainless steel appliances including:
fan assisted electric oven, induction hob, combination oven/ microwave, dishwasher and fridge-freezer
-

bathroom & en-suites

- Villeroy and Boch sanitaryware
- Polished chrome brassware
- White low profile shower trays to ensuites, with clear glass screen
- Bespoke mirror with shelving over basin
- Below sink vanity cupboard with countertop
- Anti fog mirrors
- Chrome electric heated towel rail
- Porcelain stoneware tiling to floor and walls surrounding bath/shower
Electrical

- Home Network System with Cat 5 for Hi Fi Video, TV, Data and Audio connections
- Telephone/Home Network points to living/ dining, kitchen and bedrooms
- Mains operated smoke/heat detectors with battery
- Directional LED downlighters to all rooms with mood lighting to the living/dining room including a digital dimmer to master bedroom and low level feature lighting to the hallway
-
security

- Door entry system with audio visual colour screen
- CCTV security system to entrance lobbies and external areas
- Fully hardwired alarm system to ground floor apartments only
- Fused spur for future alarm system installation by owner.
Heating

- Underfloor heating throughout
- Chrome towel rails to bathrooms and en suites
Flooring

- Porcelain stoneware tiling to wet areas
- Engineered flooring to remaining areas to
hallway, living/dining and kitchen
- Carpet to bedrooms

Bike Storage
A secure communal bike storage room is located on the ground floor.
Whichever space you select you'll enjoy Kingston living on your doorstep.

The apartment benefits from a private first floor lobby and offers privacy.
Bonus

Residential discounts are offered in the neighbouring hotel restaurant and bar.
Video Viewings:

detailedDescription: A spacious, two double bedroom garden floor conversion apartment with direct access to private garden. The many benefits include a large reception room with sitting and dining space a period fireplace and direct access to the garden. A separate fitted kitchen with a window to the front. The apartment has it's own front door leading to a welcoming entrance hallway with a large utility/storage cupboard. A private enclosed garden to the rear with a secluded patio area. Sold with a Share of the Freehold a lease in excess of 900 years and no onward chain.

detailedDescription:
Rarely available one bedroom semi detached house with no on going chain and is situated in the delightful Barwell Farm area with surrounding livery, equestrian centre and open fields. The property is located in the delightful Barwell Farm area with surrounding livery, equestrian facilities and fields. Entering the property there are stairs leading to the first floor landing which gives access to the fitted kitchen, double bedroom, lounge and bathroom. There are double glazed windows and the gas central heating and off street parking. There is also a covered area that provides further parking/storage on the ground floor that could be converted to a further room(planning permission may be required). The property is situated near the Surrey towns of Claygate, Chessington and Epsom. There is a mainline train station nearby that provides direct access to London Waterloo in under 40 minutes and the property itself is nestled away off Barwell Lane. Nearby there are stable blocks offering all levels of livery and equestrian facilities including schools - a huge attraction for any equestrian enthusiast and with easy access to A3 and M25.

detailedDescription:

detailedDescription:
This brilliantly bright and spacious 3-bed, 2-bath apartment of 953sqft is situated in Lyon’s House with lift access. Part of the Newlands House development, these brand-new homes have been designed to reflect the historic Victorian architecture that encapsulates this part of Surbiton. Comprising of one, two and three-bedroom apartments this fully private residential development is nestled within the Oakhill Conservation Area.

Description:
This brilliantly bright and spacious 3-bed, 2-bath apartment of 953sqft is situated in Lyon’s House with lift access. Part of the Newlands House development, these brand-new homes have been designed to reflect the historic Victorian architecture that encapsulates this part of Surbiton. Comprising of one, two and three-bedroom apartments this fully private residential development is nestled within the Oakhill Conservation Area.

Stone Real Estate are proud to present, Newlands House inhibits the restoration and conversion of No.3 Oakhill (Newlands House) and the erection of three new residential blocks. Residents at Newlands House will benefit from beautiful, landscaped grounds and high specification new homes.

Each 3-bedroom apartment at Newlands House boasts spacious internal accommodation (between 953 - 1259 square feet) and includes key amenities such as:
* High specification throughout
* Lift and ramp access
* Off-street parking available
* Family bathroom and en-suite shower room
* Bespoke Italian designed kitchens
* High-speed WiFi
* Many apartments offer private outdoor space
* Close to shops, bars, restaurants, leisure facilities and the River Thames

The location of Newlands House boasts excellent transport links and is situated within 300 metres of Surbiton Mainline station. With regular trains (10 per hour) to London Waterloo (20 mins) and Clapham Junction (10 mins), Surbiton station also connects residents’ to the South East and South Coast (Woking, Reading, Basingstoke, Portsmouth, Southampton).

Newlands House is situated approximately 800 metres from local bus routes provided on Ewell Road and Victoria Road providing easy access to Kingston, Twickenham and Ealing Broadway and is just a six minute walk to the river Thames!
Surbiton station has been identified as a Crossrail 2 station. If approved, Crossrail would provide direct access to Victoria, Tottenham Court Road, Euston, and Kings Cross.

address: Wentworth Court, Waterside Close, Surbiton KT6
detailedDescription:
The property comprises a spacious kitchen, a double bedroom with built in storage space, a bathroom, a hallway storage cupboard and a reception/dining room with French doors opening onto a private patio area and communal gardens with lawn and mature fruit trees. Private car park with allocated parking.

Situation
If you are looking for outdoor space in which to relax, look no further. Wentworth Court, having been built in a former orchard, is in a pleasantly secluded location. Near the Hook Road, the location provides convenient access to both Kingston and Surbiton town centres with their array of shops, restaurants and transport links. Surbiton station is just 1.3 miles away with a fast service to London Waterloo. Additionally the A3, M3, M25 and, consequently, Heathrow and Gatwick are easily reachable.

Additional Information
The lease was granted in 1992 for 125 years.

The seller informs us that the service and maintenance charges amount to approximately £1,260.00 per year and the ground rent amounts to approximately £200.00 per year.

Location

Maple Road is perfectly positioned to take advantage of all the excellent amenities that Surbiton has to offer, as well as hosting a monthly Farmer's Market.

An excellent range of bars, restaurants, cafes and The River Thames are all just a 5 minute walk away.

detailedDescription: Welcome to Cottage Grove. This charming three bedroom semi-detached cottage, is nestled away down a quiet residential road in the heart of Surbiton, moments away from Surbiton mainline station and the picturesque River Thames. To the ground of this stunning property you will find a welcoming entrance hall, storage, kitchen with breakfast bar and ample worktop space and cupboards, an incredibly bright and spacious bay fronted open-plan living/dining room, family bathroom with separate W.C. To the rear of the property there is a secluded low maintenance garden with side access, an out-house with electricity and a shower room, perfect to use as an office. The first floor has three great sized bedrooms with an impressive main bedroom. To fully appreciate this beautiful home, a viewing is highly recommended.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on the 2nd floor and situated at the rear of the development with views over New Malden is this delightful one bedroom apartment within the popular Kingston Lodge development. This flat has been well loved and modernised by the current owner resulting in a modern walk in shower room and kitchen (with a window) being installed.
The apartment is in good decorative order throughout and benefits from a large bay window in the living room allowing an abundance of natural light to flow through the flat making this truly a wonderful place to be.

Kingston Lodge is set back from the main road with well-tended communal gardens at the front and rear, this development was built in 1988 and is made up of 36 apartments in 2 blocks, with 2 semi-detached bungalows to the rear. The apartment blocks are set over 4 floors all with lift access. The development also benefits from a resident house manager, residents lounge, laundry facilities and resident and guest parking. As with many retirement complexes, there are optional social activities should any resident wish to participate.

Set within the urban area of New Malden with an excellent variety of local shops nearby, residents are well served by the many local public transport links to and from the city. For those who drive, the A3 to London is also within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
Laurels are delighted to present to the market this stunning two bedroom upper floor apartment. The property is located within a short walk to multiple transport links, local outstanding schools, and a plethora of local amenities.

As you enter the property you are greeted by a large landing that has a built in home office, as well as allowing access to all rooms around the property. The property is equipped with a lovely modern kitchen that has all the integrated appliances that anyone requires. The kitchen allows access on to a terrace that leads into the communal gardens below. Both bedrooms are spacious in size and both fit a double bed with ease, the main bedroom has the added bonus of fitted wardrobes. The spacious living area of the property has the bonus of being able to be closed off from the rest of the home if needed. The chic family bathroom of the property has been fitted out with a shower over the bath as well as housing the toilet. The property benefits from having access to the loft as well as have a garden shed for added storage.

Further benefits of the property include its location to local amenities, local outstanding primary and secondary schools, ample storage throughout. The property is not something that is available everyday viewings are highly recommended.
