detailedDescription:
This impressive modern residence has been subject to a comprehensive programme of refurbishment and extension in recent years, using high quality materials, fixtures and fittings and now provides a super home equipped with all modern conveniences, ideal for a combination of family life and entertaining. The spacious and well-planned accommodation provides 3 reception rooms, 5 double bedrooms, and 4 bathrooms providing almost 3,000 sq. Ft (267 sq. M), of useable living space, arranged over three floors, ideal for both day-to-day family life and entertaining.

Please see our virtual 3d tour of this property.



The property consists of a front drive with parking for 4 cars, impressive reception hall leading to the principal reception rooms located at the rear of the property, which has been recently completed to form a stunning open plan living, dining room and fully integrated Island Kitchen covering a total area of 72 sq. M. The living room is partially separated from the dining area and kitchen by a smart real effect, glass sided gas fire, giving warmth and ambiance. The rooms have been fitted for wall mounted TVs, ceiling speakers and surround sound. There are floor to ceiling, slim line, uv tinted sliding patio doors with electronic blinds for privacy, two large square skylights at the rear of the living and dining rooms, and 4 large side skylights running down the right hand/west side of the property, bringing in plenty of natural light into the ground floor.

The fully integrated Island Kitchen has smart matt blue units and quartz worktops, neff appliances, including double oven and microwave, dishwasher, full-size fridge, and a separate full-size freezer. The induction hob is located on the central island, with breakfast bar seating.

To the rear of the kitchen is separate room currently used as a home office or alternatively it could be used as a utility room, with quartz worktop, pocket doors and side aspect skylight. This flows into the front reception or music room with bay window and side aspect skylight. There is one final front reception room which is currently used as the utility area, but this could easily be converted into a ground floor ensuite bedroom. Finally, there is a separate ground floor wc.

The ground floor has beautiful large ceramic 1mtr square floor tiles, underfloor, zoned heating, and pocket doors, allowing a natural open plan flow, all the way around the ground floor, which can be closed off for privacy.

On the first floor there are 4 good-sized double bedrooms, one has an ensuite shower room and another has a built-in sink unit, there is also a full-sized, fully tiled, family bathroom with double ended bath and shower over bath with folding side screen.

The stairs to the loft space are open tread, solid wood, with double floor height-stained glass side wall window, and ceiling skylight, which can be opened for ventilation. The loft really is an impressive master ensuite bedroom, it is open plan with just one door leading to the ensuite fully tiled shower room. There are two Dorma windows at the front and one oversized Dorma at the rear with window seat with external flower tray and iron railings, and Velux windows set on either side, at the rear is a large wardrobe space, which doubles up as a home gym. The loft has high ceilings, laminate flooring, underfloor heating, and gives a tremendous feeling of space and light and unobscured views down towards the South Downs.

The property has been beautifully finished throughout, with 1-metre square tiled flooring on the ground floor and laminate flooring in the loft both with underfloor heating gas boiler and mega flow pressurised hot water system, it has beautiful stair and hall carpets leading to the first-floor bedrooms.

To the rear of the house is a south facing rear garden, laid mainly to lawn but with a sizeable, raised grp deck area ideal for outdoor living and in addition providing plenty of under deck storage, there is also a good-sized rear garden shed, and side gate access on the east side.

The property has been owned by only two families since being built in 1955, the original owners built the house and lived in it until 1999 when the current owners purchased the property. Having really loved living here for 22 years and with children now at University they are now ready move away from this outstanding school and living location.

Location

Coombe Lane West is conveniently located close to Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities. The A3 offering fast access to central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 is also close at hand.

The nearest train station at Norbiton is just a short walk along Coombe Lane West. This provides frequent services to London Waterloo and Vauxhall (approximately 20 to 25 minutes) with their underground links to points throughout the city. The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses and tennis and squash clubs.

Richmond Park, the largest of the capital’s eight Royal Parks at 2,368 acres of natural beauty, is close by and provides a picturesque setting to watch the abundant wildlife, or to take long walks, cycle or horse rides.

Theatres at Wimbledon and Richmond are popular with local residents, with many a new production debuting here before launching in the West End and both also have an excellent choice of restaurants. There are numerous private, state, and International schools for all ages within the immediate vicinity, including Coombe Hill Infant and Junior School, Coombe Girls and Boys, Rokeby School for boys, Holy Cross Prep School for girls, Marymount International, Kings College School as well as Kingston Grammar, Tiffin Boys and Girls Schools, most within walking distance or short bus/car journey.

Viewing is strictly by appointment through Greenwoods Residential Sales & Lettings

Important Information

The property is owned by a member of staff at Greenwoods Residential, who are selling the house using Greenwoods Residential Sales

Measurements, areas, and distances are approximate

Floor plans and photographs are for guidance purposes only and must not be relied upon for any purpose. All appliances listed in these details are only ‘as seen’ and have not been tested by Greenwoods Residential, nor have we sought certification of warranty or service, unless otherwise stated. These details are offered on the understanding that all negotiations are made through this company. Neither these, nor verbal representations, form part of any offer or contract, and their accuracy cannot be guaranteed.

Offer Procedure

Greenwoods Residential is contracted by the seller to establish how anyone who wishes to make an offer on this property intends to fund its purchase and their buying status. When making an offer on this property, you will be asked a series of questions relating to how you intend to buy the property and whether your offer is dependent on the sale of another property. This information, along with the amount of your offer, will then be forwarded onto our client for consideration. All offers on this property should be made through this office.

address: High Street, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription: Exceptional £/sq ft value - A very well presented, self contained, "duplex" apartment (with a private roof terrace) offering some 1400 sq ft of accommodation (gross internal area). So, bigger than many 3 or even 4 bed family houses - and twice the size of most 2 bed cottages! Both a 3D and a standard floor plan attached. At the asking price of £550,000, this equates to a £ per sq ft rate of just £392 / sq ft - exceptionally good value, in our view. The apartment has its own front door at ground level, with stairs then leading up to the first & second floors of this handsome, period building, with elevated views looking down Hampton Wick High Street, from the large picture window - a feature of the large "L" shaped open plan Kitchen / Living / Dining room at 1st floor level. A door from the Kitchen / Breakfast room leads onto a secluded, private roof terrace (16'9"x 12'8"). There is a WC / Cloakroom off the 1st floor landing. On the top floor is a large, rear aspect Master Bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a family bathroom and a 2nd / Guest Bedroom with study area and an en suite shower room. All in all a very spacious apartment (with lots of cubic volume as well as simply lots of actual floor space) ideal for those wanting a Hampton Wick base for entertaining, etc., and also with the ability to "lock up and leave", for those with second homes, etc. Excellent, central location, close to all transport links, Kingston town centre, the River Thames and Royal Bushy and Home Parks. Sole Agents. Viewing highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Accommodation comprises:

Covered porch leading to entrance hall | drawing room | dining room | kitchen/breakfast room| utility room | guest cloakroom | principal bedroom, with en suite shower room | six further bedrooms, one with en suite shower room | family bathroom | family shower room | annexe with separate entrance comprising: Ground floor living/garden room | ground floor bedroom with en suite shower | first floor living/dining room with french doors to balcony | fully fitted kitchen | additional shower room

amenities include:

Set in half acre grounds, with 22M river frontage | ample original period features | 3M ceilings to the ground floor reception rooms and entrance hall | integral single garage and carriage driveway | incredible views of the river thames | self-contained annexe suitable for home office<br/><br/>Outside

Integral Garage and sweeping carriage driveway

Rear Garden: Large, open, mature East facing garden with protected Yews and further, partial Walled South facing garden which used to be a Tennis Court. Raised beds, shrubs, perennials and lawn. Feature wall partioning the two gardens.<br/><br/>location<br/><br/>Lower Ham Road lies in the Riverside North Conservation Area, Thames-side Strategic Area of Special Character and Thames Policy Area. The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities, having Canbury Park Gardens close by with its public and private tennis courts and the Albany Park Canoe and Sailing Centre, towpath alongside the River Thames allowing easy walking distance to Kingston town centre with its abundance of shops and riverside restaurants and the Rose Theatre, are popular alternatives to the West End.

Additionally, Richmond and Wimbledon are close by with an excellent choice of designer boutiques, shops and restaurants. The Roehampton Club and David Lloyd leisure centre are nearby as is the All England Lawn Tennis Club. For keen golfers there is Richmond Golf Club, Coombe Hill, Coombe Wood and The Royal Wimbledon courses.

There is horse racing at Sandown, Kempton, Ascot and Windsor. The Royal Richmond Park, an area of outstanding beauty, is also nearby with Ham and Kingston Gates. Here one can enjoy the picturesque setting, go horse riding, jogging or just take a leisurely walk. The area is a favourable to new families seeking to secure a home close to the wealth of schools which surround the house and also being within close proximity to Kingston British Rail station offering fast access into London.<br/><br/>Opportunity to reinstate the private mooring across the road.

Description

Located close to Berrylands train station and within a short distance to Surbiton centre, this two double bedroom maisonette offers spacious and well presented accommodation throughout.
Positioned on the first floor of this small development, the apartment has an L shaped hallway that leads to all rooms within the property. The property further features ample built in storage throughout and a private garden extending to almost 50 feet.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A beautifully presented four bedroom family home located in a sought after residential area!

Description
At the front of the property is a bright and spacious reception room with feature bay window and double doors leading into the extended kitchen/breakfast room with bi fold doors leading out onto the rear garden. The kitchen area has been refurbished to the highest standard and offers the perfect space for any family. There is also a downstairs cloakroom. Upstairs comprises a family bathroom and three bedrooms, whilst the top floor occupies a further bedroom. The property is completed with a driveway providing ample off-street parking.

Set on Waverley Avenue the property is conveniently located for access to Kingston and Surbiton town centres with their array of shops, restaurants and transport links. address: Latchmere Lane, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Just a short walk from beautiful Richmond Park, this well presented three bedroom extended terraced family home with off street parking and low maintenance private garden. The property has been well maintained by the current owner, boasting a large rear aspect extended reception room, stylish well equipped recently updated kitchen, and shower rooms to both ground and first floors. Features include gas central heating, double glazing and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs rising to the first floor and access to a modern shower room, leading into the bright and spacious extended reception room with ample space for relaxing, entertaining and dining, and door leading out to the rear onto the raised patio area and garden beyond. The separate kitchen, with window to the front, comprises a recently updated range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances. To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles and a further single, all with inbuilt storage - plus a further modern shower room.

The property is enviably located within easy access of local shops, as well as the heart of Kingston with it's huge array of shops, bars, cafes, restaurants and leisure facilities, including cinema complex. There are a variety of bus routes nearby with connections to railway stations at Norbiton, Kingston and Hampton Wick, and access to stunning open spaces including Richmond Park and Bushy Park.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

address: Birkenhead Avenue, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A stunning two double bedroom apartment located in the popular Norbiton Hall development in the heart of Kingston.

Description

Cavender are pleased to present this impeccably presented two double bedroom first floor apartment with a floor space of over 800sqft. The property resides within the prestigious Norbiton Hall development, awarded Building of Townscape status due to its character and historic significance to Kingston. The property itself is notably high spec. The light and airy aspect compliments perfectly, the chic interiors and elegant finish. The accommodation includes a welcoming spacious hallway, well equipped kitchen, stylishly sleek bathroom, a vast living room & two good size double bedrooms. In terms of the finish, you will see distinguishing features such as durable hardwood flooring, matching wall and base units in the kitchen as well as gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below. Dual windows allow natural light to flood into the relaxing living room. High ceilings, an abundance of inbuilt storage in all the room which includes a pantry in the kitchen, gas central heating and double glazing. The apartment further benefits from two parking spaces plus further guest parking, optional paid garage parking, secure bike storage, 24/7 onsite porter and a long lease of 174 years.

Location:
The property is perfectly nestled in the heart of Kingston. Within just a short walk of the centre of Kingston you will have easy access to numerous shops, bars, cafes, restaurants, theatre, leisure facilities and cinema complex. Both Norbiton (Zone 5) and Kingston (Zone 6) stations are also within a short walk for excellent rail services into Central London (Waterloo station in under 30 minutes) and to the surrounding area. Additionally, the area is well served by amenities including a David Lloyd Centre/Gym and leisure centre, as well as outstanding local schools / nurseries. Richmond Park, Bushy Park and Home Park are within a short walk, and the banks of the Thames offer a variety of lovely bars and restaurants along the riverfront.

Falconry Court is situated on Fairfield South and directly opposite the open green space of Fairfield Recreation Ground. It is within 0.6 miles (11 minute walk) of Kingston's Zone 6 railway station, which offers a frequent connection, in two directions, to London terminals. The town centre itself is even closer whilst the River Thames including its inviting riverside restaurants is also conveniently located. Other local amenities include the Kingfisher Leisure centre whilst the property falls within the catchment for well regarded state and independent schools.<br /><br />

address: Woodview, Warren Road, Kingston Upon Thames, London, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
An impressive detached house on one of the most prestigious roads on the Coombe estate in Kingston upon Thames. This private road is home to some of the finest houses in the county, and Woodview is one of its most spectacular, finished to the highest standard and spanning over 8500 sq ft.

The property benefits from a secluded landscaped garden, a garage and a large gated forecourt providing off-street parking for multiple vehicles. Inside the property, a home automation system remotely controls a variety of amenities including Heatmiser underfloor heating, air conditioning, a Lutron lighting system, Villavent air recovery system and a Texacon alarm system. The property also features an 8-person Stannah lift which services all four floors, a 16-zone surround-sound music system, and a full CCTV system with remote monitoring.

The ground floor of this double-fronted property is centred around an expansive central hallway, which features a grand staircase and the passenger lift. Double doors lead from the hallway into a huge bespoke fully fitted kitchen and breakfast room, which connects to a smart separate dining room and a bright conservatory which looks out into the garden. The hallway also offers access to the rest of the accommodation on this level, which consists of a drawing room with a large bay window, separate family room, cloakroom and a cosy study.

An annexe on this level - which has its own separate entrance - leads to a staff flat on the lower ground floor, which consists of a large double bedroom, shower room and a kitchenette.

The rest of the lower ground floor hosts an impressive array of leisure facilities, including a games room complete with its own bar, a cinema room with a 9-foot 4K screen, a home gymnasium, and a spa area which includes a Jacuzzi, sauna, steam room and a treatment room.

The first floor hosts the master suite, which consists of a generously-proportioned double bedroom, a dressing room with built-in wardrobes, a four-piece en suite bathroom with twin sinks, and a balcony overlooking the garden. Three additional double bedrooms are located on this level, all of which feature their own en suite bathrooms and two of which have access to balconies with views over the garden.

Two further double bedrooms are located on the top floor, alongside a large four-piece family bathroom. This level also offers access to extensive eaves storage, and features skylights which flood the bedrooms with natural light.

Woodview is located on Warren Road, one of the most prestigious roads on the Coombe Estate in Kingston upon Thames. This private road leads directly to the gates of Richmond Park at its north end, and its tree-lined wide pavements provide a countryside feel, enhanced by the presence of no less than five golf courses in the immediate area. A range of transport routes connect this tranquil area with the rest of London. Norbiton and New Malden stations are within walking distance and provide direct access to Waterloo, and the A3 which passes near to the property links with the M25 to offer access to both Heathrow and Gatwick.

Located between Kingston and Wimbledon town centres, residents are able to access an outstanding selection of shopping facilities in both locations, alongside restaurants, cafes and amenities including banks, post offices, and pharmacies. Theatres in Wimbledon and Richmond offer alternatives to the West End, and the plethora of local parks provide a picturesque backdrop for picnicking, walking and cycling.

Several highly-regarded schools are also in the immediate vicinity of the property, including Rokeby School for boys, Holy Cross Preparatory School and Marymount International school for girls, as well as Coombe Hill Infant and Junior Schools. Kingston Grammar School, Tiffin School and Corpus Christi Roman Catholic Primary School are slightly further afield but still within easy reach of Woodview.

detailedDescription:
Summary
**guide price £280,000 - £300,000**
Beautifully presented one double bedroom ground floor apartment positioned to the rear of this popular development.

Description
Yew Tree Lodge is located in a desirable residential area within 0.8 miles of Surbiton main line station.

Surbiton station provides an excellent service to London Waterloo non-stop with a minimum journey of 17 minutes, in addition to stopping at Wimbledon and Clapham Junction providing further connections. On those colder mornings there is a bus stop immediately outside the building taking you into Surbiton Town Centre.

The property benefits from a spacious hallway, and generous rooms throughout. The lounge boasts a window to the rear overlooking the well maintained communal gardens and is open plan with the comprehensively fitted kitchen, complete with two storage cupboard and a pull up table. The bedroom is also positioned to the rear and is beautifully presented. Further features to note include a bathroom with white suite, residents and visitors parking and an unexpired lease term of approximately 96 years.

Surbiton has grown to become a favourite destination for a well-connected lifestyle, with a vibrancy and vitality that's hard to match.

We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch. Please note additional fees could be incurred for items such as leasehold packs.

detailedDescription:
An excellent, spacious well presented two bedroom upper ground floor conversion apartment set in a grand Victorian house. Located on one of Surbiton's highly regarded tree lined river roads within walking distance of the mainline station, high street and Thames is at the end of the road. The many benefits include a large living space with tall grand ceilings a walk in sash bay window, exposed brick fireplace and bespoke alcove shelving. An open plan fitted kitchen with a built in oven, hob and hood and a large sociable dining bar. The master bedroom also has tall ceilings a bay window and fitted wardrobes. The good size second bedroom has a large storage mezzanine area. There is a sumptuous new bathroom suite including a separate shower. A welcoming entrance hallway with a utility cupboard. Gas central heating. Well maintained communal areas and a courtyard style, landscaped communal garden. Sold with a Share of the Freehold and a lease in excess of 900 years.

detailedDescription:
**no chain** A stunning two double bedroom split level apartment, with mezzanine floor (Potential third bedroom) in a converted Church. Offered to the market with no chain, this fantastically unique property is not to be missed. Only a six minute walk to Surbiton Station.

Description

Cavender is delighted to present to KT6 Surbiton, an Outstanding Two Double Bedroom Split Level Apartment, with mezzanine floor (Potential third bedroom) in a converted Church. Offered to the market with no chain, this fantastically unique property is not to be missed.

This incredibly stunning 2 double bedroom 1000 sq. Ft Church Conversion boasts private off-street parking and secure double front door access with newly carpeted stairs leading to the first floor bedrooms and bathrooms. The Master bedroom with built-in wardrobes benefits from En-suite featuring modern three piece bathroom suite. The second bedroom, also with spacious built in wardrobes centers around a floor to ceiling arched window and benefits from daytime sunshine. The family bathroom is also located on this floor with full sized bath as well as hand held shower.

On the second floor you have the reception and dining area with Velux windows throughout. The space has modern open plan living with high pitched ceilings as per the original church building. The kitchen is modern and fully fitted with ample worktop space and large Velux windows. The Living area is bright, spacious and excellent for hosting and entertaining. Stairs from the living area take you to a mezzanine floor which is large enough to double as a quirky third bedroom however is currently being used as an office.

The versatility of this property is perfect for first time buyers, investors and landlords. Situated on Maple Road, a stones throw from Surbiton Main Line Railway Station with direct fast trains to London Waterloo (17 mins) and stopping trains to Clapham Junction (10 mins).

Maple Road is a beautiful tree-lined street that plays host to a fabulous selection of restaurants, bars and specialist retailers including a monthly farmers market. The Thames promenade: Just around the corner, creates a perfect walk directly into Kingston town center. Viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription: A four double bedroom detached house built by 'Wimpey' homes on the popular 'Celebration Park' development. The accommodation comprises 18'2 x 12' living room, 12' x 8'11 dining room, 20'8 x 11'2 kitchen breakfast room, 9'4 x 8'10 study, utility room and downstairs toilet. Further benefits include two en-suite shower rooms to bedrooms 1 and 2, family bathroom, double glazing, gas central heating, double garage to the front with further parking and a South facing rear garden. In our opinion this is a spacious well maintained family home and is within walking distance of buses, shops, schools and Chessington South train station. Viewings highly recommended.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide price £1,170,000 - £1,200,000. A unique opportunity to acquire this seven-bedroom Victorian home situated on a highly sought-after road in Surbiton. This stunning home is absolutely bursting with character and has been incredibly well-maintained by the current owners. This rarely available property is perfectly positioned within a short distance of Surbiton Mainline Station, town centre, the wonderful River Thames plus outstanding schools, universities and colleges.

The ground floor comprises entrance hall, a vast sitting room with a beautiful bay window and feature fireplace, a modern kitchen with integrated appliances and high gloss glass tiling throughout, a separate dining room, with restored cornice work, fully tiled bathroom with jacuzzi bath and finally a lovely conservatory, with underfloor heating, which sits perfectly to take advantage of the stunning garden. The first floor comprises a sizeable master bedroom with grand bay window and walk in wardrobe that could be converted into an en-suite bathroom, two further double bedrooms with lovely views of St. Matthew’s Church and a fully tiled family bathroom and spacious landing, ideal for a study area.

Similarly, on the second floor, two double bedrooms share the same scenic views. Finally, a further double bedroom with Velux windows, a fully boarded loft with potential to extend (STPP) and an artist’s studio that has previously been used as another double bedroom completes the property upstairs.

Further benefits include driveway with off-street parking for several cars, ample storage throughout, a beautiful garden with spacious outbuildings fully insulated and with mains electricity. The area is very popular with families largely due to the fantastic transport links and superb education options which include Shrewsbury House, Surbiton High School, Thames Ditton Infants, The Tiffin School, Tiffin Girl's School, Weston Green and Kingston Grammar School. Further to this, transport links for the property are incredible with the mainline station at Surbiton just 0.7 miles from the property and provides a regular and direct rail service to London Waterloo, with journey times of as little as 17 minutes. Central London can be easily accessed via the A3 and this also means that both Heathrow and Gatwick airports are within 35-minute drive.

detailedDescription:
Newlands House is a stunning brand new build development comprising 41 units offering well designed and beautifully finished one, two and three-bedroom flats, nestled within Surbiton's lovely Oakhill Conservation Area. The location provides a peaceful residential setting whilst also benefitting from close proximity to Surbiton Station (walking distance four minutes), an excellent choice of shops, supermarkets, bars and restaurants and with easy access to the River Thames and the popular historic town of Kingston Upon Thames. The property itself has been positioned to allow its residents to enjoy an important urban/rural balance and has been designed to reflect the historic Victorian architecture of this part of Surbiton. Leasehold length: 250 years, Ground Rent 0.05% of the purchase price of the property, Service Charges £2.50 per square foot per annum. detailedDescription:
Description

One Bedroom Apartment for Sale. No Onward Chain.

Located in the leafy area of Raynes Park is this airy and very well looked after modern one bedroom apartment for sale with neutral decor, open plan living space with dual aspect views and a large private balcony overlooking lots of greenery, in a cul-de-sac development. The apartment comes with allocated private parking and a healthy lease. It is conveniently located close to plenty of shops and amenties such as the bank, post office, newsagent, range of bars, pub, restaurants and Cafes. It also has good transport links and connections to Motspur Park, Raynes Park station for fast commute into Central London/London Waterloo.

The St. Catherine's close development built in 2011 by Bewley homes, benefits from beautifully landscaped communal gardens and a secure video entry phone system. This property would make an ideal purchase for first time buyers or alternative make a good buy as an investment property.

The apartment is located in close proximity less than 0.6miles to alot of good primary schools, St. John Fisher rc Primary School, Sacred Heart Catholic Primary School and Hatfield Primary School.

There are extensive leisure activities in the area including the David Lloyd Leisure Park, Malden Golf Club, a number of parks including Cottenham Park Reacreation Ground, Raynes Park Sports Ground and Cannon Hill Common, Raynes Park Resident's Lawn Tennis Club.

EPC rating B

detailedDescription:
Situated very conveniently for local shops, transport links and popular Schools is this three bedroom Victorian semi detached house. The property features a spacious lounge dining room, fitted kitchen with a separate utility and cloakroom wc. There is a large master bedroom, two further bedrooms and family bathroom suite. title: 1 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly outstanding family home with an abundance of charm and character, with some parts dating back to the 17th century with later Victorian additions. This spacious family home is beautifully presented and offers versatile accommodation with four reception rooms, plus a study allowing ample room for entertaining and for those working from home. All six bedrooms are located on the first floor, with three bathrooms. The house has retained a wealth of period features such as original beams and cornicing to the ceilings, shutters to the windows, wooden floors and cosy, inviting fire-places. The wrap around garden provides an ample lawn area for children to play as well as paved terrace areas to sit and relax in. Additionally there is a garage and off street parking for several cars.

Accommodation Comprises:
Large Entrance Hall | Drawing Room | Dining Room | Sitting Room | Snug | Study | Kitchen/Breakfast Room | Utility Room | Cloakroom | Principal Bedroom with en-suite Bathroom | Five further Bedrooms | Two further Bathrooms (one en-suite) |

Amenities Include:
Full gas fired central heating and hot water | Double Garage | Forecourt parking for several cars | Well tended gardens | A Plethora of Original Period Features |<br/><br/>location<br/><br/>Kingston Hill is conveniently located close to Kingston and Wimbledon town centres with their excellent shopping facilities. The A3 offers fast access to central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 is also close at hand. The nearest train station is Norbiton, a 15 minute walk which provides frequent services to London Waterloo (approximately 25-30 minutes) and Vauxhall with their underground links throughout the city.
The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses and tennis and squash clubs. Richmond Park, the largest of the capital’s eight Royal Parks at 2,368 acres of natural beauty, is close by and provides a picturesque setting in which to picnic, go horse riding, cycling, jogging, or just to take a leisurely walk. Theatres at Wimbledon, Richmond and Kingston are popular with residents, with many a new production debuting here before launching in the West End and all also have an excellent choice of restaurants.
There are numerous private, state and International schools for all ages within the immediate vicinity, including Coombe Hill Infants and Junior School, Rokeby School for boys, Holy Cross Prep School for girls, Marymount International. King’s College Wimbledon, Kingston Grammar for boys and Wimbledon High School for girls are also close by.

detailedDescription:
Requiring modernisation, the property offers significant potential and an ideal project opportunity to extend into the loft and on the ground as well as first floor to the rear. A detached Victorian villa with basement, off street parking for two cars presenting exciting scope to add value.
The property

A detached Victorian villa with basement, off street parking for two cars presenting an ideal project. Requiring modernisation, the property offers significant potential to extend both into the loft and on the ground floor to the rear. The ground floor comprises a reception to the front as well as separate reception to the rear, both with feature fireplaces, a fitted kitchen and separate family room as well as bathroom. The first floor offers three bedrooms of varying size, the largest of which spans the width of the house as well as W.C. A basement level offers excellent storage currently as well as enormous potential to convert, along with the loft as well, and in addition to a ground floor extension to the rear (all subject to the necessary planning permission). A private garden is offered to the rear as well as side access.
The location

Kings Road is situated in the heart of North Kingston and situated conveniently for both Richmond Park's Kingston Gate and the River Thames. It falls within the catchment for a number of incredibly well-regarded local state and independent schools, whilst other amenities such as Albany Park Canoe & Sailing Centre and Canbury Gardens Tennis Centre are close by. Kingston's Zone 6 railway station provides a frequent service into London terminals, offering up to nine trains an hour in two directions, and is within 0.4 miles (7 minute walk).<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A recently refurbished and beautifully presented two double bedroom house located close to Surbiton station and within catchment of sought after local schools.

Description

Positioned in a popular residential location within the catchment of sought after schools, this stunning two bedroom house offers modern and well presented accommodation throughout.

On the ground floor, the accommodation comprises an entrance hall leading to a large lounge which overlooks the rear garden, a high specification recently fitted kitchen and a dining room.

On the first floor, the property comprises a large master bedroom, a further double bedroom with built in wardrobes, a modern bathroom with shower and a separate WC.

The property boasts wood flooring throughout the ground floor, gas central heating and has been finished to an excellent standard throughout.

Further features include a private rear garden and the property is conveniently positioned for local shops, bus routes and amenities.

address: Queenshurst Square, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
A luxurious two bedroom apartment situated on the second floor of this newly built development by Berkeley Homes offers ample living accommodation approaching 800sqft. This stunning property is finished to the highest of quality and includes a fantastic master bedroom with en-suite, an additional double bedroom, separate utility area, modern bathroom, spacious reception room with open plan fully fitted kitchen and a large balcony which overlook the immaculate communal gardens. Further benefits include private underground parking, a residents gym, cinema room, full use of the communal gardens and a 24 hours concierge. Viewings are highly recommended!

Queenshurst is a new residential development and is one of the more sought after locations in North Kingston. The development is conveniently positioned for Canbury Gardens and the River Thames with Kingston town centre, station and Richmond Park a short distance away. The standard of schooling in the immediate area is excellent for both private and state sectors and the area has an extensive range of leisure facilities including golf courses, tennis clubs, sailing, riding schools and private & public health clubs.

detailedDescription:
Property Description

Chancellors are delighted to offer this spacious and bright first floor 2 double bedroom purpose built flat to the market.

Property Details

This home benefits from a newly fitted kitchen and has recently been decorated throughout, including new carpets. The flat has large storage cupboards. This property further benefits from a spacious living room and allocated off street parking. Other features include an entry phone system and a small maintained communal garden.

It is within walking distance to Surbiton and Tolworth train stations. There are a good range of shops, pubs and restaurants within walking distance. The property is offered with share of freehold, with a dedicated building management company. Oakleigh Court is positioned in a sought after area which is within a 25 minute walk or 5 minute bus journey to Surbiton town centre and mainline station with fast train links to London waterloo which take just 17 minutes. There is a bus stop (2 minutes away) which offers very frequent access to Surbiton and Kingston town centre with its bustling shopping area, popular riverside bars and restaurants, as well as a daily farmers market. There is very easy access to the A3 which provides road transport links towards central London and the M25. There are several Good/Outstanding schools locally.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

address: Borough Road, Kingston Upon Thames KT2
detailedDescription:
Kingston-upon-Thames is where London and Surrey merge effortlessly into one.

This leafy and affluent town is gently nestled between Richmond Park and the River Thames.

It has a hugely popular, vibrant and historic town centre with a great shopping centre and cosmopolitan restaurants.

We are pleased to announce this exciting new development, situated in the heart of fashionable North Kingston, consisting of 11 elegant houses and 3 luxury apartments.

These delightful new dwellings are thoughtfully designed to sympathetically reflect the existing character homes that surround them. The development is located in an excellent area for young families and surrounded by outstanding schools.

These include, within walking distance: Alexandra Infants, St Pauls C of E, St Agatha's Primary, St Luke's Primary and Latchmere Infant & Junior Schools.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A well-proportioned three bedroom first floor purpose built flat positioned in a popular development within approximately 0.8 miles of Surbiton town centre and mainline station.

Description
The accommodation includes a dual aspect reception room with large bay window, two double bedrooms, plus a further single bedroom / study. There is a fitted kitchen/breakfast room and a bathroom combined WC with white suite. Other features include double glazing, entry phone system and maintained communal lawned gardens. There is also an additional locked storage cupboard at the entrance to the property.

The accommodation has benefitted from extensive renovation in 2018 which includes: Neutral decoration throughout, new carpets in bedrooms, and a new combi-boiler. The property would suit those looking for a bit more space and easy access to London as well as an investment buyer looking for a buy to let property. The property is offered with share of freehold, with a dedicated building management company

Warwick Court is positioned on the Hook Road which is within a 20-minute walk or 5-minute bus journey of Surbiton town centre and mainline station with fast train links to London Waterloo which take just 17 minutes. Access to the Surrey hills - an area of outstanding natural beauty - is easily accessible by both car and public transport.

From here explore a well-proportioned reception room with curved bay window, playing homage to the neighbours; a luxury Kitchen with integrated appliances space for dining table overlooking beautiful presented landscaped garden through double glazed French doors to a large patio, ideal for alfresco dinning when the weather changes.

Attractive staircase to the first floor landing off of which can be found the large first and well sized second double bedrooms served by a generous fully tiled bathroom with suite including separate shower.

Outside the care to detail has already been viewed with the impeccably presented front laid out to provide good provision of off street parking and discrete bins storage framed by newly turfed lawn. The rear, all newly fenced can be approached by side access to find a deceptively good length of lawn, with readily stocked boarders topped off by a flowering cherry.

In the sought-after Coombe side neighbourhood within ready access of New Malden’s comprehensive amenities and leisure facilities; Malden Centre, Golf Clubs, Bustling High Street, Mainline station to not only London Waterloo (25 Mins) but Surbiton and Twickenham.

detailedDescription:
Peacefully situated within a highly sought after gated development in the heart of Kingston upon Thames, this immaculately presented two double bedroom apartment is situated in a prime location for Kingston's lively shops, bars, restaurants. For those who enjoy long walks and cycling, the property sits within close proximity from London's largest royal park, Richmond Park, all whilst being minutes from public transport making the property ideal for commuters.
The property itself benefits from a bright and spacious living room which leads into the kitchen which includes features such as; integrated cooker and hob and benefits from plenty of storage. The two double bedrooms are both within easy access of the modern bathroom which includes a contemporary white suite with a shower over the bath. The apartment boasts storage in abundance, one allocated parking space and no onward chain as well as access to the residents gymnasium.
Situation:
Kingston is renowned for its excellent schools and offers a variety of excellent shopping facilities including the Bentall Centre, local supermarkets and independent stores. The area is well serviced by many bars and restaurants and perfectly positioned for Canbury Park riverside walks. The development sits around the corner from Kingston train station which offers frequent services to London Waterloo.

Hawes and Co are pleased to offer for sale this three bedroom terraced house. In need of complete modernisation this property is perfect for scope for the new buyer to put their own stamp on. The accommodation comprises large lounge/ dining room, kitchen, family bathroom and three bedrooms. Outside of the property offers rear private garden and off street parking at the front. The property is located within easy reach of Surbiton station and the high street with buses to Surbiton, Kingston and Leatherhead. Local shops and restaurants are only a short walk away, with a good selection of local schools in the area. Viewings are highly recommended.<br /><br />
<b>Important note to purchasers:</b><br/> We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription: An excellent, well presented good size one bedroom ground floor conversion apartment set in a grand detached Victoria house. Located within walking distance of Surbiton mainline station the high street and Kingston town center. The many benefits include a large living room with ample sitting and dining space, tall grand ceilings and a bay window. There is a sleek contemporary open plan kitchen with a built in oven-hob-hood and new flooring. A large double bedroom and a modern white bathroom suite with a shower over the bath. Electric heating to conventional radiators and double glazing. Recently decorated to a high standard. Sold with a 92 year lease and no onward chain.

detailedDescription:
This top floor (6th) two bedroom flat will make a good long term investment as properties on the estate are popular with renters. It is also an ideal first time buy as there is a huge regeneration scheme planned for the area over the next 8 years which will impact the local area greatly. The flat is well presented throughout and the owners are keen to sell and there is no onward chain.

Approached along an open balcony with far reaching views over Kingston.

Kitchen: Fully fitted with a range of wall and base units. Being sold with the benefit of some white goods.

Reception Room: Original parquet wood flooring restored. Small balcony to the front overlooking Cambridge Road.

Bathroom: Shower over the bath, wash hand basin and WC. Part tiled

Hall Storage: Large storage and cloaks cupboard

Bedroom 1: Double bedroom, window overlooking the front,

Bedroom 2: Double bedroom with fitted carpet and window overlooking the rear. Off street parking

Within walking distance of several good primary and secondary schools the flat offers good sized accommodation at a reasonable price.

Fully double glazed and with gas central heating off a combination boiler the flat is well presented although could benefit from a small uplift to some decorative elements. Cambrdge Gardens is a red brick ex local authority buiding which is part of the regenration scheme for the area and although the common parts may not be the most auspcious at this tmie there are plans in place to modernise and upgrade
